info.description: Oracle ERP Cloud Platform - REST APIs
info.title: Apigee Oracle ERP Cloud APIs

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
This parameter filters the resource attributes. Only the specified attributes are returned, which means that if no attributes are specified, no attributes are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource attributes. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2

parameters.name: onlyData
parameters.description: The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

parameters.name: dependency
parameters.description:
This parameter specifies dependencies which are attributes that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The attributes specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the attributes will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency attributes. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: totalResults
parameters.description: The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified attributes.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

parameters.name: finder
parameters.description:
Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • findBySourceOrderNumberAndSystem: Find a sales order according to the source transaction number and source transaction system. Finder Variables:
    • SourceTransactionNumber; string; Value that uniquely identifies the transaction number.
    • SourceTransactionSystem; string; Application that placed the request for fulfillment.
  • findByOrderedDate: Find sales orders ordered within a date range. Finder Variables:
    • FromDate; string; Date that occurs immediately after the user created the sales order.
    • ToDate; string; Date that occurs immediately before the user created the sales order.
  • findByHeaderId: Find a sales order according to the sales order header. Finder Variables:
    • HeaderId; string; Value that uniquely identifies the sales order header.
  • findByOrderKey: Find a sales order according to the source transaction system and source transaction number. Finder Variables:
    • OrderKey; string; Value that uniquely identifies the sales order. This value is derived by concatenating the value of SourceOrderSystem, a colon, and the value of SourceOrderId. For orders created through the application, the SourceOrderId is same as the HeaderId. For example, if SourceOrderSystem is LEG and SourceOrderId is R13_Sample_Order, the value of this attribute is LEG:R13_Sample_Order.
  • findByOrderNumber: Find a sales order according to the order number. Finder Variables:
    • OrderNumber; string; Order number of the sales order.
  • PrimaryKey: Find a sales order according to the header identifier. Finder Variables:
    • HeaderId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the sales order header.

parameters.name: finder
parameters.description:
Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • findByFulfillLineId: Find a fulfillment line according to the primary key. Finder Variables:
    • FulfillLineId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the fulfillment line.
  • findBySourceLineIdAndScheduleId: Find order lines according to the source line identifier and source schedule identifier. Finder Variables:
    • SourceTransactionLineId; string; Value that uniquely identifies the transaction line from the source application.
    • SourceTransactionScheduleId; string; Value that uniquely identifies the schedule, shipment, or subline. The source application assigns this value.
  • PrimaryKey: Find order lines according to the fulfill line identifier. Finder Variables:
    • FulfillLineId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the sales order line.

parameters.name: finder
parameters.description:
Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Find inventory balance. Finder Variables:
    • InventoryItemId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the inventory item.
    • LocatorId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the locator.
    • OrganizationId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the organization.
    • OwningPartySiteId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the site of the owning party.
    • Revision; string; Description of the revision.
    • SubinventoryCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the subinventory in the organization. Value references a physical area or a logical grouping of items, such as, a storeroom or receiving dock.
    • SubinventoryGroup; string; Name of the subinventory group.
    • SummaryLevel; string; Summary level for the inventory balance. Values include None, Organization, Subinventory, or Locator.

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKeyFinder: Find suppliers according to the primary key. Finder Variables:
    • SupplierId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the supplier.
  • ActiveSuppliersFinder: Find active suppliers in the application. Finder Variables:
    • BindSysdate; string; Value that uniquely identifies the system date.
  • FindByBilltoBU: Find suppliers according to the business unit enabled for billing. Finder Variables:
    • BilltoBuId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the bill-to business unit.
  • FindByRequisitionBU: Find suppliers according to the site that you can use to create requisitions in a requisitioning business unit.
  • PrimaryKey: Find suppliers according to the primary key. Finder Variables:
    • SupplierId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the supplier.

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • CarrierFinder: Find carriers according to the bind variables that you provide. Finder Variables:
    • ActiveFlag; string; Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the carrier is active. If false, then the carrier is not active.
    • CarrierId; integer; Number that identifies the carrier. This attribute is required.
    • CarrierName; string; Name of the carrier. This attribute is required.
    • ManifestingEnabledFlag; string; Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then use a manifest with this carrier. If false, then do not use a manifest with this carrier.
  • PrimaryKey: Find carrier according to the carrier identifier as the primary key. Finder Variables:
    • CarrierId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the carrier. This attribute is required.

parameters.name: finder
parameters.description:
Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • findByHeaderAttributes: Find receipt requests or advanced shipment notice (ASN) requests in the Pending or Error state according to one or more header attributes. Finder Variables:
    • CustomerId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the customer.
    • CustomerPartyName; string; Name of the customer returning the material.
    • ExternalSystemTransactionReference; string; Value that contains reference information for the corresponding transaction in external applications.
    • FromOrganizationCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the source organization for the shipment.
    • FromOrganizationId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the source organization.
    • GroupId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the processing group.
    • OrganizationCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the receiving organization.
    • OrganizationId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the receiving organization.
    • ProcessingStatusCode; string; Value that indicates the processing status.
    • ShipmentNumber; string; Number that identifies the shipment that the shipment source assigns. This attribute corresponds to the number that identifies one of the following objects: advance shipment notice, in-transit shipment, or transfer order shipment.
    • VendorId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the supplier.
    • VendorName; string; Name of the supplier of the material to be shipped or received.
    • VendorNumber; string; Number that identifies the supplier.
  • findByTransactionAttributes: Find line requests for receipts or advanced shipment notice (ASN) that are in the Pending or Error state according to one of more transaction attributes. Finder Variables:
    • DocumentNumber; string; Number that identifies the document. Values include purchase order number, in-transit shipment number or transfer order shipment number.
    • FromDate; string; Date that is the lower limit of the transaction date range corresponding to the line request.
    • GroupId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies a processing request group.
    • ItemId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the inventory item.
    • ItemNumber; string; Number that identifies the inventory item.
    • OrganizationCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the receiving organization.
    • OrganizationId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the receiving organization.
    • POHeaderId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the purchase order header.
    • ProcessingStatusCode; string; Value that indicates the processing status.
    • RMANumber; string; Number that identifies the return material authorization.
    • ReceiptAdviceHeaderId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the return material authorization (RMA) receipt advice header.
    • ShipmentHeaderId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the transfer order or in-transit shipment header.
    • ShipmentNumber; string; Number that identifies the shipment.
    • SourceDocumentCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the source document. Value values are PO, INVENTORY, TRANSFER ORDER, and RMA.
    • ToDate; string; Date that is the upper limit of the transaction date range corresponding to the line request.
    • TransactionStatusCode; string; Value that indicates the transaction status.
    • TransactionType; string; Type of transaction. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type RCV_TRANSACTION_TYPE.
    • TransferOrderHeaderId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the transfer order header.
  • PrimaryKey: Find receipt headers. Finder Variables:
    • HeaderInterfaceId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the receipt request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) request.

parameters.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
This parameter filters the resource attributes. Only the specified attributes are returned, which means that if no attributes are specified, no attributes are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource attributes. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2

AssignmentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier site assignment.

BillPayableDistribution.description: Distribution of the bills that are payable for the supplier site.
BillPayableDistribution.title: Bill Payable Distribution

BillPayableDistributionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the distribution of the bills that are payable for the supplier site.
BillPayableDistributionId.title: Bill Payable Distribution

BillToBU.description: Business unit that the application uses for billing instead of the client business unit that the user selects.
BillToBU.title: Bill-to BU

BillToBUId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the business unit that the application uses for billing instead of the client business unit that the user selects.

BillToLocation.description: Default billing location on purchasing documents for the bill-to business unit that the user selects.
BillToLocation.title: Bill-to Location

BillToLocationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the bill to location. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Locations task.
BillToLocationCode.title: Bill-to Location

BillToLocationId.description: Values that uniquely identifies the default billing location on purchasing documents for the bill-to business unit that the user selects.

ChartOfAccountsId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the chart of account.

ClientBU.description: Business unit that is a client of the procurement business unit where the supplier site resides.
ClientBU.title: Client BU

ClientBUId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the business unit that is a client of the procurement business unit where the supplier site resides.

DistributionSet.description: Distribution set that determines the distribution on invoices for the supplier site.
DistributionSet.title: Distribution Set

DistributionSetId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the distribution set that determines the distribution on invoices for the supplier site.
DistributionSetId.title: Distribution Set

InactiveDate.description: Date when the supplier site assignment is no longer active.
InactiveDate.title: Inactive Date

LiabilityDistribution.description: The liability distribution of new invoices for the supplier site.
LiabilityDistribution.title: Liability Distribution

LiabilityDistributionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the liability distribution of new invoices for the supplier site.
LiabilityDistributionId.title: Liability Distribution

PrepaymentDistribution.description: Prepayment distribution of the prepayments for the supplier site.
PrepaymentDistribution.title: Prepayment Distribution

PrepaymentDistributionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the distribution of the prepayments for the supplier site.
PrepaymentDistributionId.title: Prepayment Distribution

ShipToLocation.description: Default shipping location on the purchasing document for the client business unit.
ShipToLocation.title: Ship-to Location

ShipToLocationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the ship to location. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Locations task.
ShipToLocationCode.title: Ship-to Location

ShipToLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the default shipping location on the purchasing document for the client business unit.

Status.description: Status of the supplier site assignment.

UseWithholdingTaxFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the withholding tax is applicable to the supplier assignment. If false, then withholding tax is not applicable. The default value is false.
UseWithholdingTaxFlag.title: Use Withholding Tax

WithholdingTaxGroup.description: Describes the withholding tax group that the application assigned to the supplier site assignment.
WithholdingTaxGroup.title: Withholding Tax Group

WithholdingTaxGroupId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the tax group that the application uses to assign the site to withhold tax.

BankChargeBearerCode.description: Code of an external payee who is responsible for paying regular or express bank charges, such as Payee or Payer. Values are from the IBY_BANK_CHARGE_BEARER lookup.
BankChargeBearerCode.title: Bank Charge Bearer Code

BankChargeBearerName.description: Name of an external payee who is responsible for paying regular or express bank charges, such as Payee or Payer.
BankChargeBearerName.title: Bank Charge Bearer Name

BankInstructionCodeOne.description: Code of the first bank instruction to an external payee.
BankInstructionCodeOne.title: Bank Instruction Code One

BankInstructionCodeTwo.description: Code of the second bank instruction to the external payee.
BankInstructionCodeTwo.title: Bank Instruction Code Two

BankInstructionDetails.description: Details of an additional bank instruction to an external payee.
BankInstructionDetails.title: Bank Instruction Details

BankInstructionNameOne.description: Name of the first bank instruction to the external payee.
BankInstructionNameOne.title: Bank Instruction Name One

BankInstructionNameTwo.description: Name of the second bank instruction to an external payee.
BankInstructionNameTwo.title: Bank Instruction Name Two

DefaultPaymentMethodCode.description: Code of the default payment method for an external payee.
DefaultPaymentMethodCode.title: Default Payment Method Code

DefaultPaymentMethodName.description: Name of the default payment method for an external payee.
DefaultPaymentMethodName.title: Default Payment Method Name

DeliveryChannelCode.description: Code of the delivery channel for an external payee.
DeliveryChannelCode.title: Delivery Channel Code

DeliveryChannelName.description: Name of the delivery channel for an external payee.
DeliveryChannelName.title: Delivery Channel Name

DeliveryMethod.description: Delivery method that is set on the external payee level. If the Override with Payee Delivery Method Preference option on the payment process profile is turned off, the setting is ignored. Values from the IBY_DELIVERY_METHODS lookup include EMAIL, FAX, and PRINTED.
DeliveryMethod.title: Remittance Advice Delivery Method

Email.description: Email address at which an external payee receives remittance advice.

Fax.description: Fax number at which an external payee receives remittance advice.

Intent.description:
Purpose of the external payee. The value is based on the payment function of the external payee. The following are the expected values:
PAYABLES_DISB - Supplier, EMPLOYEE_EXP - Person, EMPLOYEE_EXP - Employee, AR_CUSTOMER_REFUNDS - Refund, CUSTOMER_PAYMENT - Customer, ONETIME_PAYMENT - Onetime, and ADHOC_PAYMENT - Adhoc.

OrganizationIdentifier.description: Identifier of the business unit associated with an external payee.

OrganizationName.description: Name of the business unit associated with an external payee.
OrganizationName.title: Organization Name

OrganizationType.description: Type of organization, such as a business unit, that has a relationship with an external payee. Values are from the IBY_ORGANIZATION_TYPES lookup.
OrganizationType.title: Organization Type

PayEachDocumentAloneOption.description: Indicates whether documents payable for an external payee are prevented from being grouped with other like documents payable for payment.

PayeeId.description: Application-generated identifier of the external payee.

PayeePartyNumber.description: Application-generated party number in Trading Community Architecture.
PayeePartyNumber.title: Registry ID

PayeePartySiteIdentifier.description: Identifier of an external payee site.
PayeePartySiteIdentifier.title: Payee Party Site Identifier

PayeePartySiteNumber.description: Number of an external payee site.
PayeePartySiteNumber.title: Site Number

PaymentFormatCode.description: Code of the payment format that is associated with an external payee.
PaymentFormatCode.title: Payment Format Code

PaymentFormatName.description: Name of the payment format that is associated with an external payee.
PaymentFormatName.title: Payment Format Name

PaymentFunctionCode.description: Code that indicates the function or purpose of the payment. Values from the IBY_PAYMENT_FUNCTIONS lookup include SUPPLIER_PAYMENT, CUSTOMER_REFUNDS, and Others.
PaymentFunctionCode.title: Payment Function

PaymentReasonCode.description: Code of the reason for paying an external payee.
PaymentReasonCode.title: Payment Reason Code

PaymentReasonComments.description: Text field available for entering information about an external payee payment.
PaymentReasonComments.title: Payment Reason Comments

PaymentReasonName.description: Name of the reason for paying an external payee.
PaymentReasonName.title: Payment Reason Name

PaymentTextMessageOne.description: First text payment message to an external payee.
PaymentTextMessageOne.title: Payment Text Message 1

PaymentTextMessageThree.description: Third text payment message to an external payee.
PaymentTextMessageThree.title: Payment Text Message 3

PaymentTextMessageTwo.description: Second text payment message to an external payee.
PaymentTextMessageTwo.title: Payment Text Message 2

PersonId.description: Person identifier when the external payee is an employee.

ServiceLevelCode.description: Code of the service level for an external payee.
ServiceLevelCode.title: Service Level Code

ServiceLevelName.description: Name of the service level for an external payee.
ServiceLevelName.title: Service Level Name

SettlementPriority.description: Priority with which the financial institution or payment system settles payments for an external payee.
SettlementPriority.title: Settlement Priority

externalPartyPaymentMethods.description: The external party payment methods resource is used to view, create, and modify payment methods assigned to supplier payees.
externalPartyPaymentMethods.title: External Party Payment Methods

InstallmentNumber.description: The number used to identify an invoice installment to which the global descriptive flexfield is associated.

InvoiceId.description: The unique identifier for the invoice to which the installment global descriptive flexfield is associated.

__FLEX_Context.description: The global descriptive flexfield context name for the invoice installment.

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: The global descriptive flexfield context display value for the invoice installment.

BankAccount.description: The supplier bank account number to which the payment will be remitted. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice installment or populated by default from the Supplier Site or Address or Profile level payment attributes. You can also update the value for the bank account.

CreatedBy.description: The user who created the record.

CreationDate.description: The date when the record was created.

DueDate.description: The date when the invoice installment is due for payment. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or derived based on the payment terms. You can also update the value for the due date.

ExternalBankAccountId.description: The unique identifier for the supplier bank account. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice installment or populated by default from the Supplier Site or Address or Profile level payment attributes. If both Bank Account and External Bank Account ID is provided in the payload then the value for the External Bank Account ID is given preference and the value provided for Bank Account is ignored. You can also update the value for the bank account.

FirstDiscountAmount.description: The discount amount available at first discount date. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or derived based on the payment terms. The value for the attribute must exist if a value exists for the First Discount Date attribute. You can also update the value for the first discount amount.

FirstDiscountDate.description: The date when the first discount is available. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or derived based on the payment terms. The value for the attribute must exist if a value exists for the First Discount Amount attribute. You can also update the value for the first discount date.

GrossAmount.description: The gross amount due for the invoice installment. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or derived based on the payment terms. You can also update the value for the gross amount.

HeldBy.description: The user who placed or requested the hold.

HoldDate.description: The date when the hold was placed.

HoldFlag.description: Indicates whether a scheduled payment is on hold. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice installment or proactive system holds are applied if there are validation failures. The default value is false. You can also update the value for the hold flag.

HoldReason.description: An explanation or justification provided for placing or releasing the hold on the installment. You can also update the value for the hold reason.

HoldType.description: Indicates if the installment hold applied is by system or manually by the user.

InstallmentNumber.description: The number used to identify an invoice installment. The value must be provided while creating the installment. It cannot be updated once the invoice installment is created.

LastUpdateDate.description: The date when the record was last updated.

LastUpdateLogin.description: The session login associated to the user who last updated the record.

LastUpdatedBy.description: The user who last updated the record.

NetAmountOne.description: The net installment amount after deducting the first discount amount.

NetAmountThree.description: The net installment amount after deducting the third discount amount.

NetAmountTwo.description: The net installment amount after deducting the second discount amount.

PaymentMethod.description: Indicates how the first party payer is going to make the payment for the invoice. Examples include check, cash, and credit. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice installment or populated by default based on the Payment Method Default Basis setup in the Manage Disbursement System Options. You can also update the value for the payment method.
PaymentMethod.title: Name

PaymentMethodCode.description: The user-entered payment method code that helps to uniquely identify a payment method.

PaymentPriority.description: The number (1 to 99) representing the payment priority of an invoice installment. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the Supplier Site or from the Manage Invoice Options for the invoicing business unit. You can also update the value for the payment priority.

RemitToAddressName.description: The third-party payment related remit-to address where the payment should be sent. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice installment or populated by default from the Invoicing tab of the Supplier Site. You can also update the value for the remit-to address.

RemitToSupplier.description: The third-party payment related remit-to supplier where the payment should be sent. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice installment or populated by default from the Invoicing tab of the Supplier Site. You can also update the value for the remit-to supplier.

RemittanceMessageOne.description: Remittance  message provided for payment processing. You can provide the information during invoice creation or it will be populated by default from the invoice header. You may update the information at a later stage.

RemittanceMessageThree.description: Remittance  message provided for payment processing. You can provide the information during invoice creation or it will be populated by default from the invoice header. You may update the information at a later stage.

RemittanceMessageTwo.description: Remittance  message provided for payment processing. You can provide the information during invoice creation or it will be populated by default from the invoice header. You may update the information at a later stage.

SecondDiscountAmount.description: The discount amount available at second discount date. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or derived based on the payment terms. The value for the attribute must exist if a value exists for the Second Discount Date attribute. You can also update the value for the second discount amount.

SecondDiscountDate.description: The date when the second discount is available. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or derived based on the payment terms. The value for the attribute must exist if a value exists for the Second Discount Amount attribute. You can also update the value for the second discount date.

ThirdDiscountAmount.description: The discount amount available at third discount date. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or derived based on the payment terms. The value for the attribute must exist if a value exists for the Third Discount Date attribute. You can also update the value for the third discount amount.

ThirdDiscountDate.description: The date when the third discount is available. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or derived based on the payment terms. The value for the attribute must exist if a value exists for the Third Discount Amount attribute. You can also update the value for the third discount date.

UnpaidAmount.description: The invoice installment amount remaining for payment.

invoiceInstallmentDff.description: The payables invoice installments descriptive flexfields resource is used to manage details about the descriptive flexfield references for an invoice installment.
invoiceInstallmentDff.title: Invoice Installments Descriptive Flexfields

invoiceInstallmentGdf.description: The payables invoice installments descriptive flexfields resource is used to manage details about the global descriptive flexfield references for an invoice installment.
invoiceInstallmentGdf.title: Invoice Installments Global Descriptive Flexfields

InvoiceDistributionId.description: The unique identifier for the invoice distribution to which the project-related descriptive flexfield is associated.

__FLEX_Context.description: The project-related descriptive flexfield context name for the invoice distribution.

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: The project-related descriptive flexfield context display value for the invoice distribution.

AccountingDate.description: The date when the invoice distribution is to be accounted. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice distribution or populated by default from the parent invoice line.
AccountingDate.title: Accounting Date

AccountingStatus.description: The option that indicates whether invoice distribution line has been accounted. The default value is set to Unprocessed.

AllocationDistributionLineNumber.description: Indicates the invoice distribution line number to which the current distribution is allocated.

AllocationLineNumber.description: Indicates the invoice line number to which the current distribution is allocated.

AssetBook.description: The asset book candidate for transfer to Oracle Fusion Assets.

AssociatedItemDistributionLineNumber.description: The other distribution line that is related to the current distribution.

BaseAmount.description: The invoice distribution amount in the ledger currency.

CanceledFlag.description: Indicates whether an invoice distribution is canceled. The default value is false. If the value if true, then it indicates the invoice distribution is canceled.

ChargeApplicableToDistId.description: Indicates the distribution line to which the freight or miscellaneous related distribution is allocated.

ConsumptionAdviceLineNumber.description: The line number of the consignment advice associated with the invoice distribution.

ConsumptionAdviceNumber.description: The number of the consignment advice associated with the invoice distribution.

CreatedBy.description: The user who created the record.

CreationDate.description: The date when the record was created.

Description.description: The description of the invoice description. The value can be provided while creating an invoice distribution or populated by default from the parent invoice line.

DistributionAmount.description: The amount on invoice distribution. The value must be provided while creating an invoice distribution.

DistributionCombination.description: The accounting flexfield for account associated with a distribution. The value can be provided while creating an invoice distribution or populated by default from the parent invoice line.

DistributionLineNumber.description: The line number associated with the invoice distribution. The value must be provided while creating an invoice distribution and cannot be updated once the invoice distribution is created.

DistributionLineType.description: The type of invoice line. The value must be provided while creating an invoice distribution. The valid values are Item, Freight and Miscellaneous. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type INVOICE DISTRIBUTION TYPE and can be reviewed using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Payables Lookups task.

FinalMatchFlag.description: Indicates if an invoice is the last one being matched to a purchase order, making the purchase order no longer available for matching to other invoices.

IncomeTaxRegion.description: The reporting region for invoice line for 1099 supplier. The value can be provided while creating an invoice distribution or populated by default from the parent invoice line.

IncomeTaxType.description: The payments of type 1099 made to a supplier. A 1099 supplier may receive payments of more than one type. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice distribution or populated by default from the parent invoice line.

IntendedUse.description: A tax driver used to determine and calculate the applicable taxes. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default from source document or from the respective entity setup. When passing the attribute value in the payload, ensure that you are passing a value for the intended use code attribute as well.
IntendedUse.title: Intended Use

IntendedUseCode.description: The user-entered intended use code that helps to uniquely identify an intended use.

InvoiceDistributionId.description: The unique identifier for the invoice distribution that is generated while creating an invoice distribution.

LastUpdateDate.description: The date when the record was last updated.

LastUpdateLogin.description: The session login associated to the user who last updated the record.

LastUpdatedBy.description: The user who last updated the record.

MatchedStatus.description: The option that indicates whether the invoice distribution is generated for a purchase order matched line. The default value is set to Not Matched.

MultiperiodAccountingAccrualAccount.description: The accrual account used in multiperiod accounting to accrue deferred expenses.

MultiperiodAccountingEndDate.description: The multiperiod accounting end date on the invoice distribution.

MultiperiodAccountingStartDate.description: The multiperiod accounting start date on the invoice distribution.

PrepaymentAvailableAmount.description: The amount of the prepayment that can still be applied to an invoice.

PrepaymentDistributionLineNumber.description: The prepayment distribution line number related to the prepayment line.

PrepaymentLineNumber.description: The prepayment invoice line number that's applied to the invoice.

PrepaymentNumber.description: The prepayment invoice number that's applied to the invoice.

PurchaseOrderDistributionLineNumber.description: The purchase order distribution line number that is matched to the invoice distribution.

PurchaseOrderLineNumber.description: The purchase order line number that is matched to the invoice distribution.

PurchaseOrderNumber.description: The purchase order document number that is matched to the invoice distribution.

PurchaseOrderScheduleLineNumber.description: The purchase order schedule line number that is matched to the invoice distribution.

ReceiptLineNumber.description: The line number of the receipt number associated with the invoice distribution.

ReceiptNumber.description: The number of the receipt of material associated with the invoice distribution.

ReversedFlag.description: Indicates whether a distribution is part of a reversal pair. The default value is false. If the value if true, then it indicates the distribution is part of a reversal pair.

TaxName.description: The name of the classification of a charge imposed by a government through a fiscal or tax authority.

TaxRate.description: The rate specified for a tax status for an effective time period. A tax rate can be expressed as a percentage or a value per unit quantity.

TaxRateName.description: A unique code for a tax rate.

TaxRecoverable.description: Allows the full or partial recovery of a tax, after completion of a specified task defined by the statute.

TaxRegimeName.description: The name of the set of tax rules that determines the treatment of one or more taxes administered by a tax authority.

TaxType.description: A mechanism to administer the recovery process for a specific tax.

TrackAsAssetFlag.description: Indicates if the item should be transferred to Oracle Fusion Assets. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice distribution or populated by default from parent invoice line or populated by default to true if an asset account is provided in the distribution combination. If the value is true, then it indicates that the item should be transferred to Oracle Fusion Assets.

UOM.description: The unit of measure used for the quantity invoiced during matching of this distribution.

UnitPrice.description: The price charged per unit of a good or service.

ValidationStatus.description: The option that indicates whether an invoice has passed validation and all invoice holds have been released. The default value is set to Not Validated.

invoiceDistributionDff.description: The payables invoice distributions descriptive flexfields resource is used to manage details about the descriptive flexfield references for an invoice distribution.
invoiceDistributionDff.title: Invoice Distributions Descriptive Flexfields

invoiceDistributionGdf.description: The payables invoice distributions global descriptive flexfields resource is used to manage details about the global descriptive flexfield references for an invoice distribution.
invoiceDistributionGdf.title: Invoice Distributions Global Descriptive Flexfields

invoiceDistributionProjectDff.description: The payables invoice distribution project descriptive flexfields resource is used to manage details about the project information for an invoice distribution.
invoiceDistributionProjectDff.title: Invoice Distributions Project Descriptive Flexfields

__FLEX_Context.description: The global descriptive flexfield context name for the invoice line.

count.description: The number of resource instances returned in the current range.
count.title: Count

hasMore.description: Indicates whether more resources are available on the server than the subset returned in the response. If the value is true, then there are more resources to retrieve from the server. The default value is false.

InvoiceId.description: The unique identifier for the invoice to which the line project-related descriptive flexfield is associated.

LineNumber.description: The number used to identify an invoice line to which the project-related descriptive flexfield is associated.

__FLEX_Context.description: The project-related descriptive flexfield context name for the invoice line.

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: The project-related descriptive flexfield context display value for the invoice line.

AccountingDate.description: The accounting date for invoice line. It is used to populate by default to invoice distributions. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice installment or populated by default from the invoice header.
AccountingDate.title: Accounting Date

ApprovalStatus.description: The status indicating the state of the invoice line in the approval process.

AssessableValue.description: The deemed price at which a product is valued, by a tax authority, for tax calculation purposes.

AssetBook.description: The asset book associated with the row. The value is populated by default to the distributions candidate for transfer to Oracle Fusion Assets.

AssetCategory.description: The asset category under which this asset line will be grouped. The value is populated by default to the invoice distributions for transferring to Oracle Fusion Assets.

BaseAmount.description: The invoice line amount in the ledger currency.

BudgetDate.description: Budgetary Calendar Period Date applicable for funds check.

CanceledFlag.description: Indicates whether an invoice line is canceled. If the value is true, then it indicates that the line has been canceled.

ConsumptionAdviceLineNumber.description: The line number of the consignment advice associated with the invoice line.

ConsumptionAdviceNumber.description: The number of the consignment advice associated with the invoice line.

CreatedBy.description: The user who created the record.

CreationDate.description: The date when the record was created.

Description.description: The description of the invoice line. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default from the invoice header.

DiscardedFlag.description: Indicates that the line is canceled when an invoice is canceled. When a line is discarded all its distributions are reversed and the amount is set to 0. The default value is false. If the value is true, then it indicates that the line has been discarded.

DistributionCombination.description: The accounting flexfield to be used for automatic generation of a single distribution. The value can be provided while creating an invoice line. In case of Prepayment invoice or charge lines the value is populated by default from the Supplier Site Assignment or from Manage Common Options for Payables and Procurement options for the invoicing business unit.

DistributionSet.description: The distribution set name used in the generation of distributions for a line. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default from the Distribution Set from the Site Assignments in the Supplier Site.

FinalMatchFlag.description: Indicates if an invoice is the last one being matched to a purchase order, making the purchase order schedule no longer available for matching to other invoices. A value of Y indicates the purchase order schedule is finally closed and can no longer match invoices to it.

FundsStatus.description: Indicator to check and reserve funds for the invoice line.
FundsStatus.title: Meaning

GenerateDistributions.description: Indicates whether distributions for the invoice line should be generated dynamically whenever possible.

IncomeTaxRegion.description: The reporting region for the invoice line for the 1099 supplier. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default to the State code from the address associated with supplier site.

IncomeTaxType.description: The payments of type 1099 made to a supplier. A 1099 supplier may receive payments of more than one type. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default from the Federal Income Tax Type from the Income Tax tab from Supplier Profile.

IntendedUse.description: A tax driver used to determine and calculate the applicable taxes for the line. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default from source document or from the respective entity setup. When passing the attribute value in the payload, ensure that you are passing a value for the intended use code attribute as well.
IntendedUse.title: Intended Use

IntendedUseCode.description: The user-entered intended use code that helps to uniquely identify an intended use. When passing the attribute value in the payload, ensure that you are passing a value for intended use attribute as well.

ItemDescription.description: The description of the item in the invoice line. The default value is populated from the inventory item.

LandedCostEnabled.description: Indicates if the invoice line is enabled for landed cost.

LastUpdateDate.description: The date when the record was last updated.

LastUpdateLogin.description: The session login associated to the user who last updated the record.

LastUpdatedBy.description: The user who last updated the record.

LineAmount.description: The line amount in invoice currency. The value must be provided while creating an invoice line.

LineNumber.description: The unique number for the invoice line. The value must be provided while creating an invoice line. It cannot be updated once the invoice line is created.

LineSource.description: The source of the invoice line. The default value is set to Interface imported invoice. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type LINE SOURCE and can be reviewed using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Payables Lookups task.

LineType.description: The type of invoice line. The value must be provided while creating an invoice line. The valid values are Item, Freight and Miscellaneous. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type INVOICE LINE TYPE and can be reviewed using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Payables Lookups task.

MatchBasis.description: Indicator on the purchase order that determines if the deliverable is quantity based such as, the quantity of goods, number of hours for service, or amount based such as fixed rate labor for services.

MatchOption.description: Indicator of whether the invoice for the shipment should be matched to the purchase order or the receipt.

MatchType.description: Indicates if the invoice is matched to a purchase order or to a receipt of material.

MultiperiodAccountingAccrualAccount.description: The accrual account used in multiperiod accounting to accrue deferred expenses.

MultiperiodAccountingEndDate.description: The multiperiod accounting end date on the invoice line.

MultiperiodAccountingStartDate.description: The multiperiod accounting start date on the invoice line.

PrepaymentIncludedonInvoiceFlag.description: Indicates that the prepayment is referenced on the supplier invoice and the invoice amount includes the amount of the prepayment and any associated tax. The default value is false.

PrepaymentLineNumber.description: The prepayment invoice line number that's applied to the invoice.

PrepaymentNumber.description: The prepayment invoice number that's applied to the invoice.

ProductCategory.description: Identifies the taxable nature of a non-Inventory based item to determine tax or tax reporting purposes. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default from source document or from the respective entity setup.

ProductCategoryCodePath.description: The user-entered product category code path that helps to uniquely identify a product category.

ProductFiscalClassification.description: A tax classification used by a tax authority to categorize a product. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default from source document or from the respective entity setup. When passing the attribute value in the payload, ensure that you are passing values for product fiscal classification code, product fiscal classification type attributes as well.
ProductFiscalClassification.title: Product Fiscal Classification

ProductFiscalClassificationCode.description: The user-entered product fiscal classification code that helps to uniquely identify a product fiscal classification. When passing the attribute value in the payload, ensure that you are passing values for product fiscal classification, product fiscal classification type attributes as well.

ProductFiscalClassificationType.description: The user-entered product fiscal classification type that helps to uniquely identify a product fiscal classification. When passing the attribute value in the payload, ensure that you are passing values for product fiscal classification, product fiscal classification code attributes as well.

ProductTable.description: The name of the product source table used to generate the invoice.

ProductType.description: The type of product that defaults from the inventory item attributes. Possible values are Goods or Services. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default from source document or from the respective entity setup.
ProductType.title: Product Type

ProrateAcrossAllItemsFlag.description: Indicates that the Freight or Miscellaneous type line should be prorated across all existing Item type lines. The default value is false. If the value if true, then it indicates the charge line should be prorated across all item type lines.

PurchaseOrderLineNumber.description: The purchase order line number that is matched to the invoice line.

PurchaseOrderNumber.description: The purchase order document number that is matched to the invoice line.

PurchaseOrderScheduleLineNumber.description: The purchase order schedule line number that is matched to the invoice line.

PurchasingCategory.description: The unique identifier for the item category.

Quantity.description: The quantity of items invoiced include matched invoice lines, price corrections, quantity corrections, and unmatched invoice lines.

ReceiptLineNumber.description: The line number of the receipt number associated with the invoice line.

ReceiptNumber.description: The number of the receipt of material associated with the invoice line.

ReferenceKeyTwo.description: The primary key information that uniquely identifies the record in another product's view.

Requester.description: The name of the person who requested the goods or services. The requester is used by the Invoice Approval Workflow process to generate the list of approvers.

ShipToCustomerLocation.description: The location that material was shipped to in case of a drop shipment.
ShipToCustomerLocation.title: Name

ShipToLocation.description: The location where the goods and services have been shipped to by the supplier.

ShipToLocationCode.description: The user-entered ship to location code that helps to uniquely identify a ship to location.

TaxClassification.description: The tax classification code used for tax calculation. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default from the Tax Classification Code from the Transaction Tax tab in the Supplier Profile or Address or as per the Tax setups.

TaxControlAmount.description: The user-enterable value to ensure that the calculated tax will be the same as on the physical document.

TaxRate.description: The rate specified for a tax rate name.

TaxRateCode.description: The tax rate code associated with tax rate identifier.

TaxRateName.description: The tax rate name associated with tax rate identifier.

TrackAsAssetFlag.description: Indicates if the item should be transferred to Oracle Fusion Assets. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default to true if an asset account is provided in the distribution combination. If the value if true, then it indicates the item should be transferred to Oracle Fusion Assets.

TransactionBusinessCategory.description: The transaction category assigned to the invoice line. Used to identify and classify business transactions for the purpose of tax calculation. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default from source document or from the respective entity setup.

TransactionBusinessCategoryCodePath.description: The user-entered transaction business category code path that helps to uniquely identify a transaction business category.

UOM.description: The unit of measure for the quantity invoiced.

UnitPrice.description: The price charged per unit of a good or service.

UserDefinedFiscalClassification.description: A classification for any tax requirement that you cannot define using the existing fiscal classification types. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default from source document or from the respective entity setup.
UserDefinedFiscalClassification.title: User-Defined Fiscal Classification

UserDefinedFiscalClassificationCode.description: The user-entered user defined fiscal classification code that helps to uniquely identify an user defined fiscal classification.

Withholding.description: The withholding tax group name. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice line or populated by default from the Withholding from Site Assignments in the Supplier Site or Address or Profile level.

invoiceDistributions.description: The payables invoice distributions resource is used to manage details that are used to create accounting entries, and includes information, such as accounting date, distribution combinations, and the details necessary for integration with applications, such as Oracle Fusion Assets.
invoiceDistributions.title: Invoice Distributions

invoiceLineDff.description: The payables invoice lines descriptive flexfields resource is used to manage details about the descriptive flexfield references for an invoice line.
invoiceLineDff.title: Invoice Lines Descriptive Flexfields

invoiceLineGdf.description: The payables invoice lines descriptive flexfields resource is used to manage details about the global descriptive flexfield references for an invoice line.
invoiceLineGdf.title: Invoice Lines Global Descriptive Flexfields

invoiceLineProjectDff.description: The payables invoice line project descriptive flexfields resource is used to manage details about the project information for an invoice line.
invoiceLineProjectDff.title: Invoice Lines Project Descriptive Flexfields

AccountCodingStatus.description: This value indicates the routing status of the invoice. The invoice can be in the process of routing or complete.

AccountingDate.description: The accounting date captured on the invoice that is finally used to default to invoice lines and distributions. The value can either be provided while creating the invoice or derived based on the Accounting Date Basis option on the Manage Invoice Options for the invoicing business unit.
AccountingDate.title: Accounting Date

AccountingStatus.description: An indicator to show the state of account creation for a given invoice. The default value is set to Unaccounted.

AmountPaid.description: The amount paid for the invoice.

ApplyAfterDate.description: The date associated with a prepayment invoice after which you can apply the prepayment against invoices. It is only used for temporary prepayments. The column is null for permanent prepayments and other invoice types. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or derived based on the Prepayment Settlement Days setup in the Manage Invoice Options for the invoicing business unit.

ApprovalStatus.description: The status indicating the state of the invoice in the approval process.

BankAccount.description: The supplier bank account number to which the payment will be remitted. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the Supplier Site, Address, or Profile-level payment attributes.

BankChargeBearer.description: The bearer of bank charge cost. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type IBY_BANK_CHARGE_BEARER. Accepted values can be reviewed using the Setup and Maintenance work area and the Manage Standard Lookups task.

BaseAmount.description: The invoice amount in the ledger currency.

BudgetDate.description: Budgetary Calendar Period Date applicable for funds check.

BusinessUnit.description: Indicates the business unit name for the invoice. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the profile option DEFAULT_ORG_ID. It cannot be updated once the invoice is created.
BusinessUnit.title: Business Unit

CanceledBy.description: The user who canceled an invoice.

CanceledDate.description: The date when the invoice was canceled.

CanceledFlag.description: Indicates if the invoice has been canceled. The default value is false. If the value if true, then it indicates the invoice is canceled.

ControlAmount.description: The user-enterable value to ensure that the calculated tax will be the same as on the physical document.

ConversionDate.description: The date when a conversion rate is used to convert an amount into another currency for an invoice. It is a mandatory attribute for non functional currency invoices. The value can either be provided while creating the invoice or populated by default from the accounting date of the invoice.

ConversionRate.description: The conversion rate at which the principal unit of one currency is converted into another currency for an invoice. It is a mandatory attribute for non functional currency invoices, which is based on the Require conversion rate entry option in the Manage Common Options for Payables and Procurement options for the invoicing business unit. The value can either be provided while creating the invoice or populated by default from the Manage Daily Rates for the conversion rate type and date, or can be updated later using the Apply Missing Conversion Rates process.

ConversionRateType.description: The source of currency conversion rate for an invoice. Examples include corporate, user-defined, and spot. It is a mandatory attribute for non functional currency invoices, which is based on the Require conversion rate entry option in the Manage Common Options for Payables and Procurement options for the invoicing business unit. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the Conversion Rate Type from the Manage Common Options for Payables and Procurement options for the invoicing business unit.
ConversionRateType.title: Conversion Rate Type

CreatedBy.description: The user who created the record.

CreationDate.description: The date when the record was created.

DeliveryChannel.description: The text on electronic payment that instructs the bank about the execution of payment. For example, print a check and hold it for collection by the payee. The value can either be provided while creating the invoice or populated by default from the Supplier Site or Address or Profile level payment attributes.
DeliveryChannel.title: Name

DeliveryChannelCode.description: The delivery channel code entered by the user that helps to uniquely identify a delivery channel.

Description.description: The statement that describes the invoice.

DocumentCategory.description: The sequential numbering document category. The attribute is mandatory, which is based on the Sequencing setup at Specify Ledger Options for the ledger associated to the invoicing business unit.

DocumentFiscalClassificationCodePath.description: The classification of transactions that require special documentation to accompany them as designated by the tax authority. For example, international transactions often require proof of export documentation to support the sale or transfer of goods. A document fiscal classification code can be created to confirm receipt of the export documents. When passing the attribute value in the payload, ensure that the document fiscal classification code path is passed.

DocumentSequence.description: The manual sequence number when document sequential numbering is enabled. The attribute is mandatory, which is based on the Sequencing setup at the Specify Ledger Options for the ledger associated to the invoicing business unit.

ExternalBankAccountId.description: The unique identifier for the supplier bank account. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the Supplier Site, Address, or Profile-level payment attributes. If you provide values for multiple bank account-related attributes, such as Bank Account, Supplier IBAN, or External Bank Account ID, then all the information provided is validated.

FirstPartyTaxRegistrationId.description: The unique first party tax registration identifier.

FirstPartyTaxRegistrationNumber.description: The first party tax registration number. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the first party legal establishment. You can also update the value for the first-party tax registration number.
FirstPartyTaxRegistrationNumber.title: Registration Number

FundsStatus.description: Indicator to check and reserve funds for the invoice.
FundsStatus.title: Meaning

GoodsReceivedDate.description: The date when the goods were received. This date can be used to calculate the invoice payment due date. The value can either be provided while creating the invoice or populated by default to the system date.

InvoiceAmount.description: The invoice amount in transaction currency. The value must be provided while creating an invoice.

InvoiceCurrency.description: The currency code used on the invoice. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the Supplier Site or from the Manage Invoice Options for the invoicing business unit.

InvoiceDate.description: The date on the supplier invoice. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default to the system date.

InvoiceGroup.description: The unique name of the invoice group assigned to a group of invoices used for reporting and payment purposes. It is a mandatory attribute, which is based on the Require invoice grouping option in the Manage Invoice Options for the invoicing business unit.

InvoiceId.description: The unique invoice identifier that is generated while creating an invoice.

InvoiceNumber.description: The unique number for supplier invoice.

InvoiceReceivedDate.description: The date when the invoice was received. This date can be used to calculate the invoice payment due date. The value can either be provided while creating the invoice or populated by default to the system date.

InvoiceSource.description: The source that indicates the feeder system from which an invoice is created. The valid values are Spreadsheet, External, or any user-defined source in the lookup type SOURCE and can be reviewed using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Payables Lookups task. The value can either be provided while creating the invoice or populated by default to External.

InvoiceSourceCode.description: Code that indicates the feeder system from which an invoice is created. The valid values are defined in the SOURCE lookup type. Values can be reviewed using the Setup and Maintenance work area and the Manage Payables Lookups task.

InvoiceType.description: The type of the invoice. The valid invoice types are Standard, Prepayment, Credit Memo, Debit Memo. The value can either be provided while creating the invoice or derived based on the invoice amount. The positive invoice amount is considered as Standard invoice and negative values are considered as Credit Memo. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type INVOICE TYPE and can be reviewed using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Payables Lookups task.

LastUpdateDate.description: The date when the record was last updated.

LastUpdateLogin.description: The session login associated to the user who last updated the record.

LastUpdatedBy.description: The user who last updated the record.

LegalEntity.description: The name of the legal entity. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or derived by the system.
LegalEntity.title: Legal Entity

LegalEntityIdentifier.description: The user-entered legal entity identifier that helps to uniquely identify a legal entity.

LiabilityDistribution.description: The account combination to which liability is recorded. Payables uses the liability account combination when accounting entries are created for invoices. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the Supplier Site Assignment or from the Default Distributions from Manage Common Options for Payables and Procurement options for the invoicing business unit.

PaidStatus.description: The status indicating whether an invoice is paid. The default value is set to Unpaid.

Party.description: An entity that can enter into business relationships with other entities and that submits invoices or other requests for payment. In some cases, goods or services or both are provided in return for payment.
Party.title: Name

PartySite.description: Unique identity of the party site.
PartySite.title: Site Name

PayAloneFlag.description: Indicates whether the invoice is to be paid with its own payment document without including other invoices for the supplier. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the Supplier Site or Address or Profile level payment attributes. The default value is false.

PayGroup.description: Groups a category of supplier invoices for a single pay run. Examples include employees, merchandise, nonmerchandise, government, domestic, and international. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the Supplier Site or from the Manage Invoice Options for the invoicing business unit. You can also update the pay group on the invoice. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type PAY GROUP and can be reviewed using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Payables Lookups task.

PaymentCurrency.description: The currency used to make a payment. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the Supplier Site or from the Manage Invoice Options for the invoicing business unit.

PaymentMethod.description: Indicates how the first party payer is going to make the payment for the invoice. Examples include check, cash, and credit. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default based on the Payment Method Default Basis setup in the Manage Disbursement System Options.
PaymentMethod.title: Name

PaymentMethodCode.description: The user-entered payment method code that helps to uniquely identify a payment method.

PaymentReason.description: The codes provided by the government or central bank of a country. These codes provide the payment system or bank with additional details about the reason for the payment, and are used for regulatory reporting purposes. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the Supplier Site or Address or Profile level payment attributes.
PaymentReason.title: Name

PaymentReasonCode.description: The user-entered payment reason code that helps to uniquely identify a payment reason.

PaymentReasonComments.description: The comments that indicate the reason for creating the payment. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the Supplier Site or Address or Profile level payment attributes.

PaymentTerms.description: The payment terms used to calculate installments and to calculate due dates, discount dates, and discount amounts for each invoice. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the Supplier Site or from the Manage Invoice Options for the invoicing business unit.

ProcurementBU.description: The procurement business unit that is associated to the supplier site on the invoice and helps to uniquely identify a supplier site.

ProductTable.description: The name of the product source table used to generate the invoice.

PurchaseOrderNumber.description: The purchase order document number that is matched to the invoice.

ReferenceKeyOne.description: The primary key information that uniquely identifies the record in another product's view.

RemittanceMessageOne.description: Remittance message provided for payment processing. You can provide the information during invoice creation or update it later.

RemittanceMessageThree.description: Remittance message provided for payment processing. You can provide the information during invoice creation or update it later.

RemittanceMessageTwo.description: Remittance message provided for payment processing. You can provide the information during invoice creation or update it later.

Requester.description: The name of the person who requested the goods or services. The requester is used by the Invoice Approval Workflow process to generate the list of approvers.

RoutingAttribute1.description: Captures additional attributes information that may have been used for routing payables invoice images.

RoutingAttribute2.description: Captures additional attributes information that may have been used for routing payables invoice images.

RoutingAttribute3.description: Captures additional attributes information that may have been used for routing payables invoice images.

RoutingAttribute4.description: Captures additional attributes information that may have been used for routing payables invoice images.

RoutingAttribute5.description: Captures additional attributes information that may have been used for routing payables invoice images.

SettlementPriority.description: The priority with which the financial institution or payment system should settle the payment for this document. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type IBY_SETTLEMENT_PRIORITY. Accepted values can be reviewed using the Setup and Maintenance work area and the Manage Standard Lookups task.

Supplier.description: The supplier name on the invoice. The value must be provided while creating the invoice. It cannot be updated once the invoice is created.
Supplier.title: Name

SupplierIBAN.description: The alphanumeric sequence that conforms to the ISO standard for uniquely identifying a bank account number internationally. The standard IBAN carries all the routing information needed to transfer a payment from one bank to another anywhere in the world. The value provided in the payload helps to uniquely identify a bank account. If you provide values for multiple bank account-related attributes, such as Bank Account, Supplier IBAN, or External Bank Account ID, then all the information provided will be validated.

SupplierNumber.description: The unique number to identify the supplier.
SupplierNumber.title: Supplier Number

SupplierSite.description: The name of the physical location of the supplier from where the goods and services are rendered. The value must be provided during creation action. It cannot be updated once the invoice is created.
SupplierSite.title: Site

SupplierTaxRegistrationNumber.description: The third party tax registration number. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or populated by default from the supplier.
SupplierTaxRegistrationNumber.title: Registration Number

TaxationCountry.description: The country where the transaction took place for taxation purposes. Oracle Fusion Tax sets the context of other tax drivers such as the Product Fiscal Classification based on the value of this field. The value can either be provided when creating an invoice or it's populated by default from the setup.
TaxationCountry.title: Territory Name

TermsDate.description: The date used with payment terms to calculate installment along with due date and discount dates. The value can either be provided while creating an invoice or derived based on the Terms Date Basis option from the Supplier Site or from the Manage Invoice Options for the invoicing business unit.

UniqueRemittanceIdentifier.description: The unique identifier for a remittance. Contains reference information for a payment.

UniqueRemittanceIdentifierCheckDigit.description: A check digit used to validate the unique remittance identifier.

ValidationStatus.description: The status indicating the state of the invoice in the validation process. The default value is set to Not Validated.

VoucherNumber.description: The manual voucher number when document sequential numbering is not used.

appliedPrepayments.description: The applied prepayments resource is used to view the prepayments that are applied to an invoice.
appliedPrepayments.title: Applied Prepayments

attachments.description: The attachments resource for a payables invoice is used to manage attachments that the user has attached to the invoice header.
attachments.title: Attachments

availablePrepayments.description: The available prepayments resource is used to view the available prepayment that can be applied to invoices.
availablePrepayments.title: Available Prepayments

invoiceDff.description: The payables invoices descriptive flexfields resource is used to manage details about the descriptive flexfield references for an invoice.
invoiceDff.title: Invoices Descriptive Flexfields

invoiceGdf.description: The payables invoices global descriptive flexfields resource is used to manage details about the global descriptive flexfield references for an invoice.
invoiceGdf.title: Invoices Global Descriptive Flexfields

invoiceInstallments.description: The payables invoice installments resource is used to manage details about the payment due dates, amounts, and other payment information. An invoice can have one or more installments.
invoiceInstallments.title: Invoice Installments

invoiceLines.description: The payables invoice lines resource is used to manage details about goods and services, which includes freight, and miscellaneous charges that can be allocated to item lines. It also captures details necessary for integration with applications, such as Oracle Fusion Assets.
invoiceLines.title: Invoice Lines
