Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

FreezePriceFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then price the sales order. If false, then do not price. The default value is true.

FreezeShippingChargeFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then recalculate shipping charges for the sales order. If false, then do not recalculate. The default value is true.

FreezeTaxFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then calculate taxes for the sales. If false, then do not calculate. The default value is true.

FreightTerms.description: Terms for paying freight charges. For example, paid by shipper, collect, or prepaid. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_FREIGHT_TERMS. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

FreightTermsCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the terms for paying freight charges. For example, paid by shipper, collect, or prepaid. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_FREIGHT_TERMS. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

HeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the sales order header. The application creates this value when it creates the sales order.

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time when the user most recently updated the sales order.
LastUpdateDate.title: Last Updated Date

LastUpdatedBy.description: User who performed the most recent update on the sales order.
LastUpdatedBy.title: Updated By

LatestAcceptableArrivalDate.description: Date when the customer is willing to receive the item.

LatestAcceptableShipDate.description: Date when the customer is willing to allow the warehouse to ship the item.

MessageText.description: Message that indicates the processing status of the sales order.

OnHoldFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then sales order is on hold. If false, then sales order is not on hold. The default value is false. This attribute is read-only.
OnHoldFlag.title: On Hold

OrderKey.description: Value that uniquely identifies the sales order. This value is derived by concatenating the value of SourceOrderSystem, a colon, and the value of SourceOrderId. For orders created through the application, the SourceOrderId is same as the HeaderId. For example, if SourceOrderSystem is LEG and SourceOrderId is R13_Sample_Order, the value of this attribute is LEG:R13_Sample_Order.

OrderNumber.description: Number that identifies the sales order. The profile Retain Sales Order Number For Orchestration Order Number determines whether to use the source transaction number as the order number for each imported source order. If you use the source transaction number as the order number, then this transaction number must be unique in the source application.
OrderNumber.title: Orchestration Order

OrigSystemDocumentReference.description: Original reference for the source order from the source application.

PackingInstructions.description: Text that describes how to pack the item.

PartialShipAllowedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then ship items on the sales order in more than one shipment. If false, then do not ship these items in one shipment. The default value is false.
PartialShipAllowedFlag.title: Allow Split Shipments

PaymentTerms.description: Payment terms to apply to collect payment. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Receivables Payment Terms task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

PaymentTermsCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the payment terms. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Receivables Payment Terms task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

PreCreditCheckedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then allow an application outside Oracle Fusion to perform credit check. If false, then do not allow. The default value is false.

PreferredSoldToContactPointId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the preferred contact point for the sold-to contact. This value identifies the preferred email contact.

PricedOn.description: Date when pricing priced the sales order. This attribute contains the system date at the beginning of the price calculation.

PricingSegmentCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the pricing segment.

PricingSegmentExplanation.description: Explanation of why pricing applied the pricing segment.

PricingStrategyExplanation.description: Explanation of why pricing applied the pricing strategy.

PricingStrategyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the pricing strategy.

RequestedArrivalDate.description: Date when the customer requested the item to arrive.

RequestedCancelDate.description: Date when the customer canceled the order line.

RequestedFulfillmentOrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the organization that ships the shipment.

RequestedFulfillmentOrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the organization that ships the shipment.

RequestedFulfillmentOrganizationName.description: Name of the organization that ships the shipment.

RequestedShipDate.description: Date when the customer requested to ship the item.

RequestingBusinessUnitId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the business unit who requested the sales order. Assign a business unit for each role to each user to provide access to data in the business unit.

RequestingBusinessUnitName.description: Name of the business unit who requested the sales order. Assign a business unit for each role to each user to provide access to data in the business unit.

RequestingLegalEntity.description: Legal entity who formed a contract with the customer for the sales order. The contracting party on the order is the legal entity.

RequestingLegalEntityId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the legal entity who formed a contract with the customer. The contracting party on the order is the legal entity.

RevisionSourceSystem.description: Source application that sent a revision of the sales order.

SalesChannel.description: Name of the sales channel. For example, web or phone. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_QP_CHANNEL_METHODS.

SalesChannelCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the sales channel. For example, web or phone. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_QP_CHANNEL_METHODS.

Salesperson.description: Name of the primary sales person.

SalespersonId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the primary sales person.

SegmentExplanationMessageName.description: Name of the message for the pricing segment strategy. You can use the message name to get the message text.

ShipmentPriority.description: Priority of shipment that allows you to group shipments into different categories depending on the urgency. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_SHIPPING_PRIORITY. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source, or use Load Planning Data from Flat Files.

ShipmentPriorityCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the priority of the shipment. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_SHIPPING_PRIORITY. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task.

ShippingCarrierId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the carrier who delivered the item.

ShippingInstructions.description: Text that includes details about how to ship the item.

ShippingMode.description: Mode of shipping that delivers the item. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_MODE_OF_TRANSPORT. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the V task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

ShippingModeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the mode of shipping that delivers the shipment. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_MODE_OF_TRANSPORT. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

ShippingServiceLevel.description: Level of service for the shipping that delivers the shipment. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_SERVICE_LEVELS. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

ShippingServiceLevelCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the shipping level of service to use to deliver the shipment. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_SERVICE_LEVELS. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

ShipsetFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then ship a group of order lines in the sales order together from a single location to a single destination, and ship them all on the same scheduled ship date. If false, then do not ship them as a group. This attribute does not have a default value.

SourceTransactionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transaction in the source application. If the source application does not contain a unique value for the transaction, then you can set this attribute to a user key that the source application contains, such as an order number or quote number. The application uses this attribute and the source transaction to uniquely identify the transaction and create the composite key for a change order. You must make sure that each change order uses the same value that the new sales order used.

SourceTransactionNumber.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transaction in the source application. The source application assigns this value as the order number. If your implementation interfaces to a quote and converts the quote to a sales order, then this attribute references the quote number.
SourceTransactionNumber.title: Source Order

SourceTransactionSystem.description: Source system that created the order. You use the Manage Trading Community Source Systems and Manage Upstream and Fulfillment Source Systems tasks to setup the source application.
SourceTransactionSystem.title: Source Order System

StatusCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the status of the sales order.

StrategyExplanationMessageName.description: Name of the pricing strategy message. You can use the message name to get the message text.

SubmittedBy.description: User who submitted the sales order.

SubmittedDate.description: Date and time when the user submitted the sales order.

SubmittedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the application validated and submitted the sales order. If false, then the application did not validate and submit. The sales order is in draft status. The default value is false.

SubstituteAllowedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then you can substitute items on the fulfillment line for various reasons, such as shortage of material, or as a goodwill gesture to the customer. If false, then you cannot make these substitutions. This attribute does not have a default value.

SupplierId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier who supplies the item. You can use a supplier according to the contractual obligations in drop ship.

SupplierName.description: Name of the supplier who supplies the item. You can use a supplier according to a contractual obligation in drop ship.

SupplierSiteId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier who supplies the item.

SupplierSiteName.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier site that supplies the item.

TradeComplianceResult.description: Name that identifies the result of the trade compliance screening for the order.

TradeComplianceResultCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the result of the trade compliance screening for the order lines.

TransactionDocumentTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies whether the request is a sales order, purchase order or internal material transfer.

TransactionOn.description: Date and time when the transaction started. The date occurs when the customer commits to purchase the items that the sales order contains. The date can occur in the past or future, depending on when the customer placed the sales order.
TransactionOn.title: Ordered Date

TransactionType.description: Name of the type of sales order.

TransactionTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the type of transaction. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_DOO_ORDER_TYPES. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Order Lookups task.
TransactionTypeCode.title: Order Type

TransactionalCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency that pricing used to price the transaction.
TransactionalCurrencyCode.title: Currency

TransactionalCurrencyName.description: Name of the currency that pricing used to price the transaction.

additionalInformation.description: The Sales Orders for Order Hub resource gets, creates, and updates sales orders in Oracle Order Management Cloud. A sales order captures order header details, such as customer, items ordered, and pricing.
additionalInformation.title: Details

attachments.description: The Sales Orders for Order Hub resource gets, creates, and updates sales orders in Oracle Order Management Cloud. A sales order captures order header details, such as customer, items ordered, and pricing.
attachments.title: Attachments

billToCustomer.description: The Sales Orders for Order Hub resource gets, creates, and updates sales orders in Oracle Order Management Cloud. A sales order captures order header details, such as customer, items ordered, and pricing.
billToCustomer.title: Bill-to Customers

copyOrderReference.description: The Sales Orders for Order Hub resource gets, creates, and updates sales orders in Oracle Order Management Cloud. A sales order captures order header details, such as customer, items ordered, and pricing.
copyOrderReference.title: Copy Orders

holds.description: The Sales Orders for Order Hub resource gets, creates, and updates sales orders in Oracle Order Management Cloud. A sales order captures order header details, such as customer, items ordered, and pricing.
holds.title: Holds

lines.description: The Sales Orders for Order Hub resource gets, creates, and updates sales orders in Oracle Order Management Cloud. A sales order captures order header details, such as customer, items ordered, and pricing.
lines.title: Order Lines

payments.description: The Sales Orders for Order Hub resource gets, creates, and updates sales orders in Oracle Order Management Cloud. A sales order captures order header details, such as customer, items ordered, and pricing.
payments.title: Payments

salesCredits.description: The Sales Orders for Order Hub resource gets, creates, and updates sales orders in Oracle Order Management Cloud. A sales order captures order header details, such as customer, items ordered, and pricing.
salesCredits.title: Sales Credits

shipToCustomer.description: The Sales Orders for Order Hub resource gets, creates, and updates sales orders in Oracle Order Management Cloud. A sales order captures order header details, such as customer, items ordered, and pricing.
shipToCustomer.title: Ship-to Customers

totals.description: The Sales Orders for Order Hub resource gets, creates, and updates sales orders in Oracle Order Management Cloud. A sales order captures order header details, such as customer, items ordered, and pricing.
totals.title: Totals

CreatedBy.description: User who created the additional information.
CreatedBy.title: Created By

CreationDate.description: Date and time when the user created the additional information.
CreationDate.title: Creation Date

HeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the sales order that contains the additional information.

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time when the user most recently updated the order line.
LastUpdateDate.title: Last Updated Date

LastUpdateLogin.description: Login that user used when updating the additional information.
LastUpdateLogin.title: Last Updated Login

LastUpdatedBy.description: User who most recently updated the additional information.
LastUpdatedBy.title: Updated By

ObjectVersionNumber.description: Number that determines whether some other session updated the row. The application increments this value every time it updates a row. It compares this number at the start and at the end of each transaction to determine whether another session updated the row since the last time the application queried the row.

SourceTransactionIdentifier.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transaction in the source application.

SourceTransactionSystem.description: Source application that placed the request.

AsyncTrackerId.description: An identifier used for tracking the uploaded files.
AsyncTrackerId.title: Asynchronous Upload Tracker Id

AttachedDocumentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the attachment.
AttachedDocumentId.title: Attached Document Id

ContentRepositoryFileShared.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the application shares the attachment file in the content repository. If false, then the application does not share.
ContentRepositoryFileShared.title: Shared

CreatedBy.description: User who created the attachment.
CreatedBy.title: Created By

CreatedByUserName.description: Login that the user used when creating the attachment.
CreatedByUserName.title: Created By User Name

CreationDate.description: Date and time when the user created the attachment.
CreationDate.title: Creation Date

DatatypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the data type of the attachment.
DatatypeCode.title: Type

DmDocumentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the attached document.

DmFolderPath.description: Path to the folder that contains the attachment.
DmFolderPath.title: Dm Folder Path

DmVersionNumber.description: Number that identifies the version of the attached document.

ErrorStatusCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the status of the attachment upload.
ErrorStatusCode.title: Error Status Code

ErrorStatusMessage.description: Error message encountered while uploading attachment.
ErrorStatusMessage.title: Error Status Message

FileUrl.description: URL (Uniform Resource Locator) that locates the attachment file.
FileUrl.title: File Url

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time when the user most recently updated the attachment.
LastUpdateDate.title: Last Update Date

LastUpdatedBy.description: User who most recently updated the attachment.
LastUpdatedBy.title: Last Updated By

LastUpdatedByUserName.description: Login that the user used when updating the attachment.
LastUpdatedByUserName.title: Last Updated By User

Uri.description: URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) that identifies the attachment file.
Uri.title: Uri

Url.description: URL (Uniform Resource Locator) that locates the attachment.
Url.title: Url

AccountNumber.description: Number of the customer account who is legally responsible for payment. This account exists when a selling relationship exists between the deploying company and the party.

Address1.description: First line of the bill-to customer address.

Address2.description: Second line of the bill-to customer address.

Address3.description: Third line of the bill-to customer address.

Address4.description: Fourth line of the bill-to customer address.

AddressId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the bill-to customer address.

City.description: City of the bill-to customer address.

ContactFirstName.description: First name of the person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

ContactId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the contact for the billing account.

ContactLastName.description: Last name of the person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

ContactMiddleName.description: Middle name of the person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

ContactName.description: Person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

ContactNameSuffix.description: Name suffix of the person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

ContactNumber.description: Telephone number of the person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

ContactTitle.description: Title of the person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

Country.description: Country of the bill-to customer address.

County.description: County of the bill-to customer address.

CustomerAccountId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the account that is legally responsible for payment. This account exists when a selling relationship exists between the deploying company and the party.

PartyName.description: Name of the party who is legally responsible for payment.

PersonFirstName.description: If a person is legally responsible for payment, then this attribute contains the first name of the person.

PersonLastName.description: If a person is legally responsible for payment, then this attribute contains the last name of the person.

PersonMiddleName.description: If a person is legally responsible for payment, then this attribute contains the middle name of the person.

PersonNameSuffix.description: If a person is legally responsible for payment, then this attribute contains the name suffix of the person.

PersonTitle.description: If a person is legally responsible for payment, then this attribute contains the title of the person.

PostalCode.description: Postal code of the bill-to customer address.

PreferredContactPointId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the email for the preferred contact point for the contact at the account who is responsible for payment.

Province.description: Province of the bill-to customer address.

SiteUseId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the account site that is legally responsible for payment.

SourceAddressId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the bill-to customer address. Value is 1.

State.description: State of the bill-to customer address.

DocumentSystemReferenceId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the document system reference when the user copies a sales order.

OriginalHeaderId.description: Header value that identifies the source sales order when the user copies a sales order.

OriginalOrderChangeVersionNumber.description: Change version number from the source sales order when the user copies a sales order.

OriginalOrderNumber.description: Order number from the source sales order when the user copies a sales order.

ActiveFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the hold is active. If false, then the hold is not active.
ActiveFlag.title: Active

ApplyDate.description: Date when the user applied the hold.
ApplyDate.title: Hold Date

ApplySystem.description: Application that requested to apply the hold.

ApplyUser.description: Name of the user who applied the hold.

HoldComments.description: Comments that the user added when placing the hold.
HoldComments.title: Comments

HoldInstanceId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the hold.

HoldReleaseComments.description: Comments that the user added when releasing the hold.
HoldReleaseComments.title: Release Comments

HoldReleaseReasonCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the reason for releasing the hold.
HoldReleaseReasonCode.title: Release Reason

ReleaseDate.description: Date when the user released the hold.
ReleaseDate.title: Release Date

ReleaseUser.description: Name of the user who released the hold.

SourceRequestId.description: Value that identifies the source application that requested the hold.

AccountingRule.description: Accounting rule that determines the accounting timeframe or timeframes to use when distributing revenue for an invoice line.

AccountingRuleCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the accounting rule.

ActionTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the type of action with respect to the coverage or the subscription product on fulfillment line. Say Add, Update, Renew in case of  coverage. Resume, Suspend, terminate in case of subscriptions. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_QP_ACTION_TYPES.

ActualCompletionDate.description: Date when the application fulfilled the fulfillment line.
ActualCompletionDate.title: Actual Completion Date

ActualShipDate.description: Date when the application sent the shipment.
ActualShipDate.title: Actual Ship Date

AppliedPriceListId.description: Value that identifies the price list that pricing applied.

AssessableValue.description: Price that a tax authority uses to value, and then tax the item.

AssetGroupNumber.description: Value that groups customer assets into different categories.

AssetTrackedFlag.description: Abbreviation that identifies whether the fulfill line is eligible to be interfaced to asset management for tracking customer assets that are created from order processing. This attribute is not currently used.

AssetTrackingCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies whether the fulfill line is eligible to be interfaced to asset management for tracking customer assets that are created from order processing. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_EGP_ASSET_TRACKING.

BillingTransactionTypeId.description: Value that identifies the billing type.

BusinessUnitId.description: Value that identifies the business unit for the fulfillment line.

BusinessUnitName.description: Name of the business unit for the fulfillment line.

BuyerId.description: Buyer details for a schedule. This attribute references the Buyer Public View that the application publishes for the item on the purchase order.

CancelReason.description: Reason to cancel the sales order. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type DOO_RETURN_REASON. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Order Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

CancelReasonCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the reason to cancel the sales order. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type DOO_RETURN_REASON. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Order Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

CanceledFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the application canceled the sales order line. If false, then not canceled. The default value is false.
CanceledFlag.title: Canceled

ComponentIdPath.description: Value that identifies the path from the inventory item to the parent of this configured item on the order line.

ConfigCreationDate.description: Date when the user created the configured item.

ConfigHeaderId.description: Value that identifies the order header of the sales order that contains the configured item.

ConfigInventoryItemId.description: Inventory item for an assemble-to-order, configured item that the application can ship. A contract or a sales agreement is an example of an item that the application cannot ship.

ConfigItemReference.description: Reference to the finished configured item.

ConfigRevisionNumber.description: Revision number of the configured item. The configurator sets the value of this attribute to the configured item. It does not set it to a configure option.

ConfigTradeComplianceResultCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the result of trade compliance screening for the configured item.

ConfiguratorPath.description: Path that identifies the inventory item for the configure option. Path format is ".", separated by inventory item identifier. The format uses [<instance number>] to specify configure options that occur in more than one instance.

ContractEndDate.description: End date of the contract, according to the start date and duration. You can use Manage Time Units Mappings to map time units to the units of measure that the application uses.

CoveredCustomerProductDescription.description: Description of the customer item that the coverage item covers.

CoveredCustomerProductId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the customer item that the coverage item covers.

CoveredCustomerProductNumber.description: Number that identifies the customer item that the coverage item covers.

CoveredProductDescription.description: Description of the inventory item that the coverage item covers.

CoveredProductId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the inventory item that the coverage item covers.

CoveredProductNumber.description: Number that identifies the inventory item that the coverage item covers.

CreatedBy.description: User who created the order line.
CreatedBy.title: Created By

CreationDate.description: Date and time when the user created the order line.
CreationDate.title: Creation Date

CreditCheckAuthExpiryDate.description: Date when the approved credit authorization expires.

CreditCheckAuthorizationNumber.description: Value that uniquely identifies the approved credit authorization that the credit management system created on the authorized amount for the customer account. This attribute applies on credit checks only for authorization or reauthorization.

CustomerPOLineNumber.description: Value that uniquely identifies the purchase order line. The purchase order line describes the item or service, and it includes the price and quantity ordered.
CustomerPOLineNumber.title: Customer PO Line

CustomerPONumber.description: Number that identifies the purchase order that the application uses to request that the seller supply the item or service in return for payment.
CustomerPONumber.title: Customer PO

CustomerPOScheduleNumber.description: Number that identifies the schedule for the shipment that ships the purchase order. This is an optional attribute that the user can specify when submitting the sales order.

CustomerProductId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the customer item.

DefaultTaxationCountry.description: Country that the tax authority uses to calculate tax.

DefaultTaxationCountryShortName.description: Short name of the country that the tax authority uses to calculate tax.

DemandClass.description: Demand class that represents a group of customers, such as government, commercial, sales channel, or region. Demand class can represent different sources of demand, such as retail, mail order, or wholesale. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_DOO_DEMAND_CLASS. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Order Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

DemandClassCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the demand class. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_DOO_DEMAND_CLASS. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Order Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

DestinationLocationId.description: Value that identifies the destination location where the application ships the item.

DestinationShippingOrganizationId.description: Value that identifies the destination organization where the application ships the item.

DisplayLineNumber.description: Number that the order management work area displays to identify the order line.

DocumentSubtype.description: Tax classification for tax reporting. This attribute depends on the requirements for each country.

DocumentSubtypeName.description: Name of the tax classification for tax reporting. This attribute depends on the requirements for each country.

EarliestAcceptableShipDate.description: Earliest date when the customer is willing to receive shipment.
EarliestAcceptableShipDate.title: Earliest Acceptable Ship Date

EstimateFulfillmentCost.description: Estimated cost to deliver the fulfillment line to the customer. This value includes item cost and shipping cost.

EstimateMargin.description: Estimated margin expected when shipping the fulfillment line.

ExemptionCertificateNumber.description: Certification number that the taxing authority provides for tax exemption for each customer who is eligible for tax exemption.

ExtendedAmount.description: Monetary amount of the order line.
ExtendedAmount.title: Extended Amount

FOBPoint.description: Freight on board. Identifies ownership of the item while it is in transit. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_FOB. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

FOBPointCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the freight on board. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_FOB. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

FinalDischargeLocationId.description: Value that identifies the final destination location for the purchase.

FirstPartyTaxRegistration.description: Registration number that the application provides to the supplier. The supplier uses this number to tax the transaction.

FreightTerms.description: Terms for paying freight charges. For example, paid by shipper, collect, or prepaid. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_FREIGHT_TERMS. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

FreightTermsCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the terms for paying freight charges. For example, paid by shipper, collect, or prepaid. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_FREIGHT_TERMS. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

FulfillInstanceId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the fulfillment instance that fulfills this fulfillment line.

FulfillLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the fulfillment line.

FulfillLineNumber.description: Numerical value for the fulfillment line. The default value is 1. It increments in integers when the fulfillment line splits.
FulfillLineNumber.title: Fulfillment Line

FulfilledQuantity.description: Quantity the application uses to fulfill the order line.
FulfilledQuantity.title: Fulfilled Quantity

FulfillmentDate.description: Date when the application fulfills the order line. Fulfillment includes item shipped, hardware installed, and so on.
FulfillmentDate.title: Actual Fulfillment Date

FulfillmentMode.description: Fulfillment mode, such as regular, dropship, or back-to-back.

GopReferenceId.description: Value that identifies the cross-reference to the recommendation that global order promising creates for the split fulfillment line.

GopRequestRegion.description: Region details for the promising request that global order promising provides.

HeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the header of the sales order that contains the order line.

IntendedUseClassificationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies intended use of the item. For tax calculation.

IntendedUseClassificationName.description: Classification name for the intended use of the item. For tax calculation.

InventoryOrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the inventory organization where the application assigns the item. The application also uses this value for the item validation organization when the customer places the sales order.

InventoryOrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the inventory organization where the application assigns the item. The application also uses this value for the item validation organization when the customer places the sales order.

InvoiceEnabledFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the order line qualifies for billing. If false, then the order line does not qualify for billing. The default value is set based on the item setup. This attribute is read-only.

InvoiceInterfacedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the application sent the order line to the billing system. If false, then the application did not send the order line to the billing application. The default value is false. This attribute is read-only.

InvoiceableItemFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the fulfillment line includes the item that the application enabled for billing or invoicing. If false, then the fulfillment line does not include this item. The default value is set based on the item setup. This attribute is read-only.
InvoiceableItemFlag.title: Billable

InvoicingRule.description: Invoicing rule that determines when to recognize a receivable for invoice.

InvoicingRuleCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies invoicing rules that determine when to recognize a receivable for invoice.

ItemSubTypeCode.description: Subgroup for ITEM_TYPE_CODE. It provides details for each configured item or service, such as assemble-to-order.

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time when the user most recently updated the order line.
LastUpdateDate.title: Last Updated Date

LastUpdateLogin.description: Login that user who most recently updated the order line used.
LastUpdateLogin.title: Last Updated Login

LastUpdatedBy.description: User who performed the most recent update on the order line.
LastUpdatedBy.title: Updated By

LatestAcceptableArrivalDate.description: Latest date when the customer is willing to receive the item.
LatestAcceptableArrivalDate.title: Latest Acceptable Arrival Date

LatestAcceptableShipDate.description: Latest date when the customer is willing to allow the warehouse to ship the item.
LatestAcceptableShipDate.title: Latest Acceptable Ship Date

LineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the order line.

LineNumber.description: Number that identifies the order line.
LineNumber.title: Orchestration Order Line

OnHoldFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then fulfillment lines will accept more processing. If false, then fulfillment lines will not accept more processing. The default value is false. This attribute is read-only.
OnHoldFlag.title: On Hold

OpenFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then status of the fulfillment line is not closed. If false, then status of the fulfillment line is closed. The default value is true. This attribute is read-only.
OpenFlag.title: Open

OrderedQuantity.description: Quantity of the item or service on the fulfillment line.
OrderedQuantity.title: Ordered Quantity

OrderedUOM.description: Unit of measure for the ordered quantity. For example, length, time, heat, value, and so on.

OrderedUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure for the ordered quantity.
OrderedUOMCode.title: UOM

OrigSystemDocumentLineReference.description: Original document reference of the order line in the source application.

OrigSystemDocumentReference.description: Original document reference of the source order in the source application.

OriginalProductDescription.description: Description of the inventory item that the fulfillment line contained before the application substituted the item.

OriginalProductId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the inventory item that the fulfillment line contained before the application substituted the item.

OriginalProductNumber.description: Number of the inventory item that the fulfillment line contained before the application substituted the item.

OverFulfillmentTolerance.description: Percent of quantity that can be fulfilled above the ordered quantity.

OverrideScheduleDateFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the user can manually override the schedule date. If false, then user cannot override. The default value is false.
OverrideScheduleDateFlag.title: Override Schedule

OwnerId.description: User who is responsible for the order line.

PackingInstructions.description: Document that contains packing details for the item.
PackingInstructions.title: Packing Instructions

ParentFulfillLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the parent fulfillment line. This value describes the fulfillment line hierarchy for a configured item.

ParentSourceTransactionLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the parent transaction line from the source application. This value describes the transaction line hierarchy for a configured item.

PartialShipAllowedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then ship items in the sales order in more than one shipment. If false, then ship items in the sales order in one shipment. The default value is false.
PartialShipAllowedFlag.title: Allow Split Shipments

PaymentTerms.description: Payment terms to use to collect payment.

PricedOn.description: Date when pricing priced the order line. The application sets this date to the system date when pricing begins pricing the order line.

ProcessNumber.description: Number that identifies the orchestration process.

ProductCategory.description: Item classification that the tax authority uses to tax the item.

ProductCategoryName.description: Classifies the item for tax. Order management uses this attribute when you do not install Oracle Fusion Inventory in your deployment, or when you installed it but you do not use it to classify items for tax.

ProductDescription.description: Description of the item that the application fulfills.

ProductFiscalCategory.description: Tax classification of the item that the tax authority uses to tax the item.

ProductFiscalCategoryId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the tax classification.

ProductId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the inventory item.

ProductNumber.description: Stock keeping unit for the item that the application fulfills.

ProductType.description: Type of item classification in Oracle Fusion Tax. The value of the item type specifies whether the transaction line is for an item or service, or whether it is a memo line.

ProductTypeName.description: Name of the item classification in Oracle Fusion Tax. The value of the item type specifies whether the transaction line is for an item or service, or whether it is a memo line.

PromiseArrivalDate.description: Date when global order promising promised to the customer that the item will arrive.
PromiseArrivalDate.title: Promised Arrival Date

PromiseShipDate.description: Date when global order promising promised to the customer that the item will ship.
PromiseShipDate.title: Promised Ship Date

PurchasingEnabledFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the purchase order can include the item on the fulfillment line. If false, then the purchase order cannot include the item on the fulfillment line. The default value is set based on the item setup. This attribute is read-only.

PurchasingUOM.description: Unit of measure that procurement set on the purchase order for the supplier.

PurchasingUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure that procurement set on the purchase order for the supplier.

QuantityForEachModel.description: Quantity for a configure option on a single configured item.

RMADeliveredQuantity.description: Quantity delivered for the receipt line.
RMADeliveredQuantity.title: Delivered Quantity

RemnantFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the application partially fulfilled a configured item. If false, then the application did not partially fulfill a configured item. The default value is false. This attribute is read-only.

RequestedArrivalDate.description: Original date when the customer requested for the item to arrive.
RequestedArrivalDate.title: Requested Arrival Date

RequestedCancelDate.description: Date when the customer canceled the order line.

RequestedFulfillmentOrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the organization that fulfills the item. If the item is shippable, then this value references the warehouse that ships the item. A contract or an agreement is an example of an item that is not shippable.

RequestedFulfillmentOrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the organization that fulfills the item. If the item is shippable, then this value references the warehouse that ships the item. A contract or an agreement is an example of an item that is not shippable.

RequestedFulfillmentOrganizationName.description: Name of the organization that fulfills the item. If the item is shippable, then this value references the warehouse that ships the item. A contract or an agreement is an example of an item that is not shippable.

RequestedShipDate.description: Original date when the customer requested for the item to ship.
RequestedShipDate.title: Requested Ship Date

RequestingBusinessUnitId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the business unit who requested the sales order. Assign a business unit for each role to each user to provide access to data in the business unit.

RequestingBusinessUnitName.description: Name of the business unit who requested the sales order. Assign a business unit for each role to each user to provide access to data in the business unit.

RequiredFulfillmentDate.description: Date when the customer requires fulfillment.

RequisitionBusinessUnitId.description: Value that identifies the requisition business unit.

RequisitionInventoryOrganizationId.description: Value that identifies the requisition organization.

ReservableFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the application can reserve the item on the fulfillment line. If false, then the application cannot reserve. The default value is set based on the item setup. This attribute is read-only.
ReservableFlag.title: Reservable

ReservationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the reservation.

ReservedQuantity.description: Quantity of the item that the application reserved in the warehouse to fulfill the fulfillment line.
ReservedQuantity.title: Reserved Quantity

ReturnReason.description: Reason that the customer provided to return the item.

ReturnReasonCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the reason to return an item.

ReturnableFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the application can return the item to the supplier. If false, then the application cannot return the item to the supplier. The default value is set based on the item setup. This attribute is read-only.
ReturnableFlag.title: Return Allowed

RootParentFulfillLineId.description: Description of the fulfillment line hierarchy for a configured item. It identifies the highest fulfillment line in the hierarchy.

SalesProductTypeCode.description: Sales type of the item on the fulfillment line.

Salesperson.description: Person who is responsible for the sale of the sales order.

SalespersonId.description: Value that identifies the primary salesperson.

ScheduleArrivalDate.description: Date when the application scheduled the shipment to arrive.
ScheduleArrivalDate.title: Scheduled Arrival Date

ScheduleShipDate.description: Date when the application scheduled the shipment to ship.
ScheduleShipDate.title: Scheduled Ship Date

SchedulingReasonCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the scheduling reason.

ServiceCancelDate.description: Date when the customer canceled the coverage item or subscription item on the fulfillment line.

ServiceDuration.description: Duration for the coverage item or subscription item on the fulfillment line.

ServiceDurationPeriodCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure for the coverage item or subscription item on the fulfillment line.

ServiceDurationPeriodName.description: Name of the unit of measure for the coverage item or subscription item on the fulfillment line.

ShipSetName.description: Group of order lines in the sales order that must ship together from one location to one destination, and that use the same scheduled ship date.
ShipSetName.title: Shipment Set

ShipmentPriority.description: Priority of shipment that allows you to group shipments into different categories depending on the urgency. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_SHIPPING_PRIORITY. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

ShipmentPriorityCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the priority of the shipment. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_SHIPPING_PRIORITY. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

ShippableFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the application can ship the order line to the customer. For example, the application can typically ship a computer, but cannot typically ship a service. If false, then the application cannot ship the order line. The default value is set based on the item setup. This attribute is read-only.
ShippableFlag.title: Shippable

ShippedQuantity.description: Quantity of the item on the order line that shipped.
ShippedQuantity.title: Shipment Quantity

ShippedUOM.description: Unit of measure for the quantity shipped.

ShippedUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure for the quantity shipped.

ShippingCarrierId.description: Abbreviation that identifies the carrier who delivers the item.

ShippingInstructions.description: Detailed instructions about cargo and other requirements for shipping.
ShippingInstructions.title: Shipping Instructions

ShippingMode.description: Mode of shipping that delivers the item. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_MODE_OF_TRANSPORT. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

ShippingModeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the mode of shipping that delivers the shipment. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_MODE_OF_TRANSPORT. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

ShippingServiceLevel.description: Level of service for the shipping that delivers the shipment. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_SERVICE_LEVELS. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

ShippingServiceLevelCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the shipping level of service to use to deliver the shipment. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_SERVICE_LEVELS. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Shipping Lookups task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

ShowInSales.description: Specifies how to display a configured item on the Sales Summary page and on the Configurator summary page. You can set this attribute to one of the following values. Yes: display the configured item, but do not display the configure options. This is the default value. Hide Self: display the configure options, but do not display the configured item. Hide Self and Descendants: do not display the configured item or the configure options. You define this attribute for the configure options in Product Information Management. This attribute controls only the display. It does not filter items from the configurator.

SourceScheduleNumber.description: Number that the source application assigns for the schedule, shipment, or subline.
SourceScheduleNumber.title: Source Schedule Number

SourceTransactionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transaction in the source application.

SourceTransactionLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transaction line from the source application.

SourceTransactionLineNumber.description: Number of the transaction line from the source application.
SourceTransactionLineNumber.title: Source Order Line

SourceTransactionNumber.description: Number that identifies the transaction in the source application.
SourceTransactionNumber.title: Source Order

SourceTransactionRevisionNumber.description: Revision number of the transaction in the source application.

SourceTransactionScheduleId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the schedule, shipment, or subline. The source application assigns this value.

SourceTransactionSystem.description: Source application that placed the request.
SourceTransactionSystem.title: Source System

StatusCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the status of the fulfillment line.

Subinventory.description: Physical or logical location of the item.

SubinventoryCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the physical or logical location of the item.

SubstitutionAllowedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then allow the application to substitute an item on the fulfillment line for some reason, such as shortage of material or goodwill gesture to the customer. If false, then do not allow the application to substitute. This attribute does not have a default value.
SubstitutionAllowedFlag.title: Allow Item Substitution

SubstitutionReason.description: Describes why the application substituted the item on the fulfillment line.

SubstitutionReasonCode.description: Abbreviation that describes why the application substituted the item on the fulfillment line.
SubstitutionReasonCode.title: Substitution Reason

SupplierName.description: Name of the supplier that the application requested.

SupplierSiteId.description: Supplier site for the purchase order.

SupplierSiteName.description: Name of the supplier site for the purchase order.

SupplyStatusCode.description: Status of the supply for the fulfillment line.

TaxClassification.description: Group of taxes for reporting and processing.

TaxClassificationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies a group of taxes.

TaxExemptCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies whether the fulfillment line is exempt from tax. Valid values include S and E. If S, then calculate standard tax. If E, then exempt from tax. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ZX_EXEMPTION_CONTROL.

TaxExemptFlag.description: Abbreviation that identifies the tax exemption. This attribute is not currently used.

TaxExemptReasonCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the reason for the tax exemption.

TaxInvoiceDate.description: Tax invoice date that tax reporting uses depending on the requirements of different countries.

TaxInvoiceNumber.description: Invoice number that tax reporting uses depending on the requirements of different countries.

ThirdPartyTaxRegistration.description: Registration number that the customer specifies in the purchase order.

ThirdPartyTaxRegistrationNumber.description: Customer registration number that the customer specifies in the purchase order.

TotalContractAmount.description: Total amount for the contract duration according to the total contract quantity.

TotalContractQuantity.description: Total quantity for the contract duration including the number of timeframes for recurring billing.

TradeComplianceDate.description: Most recent date when the application screened the order line for trade compliance.

TradeComplianceResultCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the result of trade compliance screening.

TransactionBusinessCategory.description: Tax classification that the tax authority requires.

TransactionBusinessCategoryName.description: Name of the tax classification that the tax authority requires.

TransactionCategoryCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies whether the line is a return. Values include RETURN or ORDER.
TransactionCategoryCode.title: Category

TransactionLineType.description: Defines behavior for the fulfillment line. For example, required values, default values, display values, and so on.

TransactionLineTypeCode.description: Type of action in the channel system. For example, buy, replace with, return for credit, upgrade, and so on.

TransportationPlannedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the transportation planning system plans the fulfillment line. If false, then the transportation planning system does not plan the fulfillment line. The default value is false.

TransportationPlannedStatusCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates that a transportation planning application plans the fulfillment line. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_DOO_TP_STATUS.

UnderFulfillmentTolerance.description: Percent of quantity that can be fulfilled below the ordered quantity.

UnitListPrice.description: Selling price for each unit of the item before applying discounts.
UnitListPrice.title: Unit List Price

UnitQuantity.description: Number of units for the item.

UnitSellingPrice.description: Price that the buyer pays for one unit of the item.
UnitSellingPrice.title: Unit Selling Price

UnreferencedReturnFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the returned order line does not include a reference order. If false, then the returned order line includes a reference order. The default value is set by the application. This attribute is read-only.

UserDefinedFiscalClass.description: Tax classification that the user defines.

UserDefinedFiscalClassName.description: Name of the tax classification that the user defines.

ValidConfigurationFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the configured item is valid. If false, then the configured item is not valid. The default value is set only for root lines based on configuration validation. This attribute is read-only.

additionalInformation.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
additionalInformation.title: Details

attachments.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
attachments.title: Attachments

billToCustomer.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
billToCustomer.title: Bill-to Customers

billingPlans.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
billingPlans.title: Billing Plans

channelPrograms.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
channelPrograms.title: Channel Programs

charges.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
charges.title: Charges

coverageReferences.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
coverageReferences.title: Coverage Items

coveredProductReferences.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
coveredProductReferences.title: Covered Items

dropShipPurchaseOrderReference.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
dropShipPurchaseOrderReference.title: Drop Ships

dropShipRequisitionReference.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
dropShipRequisitionReference.title: Drop Ship Requisitions

externalFulfillmentSalesOrderReference.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
externalFulfillmentSalesOrderReference.title: Fulfillment Orders

holds.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
holds.title: Holds

internalOrderReference.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
internalOrderReference.title: Internal Sales Orders

lineDetails.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
lineDetails.title: Line Details

lotSerials.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
lotSerials.title: Lot Serials

manualPriceAdjustments.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
manualPriceAdjustments.title: Manual Price Adjustments

originalOrderReference.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
originalOrderReference.title: Original Orders

payments.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
payments.title: Payments

priceAdjustments.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
priceAdjustments.title: Price Adjustments

priceValidations.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
priceValidations.title: Price Validations

project.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
project.title: Projects

salesCredits.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
salesCredits.title: Sales Credits

shipToCustomer.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
shipToCustomer.title: Ship-to Customers

supplyOrderReference.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
supplyOrderReference.title: Supply Orders

transactionItemAttributes.description: The Order Lines resource manages details about the order line, such as item and quantity.
transactionItemAttributes.title: Transaction Item Attributes

FulfillLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the order line that contains the additional information.

HeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the sales order that contains the additional information.

SourceTransactionLineIdentifier.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transaction in the source application.

SourceTransactionScheduleIdentifier.description: Value that uniquely identifies the schedule, shipment, or subline. The source application assigns this value.

SourceTransactionSystem.description: Source application that placed the request.

AsyncTrackerId.description: An identifier used for tracking the uploaded files.
AsyncTrackerId.title: Asynchronous Upload Tracker Id

AttachedDocumentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the attachment.
AttachedDocumentId.title: Attached Document Id

ContentRepositoryFileShared.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the application shares the attachment file in the content repository. If false, then the application does not share.
ContentRepositoryFileShared.title: Shared

CreatedBy.description: User who created the attachment.
CreatedBy.title: Created By

CreatedByUserName.description: Login that the user used when creating the attachment.
CreatedByUserName.title: Created By User Name

CreationDate.description: Date and time when the user created the attachment.
CreationDate.title: Creation Date

DatatypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the data type of the attachment.
DatatypeCode.title: Type

DmDocumentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the attached document.

DmFolderPath.description: Path to the folder that contains the attachment.
DmFolderPath.title: Dm Folder Path

DmVersionNumber.description: Number that identifies the version of the attached document.

ErrorStatusCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the status of the attachment upload.
ErrorStatusCode.title: Error Status Code

ErrorStatusMessage.description: Error message encountered while uploading attachment.
ErrorStatusMessage.title: Error Status Message

FileUrl.description: URL (Uniform Resource Locator) that locates the attachment file.
FileUrl.title: File Url

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time when the user most recently updated the attachment.
LastUpdateDate.title: Last Update Date

LastUpdatedBy.description: User who most recently updated the attachment.
LastUpdatedBy.title: Last Updated By

LastUpdatedByUserName.description: Login that the user used when updating the attachment.
LastUpdatedByUserName.title: Last Updated By User

Uri.description: URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) that identifies the attachment file.
Uri.title: Uri

Url.description: URL (Uniform Resource Locator) that locates the attachment.
Url.title: Url

AccountDescription.description: Description of the account who is legally responsible for payment. This account exists when a selling relationship exists between the deploying company and the party.

AccountNumber.description: Number of the customer account who is legally responsible for payment. This account exists when a selling relationship exists between the deploying company and the party.

Address1.description: First line of the bill-to customer address.

Address2.description: Second line of the bill-to customer address.

Address3.description: Third line of the bill-to customer address.

Address4.description: Fourth line of the bill-to customer address.

AddressId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the bill-to customer address.

City.description: City of the bill-to customer address.

ContactFirstName.description: First name of the person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

ContactId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the contact for the billing account.

ContactLastName.description: Last name of the person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

ContactMiddleName.description: Middle name of the person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

ContactName.description: Person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

ContactNameSuffix.description: Name suffix of the person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

ContactNumber.description: Telephone number of the person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

ContactTitle.description: Title of the person to contact at the bill-to customer site.

Country.description: Country of the bill-to customer address.

County.description: County of the bill-to customer address.

CustomerAccountId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the account that is legally responsible for payment. This account exists when a selling relationship exists between the deploying company and the party.

PartyName.description: Name of the party who is legally responsible for payment.

PersonFirstName.description: If a person is legally responsible for payment, then this attribute contains the first name of the person.

PersonLastName.description: If a person is legally responsible for payment, then this attribute contains the last name of the person.

PersonMiddleName.description: If a person is legally responsible for payment, then this attribute contains the middle name of the person.

PersonNameSuffix.description: If a person is legally responsible for payment, then this attribute contains the name suffix of the person.

PersonTitle.description: If a person is legally responsible for payment, then this attribute contains the title of the person.

PostalCode.description: Postal code of the bill-to customer address.

PreferredContactPointId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the email for the preferred contact point for the contact at the account who is responsible for payment.

Province.description: Province of the bill-to customer address.

SiteUseId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the account site that is legally responsible for payment.

SourceAddressId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the bill-to customer address. Value is 1.

State.description: State of the bill-to customer address.

BillingNumberOfPeriods.description: Number of timeframes in a recurring invoice.

BillingPeriodEndDate.description: End date of the billing timeframe. The application sets this date to the contract end date of the first billing timeframe. If the invoice does not cover the full billing timeframe, then the application sets the end date to the billing end date of the subsequent billing timeframe.

BillingPeriodNumber.description: Timeframe number for the billing start date, end date, or transaction date.

BillingPeriodStartDate.description: Start date of the billing timeframe. The application sets this date to the contract start date of the first billing timeframe. If the invoice does not cover the full billing timeframe, then the application sets the start date to the billing start date of the subsequent billing timeframe.

BillingPlanId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the billing plan.

BillingPlanType.description: Name of the billing plan type.

BillingPlanTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the type of billing plan, such as periodic or milestone.

BillingTransactionDate.description: Date when the first invoice occurs when the sales order uses a recurring invoice. If the invoice covers only part of an invoice timeframe, then this attribute stores the date of the subsequent invoice.

CancellationEffectiveDate.description: Date when recurring billing stops and no future billing occurs.

NetBillingAmountForEachPeriod.description: Net amount that the application bills for each billing timeframe.

OverridePeriod.description: Timeframe that includes an override amount. For example, the first invoice is for timeframe 1, the second invoice is for timeframe 2, and so on.

OverridePeriodAmount.description: Override amount to apply on the timeframe.

OverridePeriodQuantity.description: Quantity to use when calculating recurring billing or credit for the override timeframe.

Periodicity.description: Name of the timeframe of the recurring invoice.

PeriodicityCode.description: Timeframe of the recurring invoice. Values include Day, Week, Month, Quarter, or Year.

SourceBillingPlanId.description: Value that identifies the billing plan. The source application assigns this value.

ApplyType.description: Value that indicates whether the channel program for an order line is applied by the user or the application. The values for this attribute are based on the value of ManuallyAppliedFlag.

Comments.description: Comments for channel program for an order line.

DeclinableFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the channel program for an order line can be declined by a user. If false, then the channel program for an order line can't be declined by a user. The default value is true.

DeclineReason.description: Reason to decline the channel program for an order line.

DeclineReasonCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the reason to decline the channel program for an order line. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_FOM_INCENT_DECLINE_REASON.

DiscountAmount.description: Amount of discount for the product rule.

DiscountType.description: Value that identifies the discount type of the product rule.

DiscountTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the discount type of the product rule. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_CJM_LINE_DISCOUNT_TYPE.

EndDate.description: Date when the product rule is no longer effective.

IncentiveEntitySubtypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the sub type of the channel program.

IncentiveEntityTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the type of the channel program.

IncentiveId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the channel program for an order line.

ItemLevel.description: Value that indicates the item level of the product rule.

ItemLevelCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the item level of the product rule. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_CJM_ITEM_LEVEL.

ManuallyAppliedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the channel program for an order line is selected by the user. If false, then the channel program for an order line is applied by the application. The default value is false. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_FOM_USER_APPLIED_INCENTIVE.

ProgramCode.description: Abbreviation that uniquely identifies the channel program.

ProgramDetails.description: Details of the product rule. The value of this attribute is a concatenation of DiscountType and DiscountAmount from the product rule.

ProgramId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the channel program.

ProgramLine.description: Value that indicates the item level at which a channel program is applied for an order line. The values for this attribute are based on the value of ItemLevelCode. If the value of ItemLevelCode is ALL_ITEMS, then the value of ItemLevel is used as the value of this attribute. If the value of ItemLevelCode is ITEM, then item number from order line is used as the value of this attribute. Otherwise, the value of item identifier from product rule is used as the value of this attribute.

ProgramLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the product rule.

ProgramTypeName.description: Name of the channel program type.

SourceIncentiveId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the channel program for an order line. The source application assigns this value.

StartDate.description: Date when the product rule is effective.

Status.description: Value that indicates the status of the channel program for an order line.

StatusCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the status of the channel program for an order line. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_FOM_INCENTIVE_STATUS.

ApplyTo.description: Specifies where pricing applies the charge: for the item, for shipping, or for the return.

ApplyToCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies where pricing applies the charge: for the item, for shipping, or for the return.

AverageUnitSellingPrice.description: Weighted average of the selling price. This average is the total sales revenue divided by total units sold.

CanAdjustFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the charge is eligible for adjustment. If false, then the charge is not eligible for adjustment. For Oracle Fusion application priced orders, the default value is set based on the pricing setup. For pre-priced orders, the default value is false.

ChargeCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the charge currency.

ChargeDefinition.description: Charge definition that defines the price type, charge type, and subtype.

ChargeDefinitionCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the charge definition.

ChargeSubtypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the charge subtype.

ChargeType.description: Charge type, such as item sale, service sale, financing, lease, shipping, restocking penalties, and so on.

ChargeTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the charge type.

GSAUnitPrice.description: Price for each unit. Determined from the price list on the pricing strategy.

OrderChargeId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transaction.

PricePeriodicity.description: Periodicity for recurring price types, such as month, quarter, or year.

PricePeriodicityCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the price periodicity.

PriceType.description: Price type, such as one time, recurring, and so on.

PriceTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the price type.

PricedQuantity.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure for the priced quantity, such as Ton.

PricedQuantityUOM.description: Unit of measure for priced quantity, such as Ton. Product Information Management or a service in Order Management Cloud provides this value.

PricedQuantityUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure for the priced quantity.

PrimaryFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the charge is the primary charge. If false, then the charge is not the primary charge. For Oracle Fusion application priced orders, the default value is set based on the pricing setup. For pre-priced orders, the value is entered by the user.

RollupFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the charge is a rollup charge. If false, then the charge is not a rollup charge. For Oracle Fusion application priced orders, the default value is set based on the pricing setup. For pre-priced orders, the default value is false.

SourceChargeId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the charge. The source application applies this value.
