Alias.description: Alternate internal name for the organization.
Alias.title: Alias

BusinessClassificationNotApplicableFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then no current business classification applies for the supplier. If false, then business classifications do apply. The default value is false.

BusinessRelationship.description: Business relationship between the enterprise and the supplier.
BusinessRelationship.title: Business Relationship

BusinessRelationshipCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the business relationship between the enterprise and the supplier. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_POZ_BUSINESS_RELATIONSHIP. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Standard Lookups task.
BusinessRelationshipCode.title: Business Relationship

ChiefExecutiveName.description: Name of the chief executive officer in the supplier organization.
ChiefExecutiveName.title: Chief Executive Name

ChiefExecutiveTitle.description: Title of the chief executive officer in the supplier organization.
ChiefExecutiveTitle.title: Chief Executive Title

CreationDate.description: Date when the application created the supplier.
CreationDate.title: Creation Date

CreationSource.description: Source that the application uses to create the supplier. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type POZ_CREATION_SOURCE. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Standard Lookups task.
CreationSource.title: Creation Source

CreationSourceCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the source that the application uses to create the supplier.
CreationSourceCode.title: Creation Source

CurrentFiscalYearPotentialRevenue.description: Potential revenue for the supplier organization in the current fiscal year.
CurrentFiscalYearPotentialRevenue.title: Current Fiscal Year's Potential Revenue

CustomerNumber.description: Number that the supplier uses to identify the buying organization.
CustomerNumber.title: Customer Number

DFF.description: The Flexfields for Suppliers resource manages supplier descriptive flexfields.
DFF.title: Flexfields for Suppliers

DUNSNumber.description: Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS) that identifies the supplier business.
DUNSNumber.title: D-U-N-S Number

DataFoxId.description: Value that uniquely identifies a company tracked by Oracle DataFox, which is linked to the supplier. This attribute is not currently used.

FederalIncomeTaxType.description: Type of income tax for the supplier.
FederalIncomeTaxType.title: Federal Income Tax Type

FederalIncomeTaxTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the type of income tax for a reportable supplier according to the 1099 tax code in the United States.
FederalIncomeTaxTypeCode.title: Taxpayer ID

FederalReportableFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then supplier is reportable to the Internal Revenue Service in the United States for the 1099 tax code. If false, then the supplier is not reportable. The default value is false.
FederalReportableFlag.title: Federal Reportable

FiscalYearEndMonth.description: Month when the fiscal year ends in the supplier organization.

FiscalYearEndMonthCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the month when the fiscal year ends in the supplier organization. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type MONTH. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Standard Lookups task.
FiscalYearEndMonthCode.title: Fiscal Year End Month

InactiveDate.description: Date when the supplier is no longer active.
InactiveDate.title: Inactive Date

MissionStatement.description: Mission statement that the supplier uses.
MissionStatement.title: Mission Statement

NameControl.description: First four characters of the last name of a supplier who is reportable to the Internal Revenue Service in the United States for the 1099 tax code.
NameControl.title: Name Control

NationalInsuranceNumber.description: Number that uniquely identifies a supplier who is a person. Some countries use this number to track work, taxation, and government benefits for each person.
NationalInsuranceNumber.title: National Insurance Number

NationalInsuranceNumberExistsFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then a value exists for the National Insurance number. If false, then a value does not exist for the National Insurance number. This flag is not updatable. The default value is false.
NationalInsuranceNumberExistsFlag.title: National Insurance Number Exists

OneTimeSupplierFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the supplier is a one-time supplier. If false, then the supplier is not a one-time supplier. The default value is false.
OneTimeSupplierFlag.title: One-time supplier

ParentSupplierId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the parent supplier.

ParentSupplierNumber.description: Number that identifies the parent supplier.
ParentSupplierNumber.title: Parent Supplier Number

PreferredFunctionalCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency that the supplier uses.
PreferredFunctionalCurrencyCode.title: Preferred Functional Currency

PrincipalName.description: Name of the principal officer in the supplier organization.
PrincipalName.title: Principal Name

PrincipalTitle.description: Title of the principal officer in the supplier organization.
PrincipalTitle.title: Principal Title

RegistryId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the party in the supplier relationship.
RegistryId.title: Registry ID

StandardIndustryClass.description: Classification number that the industry uses.
StandardIndustryClass.title: SIC

StateReportableFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the supplier is reportable to a state taxing authority in the United States. If false, then the supplier is not reportable. The default value is false.
StateReportableFlag.title: State reportable

Status.description: Status of the supplier. Values include ACTIVE or INACTIVE.
Status.title: Status

SupplierId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier.

SupplierPartyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier party.
SupplierPartyId.title: Supplier Party ID

SupplierTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the type of supplier. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type POZ_VENDOR_TYPE. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Supplier Type Lookup task.
SupplierTypeCode.title: Supplier Type

TaxOrganizationType.description: Type of tax organization for the supplier.
TaxOrganizationType.title: Tax Organization Type

TaxOrganizationTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the type of tax organization for the supplier. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type POZ_ORGANIZATION_TYPE. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Tax Organization Type Lookup task.
TaxOrganizationTypeCode.title: Tax Organization Type

TaxRegistrationCountry.description: Country where the supplier registered themselves for value added tax.
TaxRegistrationCountry.title: Tax Registration Country

TaxRegistrationCountryCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the country where the supplier registered themselves for value added tax.
TaxRegistrationCountryCode.title: Country

TaxRegistrationNumber.description: Identification number for value added tax that some countries use, such as countries in the European Union.
TaxRegistrationNumber.title: Tax Registration Number

TaxReportingName.description: Name of tax reporting for a supplier who is reportable for income tax to the Internal Revenue Service in the United States.
TaxReportingName.title: Tax Reporting Name

TaxpayerCountry.description: Country where the supplier organization that is responsible for taxation resides.
TaxpayerCountry.title: Taxpayer Country

TaxpayerCountryCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the country where the supplier organization that is responsible for taxation is located.

TaxpayerId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier for taxation purposes.
TaxpayerId.title: Taxpayer ID

TaxpayerIdExistsFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then a value exists for the taxpayer identifier. If false, then value does not exist for the taxpayer identifier. This flag is not updatable. The default value is false.
TaxpayerIdExistsFlag.title: Taxpayer ID Exists

UseWithholdingTaxFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the withholding tax is applicable to the supplier. If false, then withholding tax is not applicable. The default value is false.
UseWithholdingTaxFlag.title: Use withholding tax

VerificationDate.description: Date when the supplier most recently received the 1099 tax verification.
VerificationDate.title: Verification Date

WithholdingTaxGroup.description: Withholding tax group that the application assigned to the supplier.
WithholdingTaxGroup.title: Withholding Tax Group

WithholdingTaxGroupId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the tax group in which supplier is classified for withholding the tax.

YearEstablished.description: Year when the supplier established themselves.
YearEstablished.title: Year Established

YearIncorporated.description: Year when the supplier incorporated themselves.
YearIncorporated.title: Year Incorporated

addresses.description: The Addresses resource manages supplier addresses.
addresses.title: Addresses

attachments.description: The Attachments resource manages attachments for a supplier.
attachments.title: Attachments

businessClassifications.description: The Business Classifications resource manages supplier business classifications.
businessClassifications.title: Business Classifications

contacts.description: The Contacts resource manages supplier contacts.
contacts.title: Contacts

globalDFF.description: The Global Flexfields for Suppliers resource manages supplier global descriptive flexfields.
globalDFF.title: Global Flexfields for Suppliers

productsAndServices.description: The Products and Services resource manages supplier products and services.
productsAndServices.title: Products and Services

sites.description: The Supplier Sites resource manages supplier sites.
sites.title: Sites

Header.description: Values that represent the sales order or quote header, sales agreement header, or contract header.

ManualPriceAdjustment.description: Values that represent the manual price adjustments provided by consumers to be applied within the pricing process.

PricingMessage.description: Contains one instance for each pricing error found on the transaction.

PricingServiceParameter.description: Values that the calling applications send to Oracle Pricing Cloud. These attributes also store the output status of the pricing process.

PricingTerm.description: Values that represent the various promotions or contracts, or other terms applied to the transaction. These attributes are only for input.

AccumulationComponent.description: Values that describe the accumulation component.

Line.description: Values that represent the sales order or quote line, sales agreement line, or contract line.

Charge.description: Values that represent a charge calculated within the pricing process or a charge that is passed to Pricing by consuming applications.

CoverageAssociation.description: Values that represent the association between a coverage line and its covered item for a service duration.

LineAttribute.description: Values that store the transaction item attributes. This attribute is used only for input.

ChargeComponent.description: Values that store the price elements for each charge applied within the pricing process.

TaxLineDetail.description: Values that store the details of tax lines for charge components.

ChangeSummary.description: Values that store the summary of the changes.

AccumulationBasisId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the accumulation basis.

AccumulationDeltaValue.description: Difference in accumulation value due to current set of lines contribution for the accumulation.

AccumulationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the accumulation.

AccumulationValueUnitCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit for the accumulation value.

ItemId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the item.

ItemLevelCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the item level. Valid values include ITEM or ITEM_CATEGORY.

ItemUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure for the item.

SourceTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the source type of the accumulation.

SourceIdentifier1.description: Value that uniquely identifies an entity for the accumulation source. For example, Sales Agreement Header ID or Promotion Header ID.

SourceIdentifier2.description: Value that uniquely identifies an entity for the accumulation source. For example, Sales Agreement Line ID.

SourceIdentifier3.description: Value that uniquely identifies an entity for the accumulation source. For example, Sales Agreement Major Version ID.

SourceIdentifier4.description: Value that uniquely identifies an entity for the accumulation source. For example, Sales Agreement Status.

SourceIdentifier5.description: Value that uniquely identifies an entity for the accumulation source.

AllowCurrencyOverrideFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the currency can be overridden. If false, then the currency cannot be overridden. The default value is false.

AppliedCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency to be used as the default header currency.

BillToCustomerAccountSiteUseId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the bill to customer account site. This attribute is used in tax calculations.

BillingThirdPartyAccountId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the billing third-party account. This attribute is used in tax calculations.

BillingThirdPartyAccountName.description: Name of the third-party account that pricing uses in tax calculations for billing.

BillingThirdPartyAccountNumber.description: Number that identifies the third-party account that pricing uses in tax calculations for billing.

BillingThirdPartyAccountSiteId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the billing third-party account site. This attribute is used in tax calculations.

BillingThirdPartyAccountSiteNumber.description: Number that identifies the third-party account that pricing uses in tax calculations for billing.

CalculatePricingChargesFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then calculate price charges for a line item. If false, then do not calculate price charges for a line item. The default value is true.

CalculateShippingChargesFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then evaluate shipping-related charges for the document. If false, then do not evaluate shipping-related charges for the document. The default value is true.

CalculateTaxFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: Y or N. If Y, then call Oracle Fusion Tax to derive tax amounts for the lines on the document. If N, then do not call Oracle Fusion Tax to derive tax amounts for the lines on the document. The default value is Y.

CustomerId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the sold-to customer.

CustomerName.description: Name of the customer. The Party Name in customer data management provides this name.

CustomerNumber.description: Number that identifies the customer. The Party Number in customer data management provides this number.

CustomerTypeCode.description: Indicates whether customer is internal or external.

DefaultCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the default currency. This attribute retains the original currency returned for the strategy.

EndCustomerId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the customer who receives the item.

EndCustomerName.description: Name of the customer who receives the item. The Party Name in Customer Data Management provides this name.

EndCustomerNumber.description: Number that identifies the customer who receives the item. The Party Number in Customer Data Management provides this number.

FulfillmentGeographyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the fulfillment geography. This value will either be null (initially), or specified (from sales order).

HeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the header.

InternalOrganizationLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the internal organization location.

LedgerId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the ledger.

OverrideCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the override currency. If AllowCurrencyOverrideFlag is set to Y on the strategy,  OverrideCurrencyCode will replace the AppliedCurrencyCode. If AllowCurrencyOverrideFlag is set to N on the strategy, this value will not be used to replace the AppliedCurrencyCode.

PopulateCoverageLineChargesFlag.description: Determines whether the coverage line charges need to be populated or not. Contains one of the following values: true or false. The default value is false.

PriceValidFrom.description: Date from when the price is valid.

PriceValidUntil.description: Date until when the price is valid.

PricedOn.description: Date when the document is priced. This attribute stores the application date at the beginning of a pricing process.

PricingSegmentCode.description: Value that stores either the pricing segment code sent from the caller or the pricing segment code derived by the pricing engine.

PricingSegmentExplanation.description: Message that states the reason for applying the pricing segment.

PricingStrategyExplanation.description: Message that states the reason for applying the pricing strategy.

PricingStrategyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the pricing strategy. This attribute stores either the pricing strategy identifier sent from the caller or the pricing strategy identifier derived by the pricing engine.

PricingStrategyName.description: Name of the pricing strategy. The caller provides the name or pricing determines the name.

RoundingBillToPartyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the bill-to party used for rounding in tax calculations.

RoundingBillToPartyName.description: Name that identifies the bill-to party to use when rounding a number during a tax calculation.

RoundingBillToPartyNumber.description: Number that identifies the bill-to party to use when rounding a number during a tax calculation.

RoundingBillToPartySiteId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the bill-to party site used for rounding in tax calculations.

RoundingBillToPartySiteNumber.description: Number that identifies the bill-to party site to use when rounding a number during a tax calculation.

RoundingShipToPartyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the ship-to party used for rounding in tax calcuations.

RoundingShipToPartyName.description: Name that identifies the ship-to party to use when rounding a number during a tax calculation.

RoundingShipToPartyNumber.description: Number that identifies the ship-to party to use when rounding a number during a tax calculation.

SalesChannelCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the sales channel.

SalesSubChannelCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the subgroup within a channel that initiated the order. For example, for the Web channel this attribute contains the name of the web-site.

SellingBusinessUnitId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the selling business unit.

SellingBusinessUnitName.description: Name of the selling business unit.

SellingLegalEntityId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the selling legal entity.

SellingLegalEntityIdentifier.description: Value that uniquely identifies the selling legal entity that pricing uses for tax calculations.

TotalGroupEntityCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the group entity.

TotalUsageCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the total usage.

TransactionTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the transaction type, whether it is a quote, an order, and so on. This information is used in determining which pricing process to invoke.

PSTHeaderType.description: Values that represent the sales order or quote header, sales agreement header, or contract header.

AdjustmentCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the currency of manual price adjustments such as price overrides and amount-based adjustments.

AdjustmentTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the adjustment types including price override, % discount, % markup, amount discount , and amount markup.

AdjustmentValue.description: Value that is the adjustment amount for amount-based adjustment or the discount or markup percent value for percentage-based adjustment.

BasisElementCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the basis to calculate percentage based discount or markup. Values include LIST_PRICE, or NET_PRICE, which are the price element codes of type Price.

ChargeDefinitionCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the charge definition to which the manual price adjustment is applied.

ChargeDefinitionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the charge definition to which the manual price adjustment is applied.

ChargeParentEntityCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the parent entity of the charge to which the manual price adjustment will be applied to. Values include LINE.

ChargeParentEntityId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the parent entity of the charge to which the manual price adjustment will be applied to. Values include the value of line.id (or lineCoverage.id) to which the manual price adjustment needs to be applied.

ChargeRollupFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then manual price adjustment is applied to the charge. If false, then manual price adjustment is not applied to the charge. The default value is false.

ManualPriceAdjustmentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the manual price adjustment.

PricePeriodicityCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the price periodicity of the charge to be applied for manual price adjustment.

ReasonCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the reason for applying a manual price adjustment.

SequenceNumber.description: Number that indicates the order of applying manual price adjustments in case of multiple records.

ValidFrom.description: Date from when manual adjustment is effective.

ValidUntil.description: Date until when manual adjustment is effective.

PSTManualPriceAdjustmentType.description: Values that represent the manual price adjustments passed in by consumers to be applied within the pricing process.

HeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the header.

MessageSourceCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the source of the message.

MessageText.description: Text describing the nature of the error that occurred.

MessageTypeCode.description: Value that indicates the type of message. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type FND.

ParentEntityCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the parent entity of the error. Values include Line, Charge, and so on.

ParentEntityId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the parent entity on which the error occurred.

PricingMessageId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the error.

PSTPricingMessageType.description: Contains one instance for each pricing error found on the transaction.

CalculateToPriceElement.description: Value that determines which price element is calculated up to by the pricing engine. Value of this attribute is the element code for a price element of type Price or Margin. Values include List Price, Net Price, Margin, and so on. This attribute is currently used by Oracle Fusion Contracts.

IterateFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then iterate. If false, then do not iterate. The default value is false.

OutputStatus.description: Value that indicates the output status. Values include Success or Error.

PerformValueIdConversionsFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then convert value to identifier or convert identifier to value. If false, then do not convert. The default value is false.

PopulateCoverageLineChargesFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then populate the charges for coverage line. If false, then do not populate the charges for coverage line. The default value is false.

PricingContext.description: Value that identifies the calling application. Valid values are SALES and MATERIAL_TRANSFER.

ProcessingMessage.description: Message generated for the transaction when the output status is set to Error.

PSTPricingServiceParameterType.description: Value that the calling applications send to Oracle Pricing Cloud. This attribute also stores the output status of the pricing process

ApplyToEntityCode.description: Value that identifies the entity to which the pricing term will be applied. Valid value is LINE.

ApplyToEntityId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the entity the term will be applied to.

PricingTermId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the PricingTermSDO entity. This is a primary key.

SourceIdentifierId1.description: Optional. Value that uniquely identifies the entity for a pricing term. For example, sales agreement header identifier or promotion header identifier.

SourceIdentifierId2.description: Optional. Value that uniquely identifies the entity for a pricing term. For example, sales agreement line identifier or promotion line identifier.

SourceIdentifierId3.description: Optional. Value that uniquely identifies the entity for a pricing term. For example, sales agreement major version identifier.

SourceIdentifierId4.description: Optional. Value that uniquely identifies the entity for a pricing term. For example, sales agreement status.

SourceIdentifierId5.description: Optional. Value that uniquely identifies the entity for a pricing term. For example, to support a key that includes more than one part.

SourceName.description: Name of the source of an entity for a pricing term. For example, Sales Agreement or Promotion.

SourceTypeCode.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source code of an entity for a pricing term. For example, SALES_AGREEMENT or PROMOTION.

TermId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the term defined in the promotion or sales agreement.

PSTPricingTermType.description: Values that represent the various promotions or contracts, or other terms applied to the transaction. These parameters are only for input.

AccumulationComponentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the accumulation component.

AccumulationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the accumulation.

ContributionDeltaValue.description: Value that is the difference between the previous contribution and the current contribution.

ContributionValue.description: Value that is the contribution for the unit.

ContributionValueUnitCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit for the contribution value.

ParentEntityCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the parent entity.

ParentEntityId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the parent entity.

PSTAccumulationComponentType.description: Values that describe the accumulation component.

AllowCurrencyOverrideFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then currency can be overridden. If false, then currency cannot be overridden. The default value is false.

AllowPriceListUpdateFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the previously selected price list can be changed to a different price list. If false, then previously selected price list cannot be changed. The default value is false.

AppliedPriceListId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the price list applied.

AppliedShippingChargeListId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the shipping charge list that pricing applied.

AssessableValueCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency of the assessable value.

AssessableValueOverrideFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the user entered a value for AssessableValue. If false, then user didn't enter a value.

BillFromLocationAddress1.description: First line of the bill-from location address.

BillFromLocationAddress2.description: Second line of the bill-from location address.

BillFromLocationAddress3.description: Third line of the bill-from location address.

BillFromLocationAddress4.description: Fourth line of the bill-from location address.

BillFromLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the bill-from location.

BillFromLocationPostalCode.description: Postal code of the bill-from location.

BillToLocationAddress1.description: First line of the bill-to location address.

BillToLocationAddress2.description: Second line of the bill-to location address.

BillToLocationAddress3.description: Third line of the bill-to location address.

BillToLocationAddress4.description: Fourth line of the bill-to location address.

BillToLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the bill-to location.

BillToLocationPostalCode.description: Postal code of the bill-to location.

BillToPartyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the bill-to party.

BillToPartyName.description: Name that identifies the bill-to party.

BillToPartyNumber.description: Number that identifies the bill-to party.

BillToPartySiteId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the bill-to party site.

BillToPartySiteNumber.description: Number that identifies the bill-to party site.

ComponentIdPath.description: Value that uniquely identifies the hierarchical path of the component items. The attribute value contains the root model item identifier to the immediate parent inventory item identifier separated by the delimiter >.

ComponentPath.description: Value that identifies the hierarchical path of the component items. The attribute value contains the root model item to the immediate parent inventory item number separated by the delimiter >.

DefaultCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the default currency code for the line.

DefaultPriceListId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the default price list.

DefaultTaxationCountry.description: Value that specifies the country of taxation for tax calculation purposes.

DocumentSubType.description: Classification used for both tax calculation and tax reporting depending upon the requirements of different countries.

ExemptionControlCode.description: Value that controls the application of exemptions to the transaction line during tax lines calculation.

FinalDischargeLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the location of the final destination for purchases made by a customer, and is applicable to all transactions at line level.

FirstPartyTaxRegistration.description: Tax registration that the first-party organization uses for the transaction.

FirstPartyTaxRegistrationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the tax registration that the first party organization used for a transaction.

FOBCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the freight on board.

FulfillmentGeographyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the fulfillment geography.

HeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the header reference for the line.

IntendedUseClassificationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the classification purpose for which a product is used in a business by the purchaser.

IntendedUseClassificationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the classification that describes how the purchaser intends to use the item.

InventoryItemId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the item to be priced.

InventoryItemNumber.description: Number of the item that pricing must price.

InventoryOrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the inventory organization for the item.

InventoryOrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the inventory organization that the item number references.

LineCategoryCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the category of the line.

LineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the line.

LineQuantityUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the requested unit of measure.

LineTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the action performed when the order line is fulfilled.

OverrideCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the override currency. If the AllowCurrencyOverride flag is set to true on the pricing strategy, the value of this attribute is used as the default currency for any non-overridden currency on charges and totals.

OverridePriceListId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the override price list. If allowed by pricing, this is the price list that the user selects to override the price to for a particular line item.

OverridePriceListName.description: Name of the price list the user selects to override the price for a line item. Pricing uses this attribute only if a price list override is allowed.

PooLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the location that initiates or negotiates a sales order for products and services. This value represents the point of order origin location.

PooPartyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the party that initiates or negotiates a sales order for products and services. This value represents the point of order origin party identifier.

PooPartyName.description: Name of the party where the order originated from.

PooPartyNumber.description: Number that identifies the point of order origin party. This party starts or negotiates a sales order for an item.

PriceAsOf.description: Value that is used to compare effectivities on pricing setups. The caller can default header priceAsOf to lines.

PriceValidFrom.description: Date from when the price is valid.

PriceValidUntil.description: Date until when the price is valid.

PricedOn.description: Date when the line is priced. This attribute will be populated with the application date at the beginning of a pricing process.

PricingStrategyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the pricing strategy applied on this line.

PricingStrategyName.description: Name of the pricing strategy that pricing applied on this line.

ProductCategory.description: Classification of products as product categories for tax purposes.

ProductFiscalClassificationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the classification of products based on the inventory item category for tax purposes.

ProductType.description: Classification of products as product types for tax purposes.

ReferenceLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the order line to be used as reference in returns pricing processing.

ReturnReasonCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the return reason code.

RootCoverageLineId.description: Number which indicates the root coverage line.

RootLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the top most root line.

RoundingBillToPartyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the rounding bill-to party.

RoundingBillToPartyName.description: Name that identifies the rounding bill-to party.

RoundingBillToPartyNumber.description: Number that identifies the rounding bill-to party.

RoundingShipToPartyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the rounding ship-to party.

RoundingShipToPartyName.description: Name that identifies the rounding ship-to party.

RoundingShipToPartyNumber.description: Number that identifies the rounding ship-to party.

ServiceEndDate.description: Date when the service is terminated.

ServiceDurationPeriodCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the service duration period.

ShipFromLocationAddress1.description: First line of the ship-from location address.

ShipFromLocationAddress2.description: Second line of the ship-from location address.

ShipFromLocationAddress3.description: Third line of the ship-from location address.

ShipFromLocationAddress4.description: Fourth line of the ship-from location address.

ShipFromLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the ship-from location.

ShipFromLocationPostalCode.description: Postal code of the ship-from location.

ShipFromOrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the organization from where the goods are shipped.

ShipFromOrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the organization from where logistics ships the goods.

ShipFromPartyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the ship-from party.

ShipFromPartyName.description: Name that identifies the ship-from party.

ShipFromPartyNumber.description: Number that identifies the ship-from party.

ShipFromPartySiteId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the ship-from party site.

ShipFromPartySiteNumber.description: Number that identifies the ship-from party site.

ShipMethodId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the shipping method such as UPS-Parcel-Ground used for transfer of goods from one destination to another.

ShipMethodCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the shipping method, such as overnight. Logistics uses this method to transfer goods from one destination to another destination.

ShipSetName.description: Group of sales order lines that need to ship together from their common origin to a common destination.

ShipToLocationAddress1.description: First line of the ship-to location address.

ShipToLocationAddress2.description: Second line of the ship-to location address.

ShipToLocationAddress3.description: Third line of the ship-to location address.

ShipToLocationAddress4.description: Fourth line of the ship-to location address.

ShipToLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the ship-to location.

ShipToLocationPostalCode.description: Postal code of the ship-to location.

ShipToPartyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the ship-to party.

ShipToPartyName.description: Name that identifies the ship-to party.

ShipToPartyNumber.description: Number that identifies the ship-to party.

ShipToPartySiteId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the ship-to party site.

ShipToPartySiteNumber.description: Number that identifies the ship-to party site.

ShipToSiteUseId.description: Address of the person or organization party where the goods are being sent.

SkipShippingChargesFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then evaluate line level shipping-related charges. If false, then do not evaluate line level shipping-related charges. The default value is false.

TaxClassificationCode.description: Value that indicates the tax codes or groups defined in Oracle Fusion Payables.

TaxExemptionCertificateNumber.description: Number that uniquely identifies the certificate number for tax exemption. You can use this value with the tax exemption reason code to handle tax exemption.

TaxExemptionReasonCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the tax exemption reason. You can use this value with the tax exemption certificate number to handle tax exemption.

ThirdPartyTaxRegistrationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the tax registration number used by the third party involved in the transaction.

ThirdPartyTaxRegistrationNumber.description: Tax registration that the third-party organization uses for the transaction.

TradingHQLocationAddress1.description: First line of the trading headquarters location address.

TradingHQLocationAddress2.description: Second line of the trading headquarters location address.

TradingHQLocationAddress3.description: Third line of the trading headquarters location address.

TradingHQLocationAddress4.description: Fourth line of the trading headquarters location address.

TradingHQLocationCity.description: City of the trading headquarters location.

TradingHQLocationCountry.description: Country of the trading headquarters location.

TradingHQLocationCounty.description: County of the trading headquarters location.

TradingHQLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the trading headquarters location.

TradingHQLocationPostalCode.description: Postal code of the trading headquarters location.

TradingHQLocationProvince.description: Province of the trading headquarters location.

TradingHQLocationState.description: State of the trading headquarters location.

TradingHQPartySiteId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the trading headquarters party site.

TradingHQPartySiteNumber.description: Number that identifies the site where the trading headquarters party resides.

TransactionBusinessCategory.description: Classifies a transaction for tax purposes, as required by a tax authority.

UserDefinedFiscalClassificationCode.description: Value that identifies the additional classification of a transaction for tax purpose, as required by a tax authority.

PSTLineType.description: Values that represent the sales order or quote line, sales agreement line, or contract line.

CanAdjustFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the price can be discounted. If false, then the price cannot be discounted. The default value is false.

ChargeAppliesTo.description: Value that indicates the type of charge. Valid values include Price, Return, or Shipping.

ChargeDefinitionCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the pricing charge definition.

ChargeDefinitionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the charge definition entity.

ChargeId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the charge.

ChargeSubtypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the subtype of a given charge type.

ChargeTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the type of a given charge.

CoverageDurationUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the unit of measure of the coverage duration.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency used in the charge.

EstimatedPricedQuantityFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the priced quantity is an estimated number. If false, then the priced quantity is not an estimated number. The default value is false.

EstimatedUnitPriceFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the unit price is an estimated number. If false, then the unit price is not an estimated number. The default value is false.

LineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the order line.

ParentEntityCode.description: Value that indicate the parent entity of the charge. Values include Line and Line Coverage.

ParentEntityId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the parent entity of the charge.

PricePeriodicityCode.description: Value that indicates periodicity for both recurring and recurring usage price types.

PriceTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the price type of a given charge.

PricedQuantityUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the unit of measure of the priced quantity.

PrimaryFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the charge is the primary charge. If false, then the charge is not the primary charge. The default value is false.

RollupFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then mark a charge as a rollup or aggregate charge. If false, then do not mark a charge as a rollup or aggregate charge. The default value is false.

SequenceNumber.description: Number that indicates the sequence for the charge.

SourceChargeId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source charge created by an external pricing engine.

TaxIncludedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the charge includes tax. If false, then the charge does not include tax. The default value is false.

UsagePeriodCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the period of usage.

UsageUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the unit of measure of usage.

PSTChargeType.description: Values that represent a charge calculated within the pricing process or a charge that is passed to Oracle Pricing Cloud by consuming applications.

ActionCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the action to be performed for the coverage association.

AllowPriceListUpdateFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then a previously selected price list can be changed to a different price list. If false, then a previously selected price list cannot be changed to a different price list. The default value is false.

AppliedPriceListId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the price list applied for the coverage association.

AssociationParentLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the line that represents the covered item for percentage-based coverage pricing rules.

CoverageAssociationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the coverage association. This value is required.

CoverageDurationEndDate.description: Date when the coverage association ends. This value is required to be sent on the association line.

CoverageDurationStartDate.description: Date when the coverage association started. This value is required to be sent on the association line for current logic.

CoverageDurationUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure code used to price the coverage association for the coverage duration.

CoveredInventoryItemId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the inventory item of the covered item or covered asset for the coverage association.

CoveredInventoryItemNumber.description: Number that indicates the inventory item of the covered item or the covered asset for the coverage association.

CoveredItemUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the asset or covered item unit of measure for the coverage association.

CoverageLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the line of the coverage item for which coverage association is specified. This is a required attribute.

DefaultCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the default currency for the coverage association.

DefaultPriceListId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the default price list for the coverage association. This is a required attribute.

OverridePriceListId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the override price list. If allowed by pricing, refers to the identifier of a price list used to override price for a specific coverage association.

OverridePriceListName.description: Name of the price list the user selects to override the price for a line item. Pricing uses this attribute only if a price list override is allowed.

PriceAsOf.description: Value that is used to compare effectivities on pricing setups. The caller can default header priceAsOf to coverage association.

PSTCoverageAssociationType.description: Values that represent the association between a coverage line and its covered item for a service duration.

AttributeId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transactional item attribute.

DataTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the data type of the transactional item attribute. Valid values include N for number, S for character, D for date, or T for date and time.

DateValue.description: Value of the transactional item attribute when the datatype is Date.

HeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the header.

InternalName.description: Internal name of the transactional item attribute.

LineAttributeId.description: Value that uniquely identifies line attribute.

NumberValue.description: Value of the transactional item attribute when the datatype is Number and the validation type is Format Only. If the validation type is Dependent or Independent, then NumberValue represents the nontranslated ValueCode of the value set member.

TimestampValue.description: Value of the transactional item attribute when the datatype is Timestamp.

VarcharValue.description: Value of the transactional item attribute when the datatype is Character and the validation type is Format Only. If the validation type is Dependent or Independent, then VarcharValue represents the nontranslated ValueCode of the value set member.

PSTLineAttributeType.description: Values that store the transaction item attributes. This attribute is used only for input.

AggregateChargeComponentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the aggregate charge component on the roll-up charge. This attribute is used to model a many-to-one relationship between the charge components of a native charge and the roll-up charge.

ChargeComponentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the charge component.

ChargeId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the charge on which price or adjustment is applied.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency used in the charge component. This attribuite is required for service standardization.

Explanation.description: Message that is displayed in a price breakdown or price waterfall user interface.

HeaderCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the header currency. This attribute is required to service standardization.

PercentOfComparisonElement.description: Percentage that this unit price is of the basis charge component unit price. By default the basis is the List Price. This attribute captures the Margin %, the % the Net Price is of the List Price, and so on.

PriceElementCode.description: Value that identifies the element reference to the price elements setup. For example, LISTPRICE, NETPRICE, and so on.

PriceElementUsageCode.description: Value that is used by consuming applications to indicate how the charge component will be used. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type QP.

RollupFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then mark a charge component as a rollup or aggregate value for the charge component price element code. If false, then do not mark a charge component as a rollup or aggregate value for the charge component price element code. The default value is false.

SequenceNumber.description: Number that identifies the sequence for the charge component.

SourceChargeComponentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source charge component created by an external pricing engine.

SourceChargeId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source charge created by an external pricing engine.

SourceId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the lowest level pricing source; for example, price list line, tier rule, CP rule, formula, AP, shipping line, and so on.

SourceParentChargeComponentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source of the parent charge component.

SourceTypeCode.description: Type of the Pricing source; for example, Segment Price List Line, and so on. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type QP_ENTITY_TYPES and manually adjusted.

TaxIncludedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the tax is included for a given charge component. If false, then the tax is not included for a given charge component. The default value is false.

PSTChargeComponentType.description: Values that store the price elements for each charge applied within the pricing process.

ChargeComponentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the charge component.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency code for a tax line.

HeaderCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the header currency.

TaxAmountInclusiveFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then a tax line contains inclusive taxes. If false, then a tax line does not contain inclusive taxes. The default value is false.

TaxCode.description: Value that indicates the tax code of a tax regime. A tax is a classification of charge imposed by government through a fiscal or tax authority.

TaxExemptionCertificateNumber.description: Number that uniquely identifies the certificate number for tax exemption. You can use it with the tax exemption reason code to handle tax exemption.

TaxExemptionReasonCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the tax exemption reason. You can use it with the Tax Exemption Certificate Number to handle tax exemption.

TaxJurisdictionCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the tax jurisdiction for a tax line.

TaxLineDetailId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the tax line detail.

TaxRate.description: Value that indicates the tax rate for a tax line.

TaxRateId.description: Number that uniquely identifies the tax rate.

TaxRateCode.description: Value that indicates the tax rate for a tax line. Values include the tax rates defined for tax regime, tax, tax status, and, if applicable, tax jurisdiction.

TaxRegimeCode.description: Value that indicates the tax regime code. A tax regime is the set of tax rules that determines the treatment of one or more taxes administered by a tax authority.

TaxStatusCode.description: Value that indicates the tax status for a tax line, which is the tax status defined for the tax regime and tax.

PSTTaxLineDetailType.description: Values that store the details of tax lines for charge components.

PSTChangeSummaryType.description: Values that store the summary of the changes.

OrderNumber.description: Number that identifies the sales order. The profile Retain Sales Order Number For Orchestration Order Number determines whether to use the source transaction number as the order number for each imported source order. If you use the source transaction number as the order number, then this transaction number must be unique in the source application.
OrderNumber.title: Orchestration Order

CreationDate.description: Date and time when the user added the sales order.
CreationDate.title: Creation Date

SourceTransactionNumber.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transaction in the source application. The source application assigns this value as the order number. If your implementation interfaces to a quote and converts the quote to a sales order, then this attribute references the quote number.
SourceTransactionNumber.title: Source Order

SourceTransactionSystem.description: Source system that created the order. You use the Manage Trading Community Source Systems and Manage Upstream and Fulfillment Source Systems tasks to setup the source application.
SourceTransactionSystem.title: Source Order System

SourceTransactionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transaction in the source application. If the source application does not contain a unique value for the transaction, then you can set this attribute to a user key that the source application contains, such as an order number or quote number. The application uses this attribute and the source transaction to uniquely identify the transaction and create the composite key for a change order. You must make sure that each change order uses the same value that the new sales order used.

TransactionalCurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency that pricing used to price the transaction.
TransactionalCurrencyCode.title: Currency

TransactionalCurrencyName.description: Name of the currency that pricing used to price the transaction.

TransactionTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the type of transaction. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_DOO_ORDER_TYPES. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Order Lookups task.
TransactionTypeCode.title: Order Type

TransactionType.description: Name of the type of sales order.

OrderKey.description: Value that uniquely identifies the sales order. This value is derived by concatenating the value of SourceOrderSystem, a colon, and the value of SourceOrderId. For orders created through the application, the SourceOrderId is same as the HeaderId. For example, if SourceOrderSystem is LEG and SourceOrderId is R13_Sample_Order, the value of this attribute is LEG:R13_Sample_Order.

Comments.description: Comments that the user enters on the sales order.

BuyingPartyContactId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the person who placed the sales order or the sold-to contact to contact for the sales order.

BusinessUnitName.description: Name of the business unit that sold the sales order.

BuyingPartyName.description: Name of the person or organization party who placed the sales order. This value identifies the sold-to customer. This points to the party name with usage of CUSTOMER.

BuyingPartyId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the sold-to customer. This value contains the person, company, or organization who placed the sales order. This value references the party identifier with usage of CUSTOMER.

PackingInstructions.description: Text that describes how to pack the item.

ShippingInstructions.description: Text that includes details about how to ship the item.

PartialShipAllowedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then ship items on the sales order in more than one shipment. If false, then do not ship these items in one shipment. The default value is false.
PartialShipAllowedFlag.title: Allow Split Shipments

FreezePriceFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then price the sales order. If false, then do not price. The default value is true.

FreezeShippingChargeFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then recalculate shipping charges for the sales order. If false, then do not recalculate. The default value is true.

FreezeTaxFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then calculate taxes for the sales. If false, then do not calculate. The default value is true.

SubmittedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the application validated and submitted the sales order. If false, then the application did not validate and submit. The sales order is in draft status. The default value is false.

CustomerPONumber.description: Number that the customer sends for this purchase order.
CustomerPONumber.title: Purchase Order

RequestedShipDate.description: Date when the customer requested to ship the item.

ShippingMode.description: Mode of shipping that delivers the item. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type WSH_MODE_OF_TRANSPORT. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the V task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

RequestingBusinessUnitId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the business unit who requested the sales order. Assign a business unit for each role to each user to provide access to data in the business unit.

RequestingLegalEntityId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the legal entity who formed a contract with the customer. The contracting party on the order is the legal entity.

RequestedFulfillmentOrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the organization that ships the shipment.

RequestedFulfillmentOrganizationName.description: Name of the organization that ships the shipment.

SalesChannel.description: Name of the sales channel. For example, web or phone. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_QP_CHANNEL_METHODS.

SalesChannelCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the sales channel. For example, web or phone. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_QP_CHANNEL_METHODS.

PaymentTerms.description: Payment terms to apply to collect payment. Review and update the value for this attribute using the Setup and Maintenance work area, and the Manage Receivables Payment Terms task. To collect data for this attribute, use the Collect Order Reference Data task for Fusion Source.

TransactionOn.description: Date and time when the transaction started. The date occurs when the customer commits to purchase the items that the sales order contains. The date can occur in the past or future, depending on when the customer placed the sales order.
TransactionOn.title: Ordered Date

TransactionCategoryCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies whether the line is a return. Values include RETURN or ORDER.

ShipSetName.description: Group of order lines in the sales order that must ship together from one location to one destination, and that use the same scheduled ship date.

PartialShipAllowedFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then ship items in the sales order in more than one shipment. If false, then ship items in the sales order in one shipment. The default value is false.

Value.description: The taxable amount in the currency that the sales order uses. The value is either the list price, or the net price, or a value that the user enters. The value is an extended amount.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency of the assessable value.

Value.description: Value that is the rolled-up quantity for configured products. This is the same as the line requested quantity for simple products, but is a product of the requested quantity of the component and its ancestors for a configurable product component.

UomCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure.

Value.description: Value that is the quantity requested to be priced. In the case of a configurable product component, the RequestedQuantity should be a relative quantity. In the case of simple products, value of RequestedQuantity equals the value of ExtendedQuantity.

UomCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure.

Value.description: Value that indicates the unit quantity per root model for the lines of a configuration.

UomCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure.

Value.description: Number that indicates the duration of the service.

Value.description: Number that indicates the duration of the coverage.

Value.description: Unit price amount derived from a matching floor price list on the strategy for the current transaction.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency.

Value.description: Number that indicates the quantity to be priced.

UomCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the unit of measure.

PSTChargeType_PricedQuantity.description:
If price type equals usage or recurring usage, -If "IsPerUnitUsage? = TRUE, pricedQuantity = Estimated Usage Quantity * Line.Requested Quantity for simple products, pricedQuantity = Estimated Usage Quantity * Line.ExtendedQuantity for CP
  -If  ?IsPerUnitUsage? = FALSE, pricedQuantity = Estimated Usage Quantity
  If price type is not usage nor recurring usage,   PricedQuantity = Line.RequestedQuantity for simple products, PricedQuantity = Estimated Usage Quantity * Line.ExtendedQuantity for CP

Value.description: Number that indicates the asset or covered item quantity covered for the coverage association.

UomCode.description: Abbreviation that indicates the unit of measure.

Value.description: Number that indicates the coverage extended amount used for the entire service duration of a coverage association.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency.

Value.description: Value that indicates the extended amount in line currency. Extended amount equals the unit price multiplied by the line requested quantity for simple products and equals the unit price multiplied by the line extended quantity for configurable products. If either isEstimatedPricedQuantity or isEstimatedUnitPrice is set to Y, the extended amount will be an estimated amount.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency.

Value.description: Number that indicates the coverage extended amount in the header currency for the entire service duration of a coverage association.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency.

Value.description: Extended amount for the header currency.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency.

Value.description: Number that indicates the unit price in header currency.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency.

Value.description: Value that is the price or adjustment per unit in the charge currency for the line unit of measure.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency.

Value.description: Amount of the calculated taxable basis, expressed in the header currency. The calculated taxable basis is equivalent to the list price or net price.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency.

Value.description: Tax for each unit for each charge, expressed in the header currency. This tax equals the tax rate multiplied by the value of the HeaderCurrencyTaxableAmount attribute.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the tax for each unit for each charge, expressed in the header currency. This tax equals the tax rate multiplied by the value of the HeaderCurrencyTaxableAmount attribute.

Value.description: Tax for each unit for each charge. This tax equals the tax rate multiplied by the value of the TaxableAmount attribute.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency.

Value.description: Amount of the calculated taxable basis, expressed in the charge currency. The calculated taxable basis is equivalent to the list price or net price.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency.

dependency.description:
This parameter specifies dependencies which are attributes that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The attributes specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the attributes will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency attributes. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

expand.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

fields.description:
This parameter filters the resource attributes. Only the specified attributes are returned, which means that if no attributes are specified, no attributes are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource attributes. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2

finder.description:
Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Find part requirement lines according to the specified primary key criteria. Finder Variables:
    • RequirementLineId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the requirement line.

limit.description: This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.

offset.description: Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.

onlyData.description: The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

orderBy.description: This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified attributes.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

q.description:
This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

totalResults.description: The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

dependency.description:
This parameter specifies dependencies which are attributes that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The attributes specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the attributes will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency attributes. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource attributes. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2
