ASNLineNumber.description: Number that identifies the line on the advance shipment notice. Either this attribute or ShipmentLineId must be provided when receiving an advanced shipment notice (ASN).

Amount.description: Receipt amount in the purchase order currency. This attribute is mandatory when creating receipt for a fixed price service purchase order line.

AssessableValue.description: Assessable value of the transaction for taxation purposes. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

AutoTransactCode.description: This attribute is not applicable and should be left blank.

BarcodeLabel.description: Label of the barcode on the product. This attribute is not currently used.

BusinessUnit.description: Name of the business unit. This attribute can be blank for this resource and is derived from the parent transaction.

BusinessUnitId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the business unit. This attribute can be blank for this resource and is derived from the parent transaction.

Comments.description: Text that the used entered when receiving the item.

ConsignedLine.description: Value that indicates whether or not the receiving transaction is for consigned material. If this attribute is blank, the value is derived from the parent transaction. Enter N if returning an owned (once consigned) material. Else, leave this attribute blank.

ContainerNumber.description: Container number. This attribute is not currently used.

CountryOfOriginCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the country of manufacture for this item. This attribute can be blank for this resource.

CreateDebitMemoFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the supplier site of the purchase order is setup to create a debit memo and the receipt (for which return is performed) has a corresponding evaluated receipt settlement (ERS) invoice. If false, then the supplier site of the purchase order is not setup for creating debit memo. The default value is false. This attribute determines whether to create the debit memo. This attribute is applicable only when transaction type is RETURN TO VENDOR.

CreatedBy.description: User who created the interface record for the receipt line request.

CreationDate.description: Date and time when the user created the interface record for receipt line request.

CurrencyCode.description: Receipt amount in the purchase order currency. This attribute is mandatory when creating receipt for a fixed price service purchase order line.

CurrencyConversionDate.description: Date when the currency conversion occurred for the receipt. Use this attribute only for a purchase order receipt where the option on the purchase order schedule is Receipt and the order currency is different from the ledger currency of the receiving organization.

CurrencyConversionRate.description: Currency conversion rate for the receipt. Use this attribute only for a purchase order receipt where the option on the purchase order schedule is Receipt, the order currency is different from the ledger currency of the receiving organization, and the rate type on the purchase order is User.

CustomerId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the customer. This attribute can be blank and the value is derived from the parent transaction.

CustomerItemId.description: Value that the customer uses to uniquely identify the item. This attribute can be blank and the value is derived from the parent transaction.

CustomerItemNumber.description: Number that the customer uses to identify the item. This attribute can be blank and the value is derived from the parent transaction.

CustomerPartyName.description: Name of the customer. This attribute can be blank and the value is derived from the parent transaction.

CustomerPartyNumber.description: Number that uniquely identifies the customer. This attribute can be blank and the value is derived from the parent transaction.

DFF.description: The Flexfields for Receipt Transactions resource manages the information associated with receipt transactions.
DFF.title: Flexfields for Receipt Transactions

DefaultLotsAndSerialNumbersFromASNFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the lots and serial numbers from an advance shipment notice (ASN) or an advance shipment billing notice (ASBN) will be are defaulted when executing a receipt or a put away transaction. If false, then the lots and serial numbers from an advance shipment notice (ASN) or an advance shipment billing notice (ASBN) will not be defaulted when executing a receipt or a put away transaction. The default value is false.

DefaultTaxationCountry.description: Value that indicates the default taxation country. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

DeliverToLocationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the deliver-to location. This attribute is used to derive DeliverTolocationId. If this attribute is blank, the default value from the purchase order distribution or transfer order distribution is used.

DeliverToLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the deliver-to location. If this attribute is blank, the default value from the purchase order distribution or transfer order distribution is used. DeliverToLocationId is mandatory when transaction type is DELIVER and source document code is PO or TRANSFER ORDER and the destination type code of the distribution is EXPENSE.

DeliverToPersonId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the deliver-to person or requester. If this attribute is blank, the default value of the requester specified on the purchase order distribution or transfer order distribution is used.

DeliverToPersonName.description: Name of the deliver-to person or requester. This attribute is used to derive DeliverToPersonId.

DestinationTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the destination type for the receiving transaction. This attribute should be left blank. It will be derived from the source document.

DocumentDistributionNumber.description: Number that identifies the document distribution for the receiving transaction. When receiving a purchase order that has multiple distributions, this attribute is the respective purchase order distribution number. When receiving a purchase order with multiple distributions, this attribute is mandatory.

DocumentFiscalClassification.description: Fiscal classification for the document. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

DocumentLineNumber.description: Number that identifies the document line number for the receipt line request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request. When the source document code is PO (create an ASN, receive a purchase order, or receive an ASN), this attribute is the purchase order line number. When the source document code is INVENTORY, this attribute is the in-transit shipment line number. When the source document code is TRANSFER ORDER, this attribute is the transfer order shipment line number. When the source document code is RMA, this attribute is the return material authorization (RMA) line number. This attribute is mandatory.

DocumentNumber.description: Number that identifies the document for the receipt line request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request. When the source document code is PO (create an ASN, receive a purchase order or an ASN), this attribute is the purchase order number. When the source document code is INVENTORY, this attribute is the in-transit shipment number. When the source document code is TRANSFER ORDER, this attribute is the transfer order shipment number. When the source document code is RMA, this attribute is the return material authorization (RMA) number. This attribute is mandatory.

DocumentShipmentLineNumber.description: Number that identifies the document schedule for the receiving transaction. When the source document code is PO (create an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receive a purchase order, or receive an ASN), this attribute is the purchase order schedule number. When receiving a purchase order or creating an ASN line, this attribute is mandatory.

EmployeeId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the employee who performed the receiving transaction. If this attribute is blank, the value from the parent transaction is used.

EmployeeName.description: Name of the employee who performed the receiving transaction. This attribute is used to derive EmployeeId. If this attribute is blank, the value from the parent transaction is used.

EwayBillDate.description: Date when the electronic waybill was generated. This attribute is not applicable and should be left blank.

EwayBillNumber.description: Number that identifies the electronic waybill provided by supplier for shipment of goods. This attribute is not applicable and should be left blank.

Exception.description: Value that indicates whether or not the receive transaction being created has an exception. If you want to flag the receiving transaction as an exception, populate this attribute with Y. Else, leave it blank.

ExternalSystemPackingUnit.description: License plate number of the external warehouse management application.

ExternalSystemTransactionReference.description: Value that contains reference information for the corresponding transaction in external applications.

FinalDischargeLocationCode.description: Value that indicates the final discharge location. This attribute is used to derive FinalDischargeLocationId. Applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if left blank, defaulted from the parent transaction.

FinalDischargeLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the final discharge location. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

FirstPartyRegistrationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the first party registration. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

FirstPartyRegistrationNumber.description: Number that is used for the first party registration. This attribute is used to derive FirstPartyRegistrationId. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

FromLocator.description: Name of the source locator for the receiving transaction. This attribute is used to derive FromLocatorId. This attribute is applicable for negative corrections or returns and the value is derived from the parent DELIVER transaction. Enter this value if you want to return from a different location than where the material was put away.

FromLocatorId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source locator for the receiving transaction. This attribute is applicable for negative corrections or returns and the value is derived from the parent DELIVER transaction. Enter this value if you want to return from a different location than where the material was put away.

FromOrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the source organization for an interorganization transfer. This is applicable for receipts against in-transit shipment or transfer order shipment.

FromOrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source organization for an in-transit shipment.

FromSubinventory.description: Name of the source subinventory for the receiving transaction. This attribute is applicable for negative corrections or returns and the value is derived from the parent DELIVER transaction. Enter this value if you want to return from a different location than where the material was put away.

GroupId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the group of interface records submitted together for processing.

HeaderInterfaceId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the header interfaced receipt transaction line request.

InsertAndProcessFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the Manage Receiving Transactions API processes the posted interface data automatically and immediately returns the response. If false, then the records are created in interface tables but no processing is done. These interface records can subsequently processed by the Manage Receiving Transactions scheduled process. The default value is true.

InspectionQualityCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the inspection quality. This attribute is applicable only when the transaction type is ACCEPT or REJECT. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type RCV_QUALITY_CODE.

IntendedUse.description: Value that indicates the intended use. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

IntendedUseClassificationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the intended use classification. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

InterfaceSourceCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the source that interfaced the receiving transaction. It can be populated with the source application name.

InterfaceSourceLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the interfaced source line. This can be populated with the identifier of the line in the source application that initiated the receipt.

InterfaceTransactionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the interfaced receipt transaction line request.

ItemDescription.description: Description of the item corresponding to the receipt transaction request. When you create a receipt transaction for a purchase order, it should match the item description of the corresponding purchase order line. For receipt transactions against In-transit shipment, transfer order, and return material authorization (RMA), this attribute should match the description of the inventory item. When creating a receipt transaction, one of the following must be provided: ItemId, ItemNumber, or ItemDescription. If left blank, the value from the source document is used.

ItemId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the inventory item. If left blank, the value from the source document is used. When creating a receipt transaction, one of the following must be provided: ItemId, ItemNumber, or ItemDescription.

ItemNumber.description: Number that identifies the item. This attribute is used to derive ItemId. If blank, the value from the source document is used. When creating a receipt transaction, one of the following must be provided: ItemId, ItemNumber, or ItemDescription.

ItemRevision.description: Revision number of the item. This attribute is mandatory when delivering receipt lines whose item is revision controlled.

LPNId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source license plate number. This attribute can be blank for this resource.

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time when the user most recently updated the interface record for receipt line request.

LastUpdatedBy.description: Login of the user who updated the interface record for receipt line request.

LicensePlateNumber.description: Source license plate number. This attribute can be blank for this resource.

Locator.description: Name of the destination locator for the receiving transaction. This is used to derive LocatorId. This attribute or LocatorId is mandatory when: the transaction type is DELIVER, destination type of the document schedule or document line is Inventory, locator control is predefined or dynamic and item transaction defaults or not entered (if item transaction default exists, it will be derived).

LocatorId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the destination locator for the receiving transaction. This attribute or Locator is mandatory when: the transaction type is DELIVER, destination type of the document schedule or document line is Inventory, locator control is predefined or dynamic and item transaction defaults or not entered (if item transaction default exists, it will be derived).

OrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the receiving organization. This attribute is used to derive OrganizationId. For every receipt transaction request, you must provide one of the following attributes: OrganizationCode or OrganizationId, otherwise the request will fail.

OrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receiving organization. For every receipt transaction request, you must provide one of the following attributes: OrganizationCode or OrganizationId, otherwise the request will fail.

PODistributionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the purchase order distribution. This attribute is applicable when creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receiving a purchase order or an ASN.

POHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the purchase order header. This attribute is applicable when creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receiving a purchase order or an ASN.

POLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the purchase order line. This attribute is applicable when creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receiving a purchase order or an ASN.

POLineLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the purchase order schedule. This attribute is applicable when creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receiving a purchase order or an ASN.

PackingSlip.description: Packing slip number for the container that contains this item. This attribute can be blank for this resource.

ParentSourceTransactionNumber.description: Number that identifies the source transaction number of the parent receiving transaction.

ParentTransactionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the parent receiving transaction. This attribute is mandatory. Without this attribute, inspections, put away, corrections, and returns will not be processed.

PhysicalMaterialReturnRequiredFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then a new return transfer order is created that needs to be shipped to the source organization. If false, then the material is issued to scrap. The default value is false. This attribute determines whether the return against a transfer order requires a physical return of the item. This attribute is applicable only when the transaction type is RETURN TO ORGANIZATION.

PrimaryQuantity.description: Transaction quantity in the primary unit of measure that the item uses.

PrimaryUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the primary unit of measure that the item in the receiving organization uses.

PrimaryUnitOfMeasure.description: Primary unit of measure that the item in the receiving organization uses. This attribute is used to derive PrimaryUOMCode.

ProcessingStatusCode.description: Value that indicates the processing status for the line request. Valid values include PENDING, RUNNING, COMPLETED. The default value is PENDING. Only the interface records with value PENDING will be picked for processing. If there is an error in the derive, default, and validate cycle, the status moves to ERROR. This attribute should be left blank during POST operation so that the default value of PENDING is picked.

ProductCategory.description: Value that indicates the product category. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

ProductFiscalClassName.description: Name used to indicate the product fiscal classification. This attribute is used to derive ProductFiscalClassificationId. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

ProductFiscalClassificationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the product fiscal classification. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

ProductType.description: Value that indicates the product type for taxation purposes. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

Quantity.description: Transaction quantity in the unit of measure that the receipt transaction request uses.

RMALineNumber.description: Line number of the return material authorization (RMA) against which receipt is being created. This attribute is used to derive ReceiptAdviceLineId. This attribute is mandatory when creating receipt for RMA.

RMANumber.description:
Number of the return material authorization (RMA) against which receipt is being done. This attribute along with RMASourceSystemName of the header is used to derive ReceiptAdviceHeaderId.
This attribute is applicable when creating receipt transactions for RMA.

RMAReference.description: Number that identifies the return material authorization that the supplier provides when returning goods to the supplier. This attribute is applicable only when the transaction type is RETURN TO VENDOR.

RMAScheduleNumber.description: Schedule number of the return material authorization against which receipt is being done.

ReasonId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the inventory transaction reason for the receiving transaction.

ReasonName.description: Name of the inventory transaction reason for the receiving transaction. This attribute is used to derive ReasonId.

RecallHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the recall notice. This attribute should only be used for the RETURN TO VENDOR transaction type.

RecallLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the line corresponding to the recall notice. This attribute should only be used for the RETURN TO VENDOR transaction type.

RecallLineNumber.description: Number that identifies the recall notice line. This attribute should only be used for the RETURN TO VENDOR transaction type.

RecallNoticeNumber.description: Number that identifies the recall notice. This attribute should only be used for the RETURN TO VENDOR transaction type.

ReceiptAdviceHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receipt advice header.

ReceiptAdviceLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receipt advice line.

ReceiptSourceCode.description: Value that identifies the source of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) or the receipt. Valid values include VENDOR when creating an ASN, receiving a purchase order, or receiving an ASN, INVENTORY when receiving an in-transit shipment, TRANSFER ORDER when receiving a transfer order, CUSTOMER when receiving a return material authorization (RMA). This attribute is mandatory.

ReturnStatus.description: Value that indicates the status of the application call that is sent to the client. Values include SUCCESS or ERROR.

RoutingCode.description: Value that indicates the receiving routing. This attribute need not be populated for this resource. It is derived from the parent transaction.

RoutingHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receiving routing. This attribute need not be populated for this resource. It is derived from the parent transaction.

SaveAndSubmitFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the Manage Receiving Transactions API resubmits the patched interface data automatically and immediately returns the response. If false, then the records are updated in interface tables but not resubmitted. The default value is false.

SecondaryQuantity.description: Transaction quantity in the secondary unit of measure that the item uses.

SecondaryUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the secondary unit of measure that the item in the receiving organization uses.

SecondaryUnitOfMeasure.description: Secondary unit of measure that the item in the receiving organization uses.

ShipToLocationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the receiving location. This is used to derive ShipTolocationId. This attribute is applicable only when transaction type is ACCEPT, REJECT, and TRANSFER. If this attribute is blank, the value from the parent transaction is used.

ShipToLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receiving location. If this attribute is blank during a POST operation, the value is derived from ShipToLocationId of the source document. This attribute is applicable only when transaction type is ACCEPT, REJECT, and TRANSFER. If this attribute is blank, the value from the parent transaction is used.

ShipmentHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receiving shipment or receipt header. This attribute is applicable when receiving an advanced shipment notice (ASN), a in-transit shipment, or a transfer order.

ShipmentLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the shipment line. This attribute is applicable when receiving an advanced shipment notice (ASN), a in-transit shipment, or a transfer order.

ShipmentNumber.description: Number that identifies the shipment that the shipment source assigns. This number corresponds to the number that identifies one of the following objects: advance shipment notice, in-transit shipment, or transfer-order shipment.

SoldtoLegalEntity.description: Name of the sold-to legal entity. Populate this attribute with the sold-to legal entity associated to the purchase order. This is used to derive SoldtoLegalEntityId.

SoldtoLegalEntityId.description:
Value that uniquely identifies the sold-to legal entity.
The combination of DocumentNumber and SoldtoLegalEntityId is needed to derive POHeaderId, which identifies the purchase order header for a purchase order-based transaction.

SourceDocumentCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the type of source document. Valid values include PO to create an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receive a purchase order, or an ASN, INVENTORY to receive an in-transit shipment, TRANSFER ORDER to receive a transfer order, RMA to receive a transfer order. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type RCV_SOURCE_DOCUMENT_TYPE. This attribute is mandatory.

SourceTransactionNumber.description: Number that identifies the unique transaction identifier in the source application. There can be only one record in receiving transactions for a source transaction number.

Subinventory.description: Name of the destination subinventory for the receiving transaction. This attribute is mandatory when: the transaction type is DELIVER, destination type of the document schedule or document line is Inventory, subinventory is not specified on the document distribution or line (if provided in the document line, the default value is used), or no item transaction default exists (if item transaction default exists, it will be derived).

SubstituteItemId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the substitute item. This attribute is not currently used.

SubstituteItemNumber.description: Substitute item number for the item on the receipt line. This attribute is not currently used.

SubstituteUnorderedCode.description: Value that indicates whether the transaction is for a substitute item. This attribute is not currently used.

TaxClassificationCode.description: Value that indicates the tax classification. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

TaxInvoiceDate.description: Date when the tax invoice is created. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

TaxInvoiceNumber.description: Number of the tax invoice. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

ThirdPartyRegistrationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the third party registration. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

ThirdPartyRegistrationNumber.description: Number that is used for the third party registration. This attribute is used to derive ThirdPartyRegistrationId. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

TransactionBusinessCategory.description: Business category of the transaction. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

TransactionDate.description: Date when the transaction for the current line is created. This attribute is used for receipt accounting, invoicing, and other related processes. The default value is the current date and time. If the time zone is not provided, the value stored is the time zone of the database. This value cannot be a future date.

TransactionStatusCode.description: Value that indicates the status of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt transaction request. Valid values include PENDING, RUNNING or ERROR. The default value is PENDING. Only the interface records with value PENDING are picked for processing. If there is an error in running the transaction, the status changes to ERROR. This attribute should be blank during POST operations so that the default value of PENDING is used.

TransactionType.description: Type of transaction for the receipt transaction line request. Valid values include ACCEPT, REJECT, TRANSFER, DELIVER, CORRECT, RETURN TO VENDOR, RETURN TO RECEIVING, RETURN TO CUSTOMER, and RETURN TO ORGANIZATION.

TransferOrderDistributionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transfer order distribution. This attribute is applicable when receiving a transfer order with multiple distributions and direct routing.

TransferOrderHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transfer order header. This attribute is applicable when receiving a transfer order.

TransferOrderLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transfer order line. This attribute is applicable receiving a transfer order.

TruckNumber.description: Number of the truck. This attribute is not currently used.

UOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure that the receipt transaction uses.

UnitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the receipt transaction request. This attribute is used to derive UOMCode.

UserDefinedFiscalClassification.description: Value that indicates the fiscal classification defined by the user. This attribute is applicable only for return transactions. Even for returns, if blank, the default value from the parent transaction is used.

VendorId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier. This attribute can be blank for this resource and is derived from the parent transaction.

VendorItemNumber.description: Number that the supplier uses to identify the item. This attribute can be blank for this resource and is derived from the parent transaction.

VendorName.description: Name of the supplier. This attribute can be blank for this resource and is derived from the parent transaction.

VendorNumber.description: Number that identifies the supplier. This attribute can be blank for this resource and is derived from the parent transaction.

VendorSiteCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the supplier site for a business unit. This attribute can be blank for this resource and is derived from the parent transaction.

VendorSiteId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier site. This attribute can be blank for this resource and is derived from the parent transaction.

attachments.description: The Attachments resource manages attachments when creating a post receipt transaction. The attachments uploaded as part of this correspond to the entity name Receiving Transactions.
attachments.title: Attachments

inventoryStripingDFF.description: The Flexfields for Inventory Striping Attributes resource manages the inventory striping attributes that the descriptive flexfield references associated with a transaction. Inventory striping (inventory tracking) attributes are a set of named attributes (project, task, and country of origin) as well as user-configurable attributes, which when specified as part of the receipt or receiving transaction, are used to track the inventory on hand.
inventoryStripingDFF.title: Flexfields for Inventory Striping Attributes

lotItemLots.description: The Lots for Lot Items resource manages the lot information for a transaction line whose item is lot controlled and not serial controlled.
lotItemLots.title: Lots for Lot Items

lotSerialItemLots.description: The Lots for Lot and Serial Items resource manages the lot information for a transaction line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.
lotSerialItemLots.title: Lots for Lot and Serial Items

processingErrors.description: The Processing Errors resource gets the details for each error that was encountered while processing a request for post receipt transactions.
processingErrors.title: Processing Errors

serialItemSerials.description: The Serials for Serial Items resource manages the serial number information for a transaction line whose item is serial controlled and not lot controlled.
serialItemSerials.title: Serials for Serial Items

ASNType.description: Type of the receiving header request. Valid values include ASN to create an advanced shipment notice (ASN), ASBN to create an advance shipment billing notice (ASBN), and STD to create receipts. The default value is STD.

BillOfLading.description: Number that identifies the bill of lading for this shipment or receipt.

BusinessUnit.description: Name of the business unit. For a purchase order receipt, this attribute references the procurement business unit of the supplier site. For a receipt that includes a return material authorization, this attribute references the business unit that the return material authorization contains. This column is used to derive the business unit identifier, which in turn is used to derive the supplier site code.

BusinessUnitId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the business unit. For a purchase order receipt, this attribute references the procurement business unit of the supplier site. For a receipt that includes a return material authorization, this attribute references the business unit that the return material authorization contains. The combination of business unit and supplier site code is used to derive the vendor site identifier.

Comments.description: Comments or notes entered for the receipt header request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) request header.

CreatedBy.description: User who created the interface record for the header request.

CreationDate.description: Date and time when the interface record for the header request was created.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the invoice amount currency. This attribute is applicable to advance shipment billing notice (ASBN) (advanced shipment notice (ASN) with billing information).

CustomerId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the customer for the return material authorization (RMA) receipt. To create a RMA receipt, you must provide one of the following attributes: customer identifier, customer number, or customer name.

CustomerPartyName.description: Name of the customer. This attribute is used along with customer number to derive customer identifier for the return material authorization (RMA) receipt header request. To create a RMA receipt, you must provide one of the following attributes: customer identifier, customer number, or customer name.

CustomerPartyNumber.description: Number used to represent the customer party. This attribute is used along with customer name to derive customer identifier for the return material authorization (RMA) receipt header request. To create a RMA receipt, you must provide one of the following attributes: customer identifier, customer number, or customer name.

DFF.description: The Flexfields for Receipt Header Request resource manages the details of the receipt header request that the descriptive flexfield references.
DFF.title: Flexfields for Receipt Header Requests

EmployeeId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the employee or contingent worker who is creating a receipt. To create a receipt, you must provide one of the following attributes: employee identifier or employee name.

EmployeeName.description: Name of the employee who is creating the receipt. This attribute is used to derive the employee identifier or contingent worker identifier. To create a receipt, you must provide one of the following attributes: employee identifier or employee name.

ExpectedReceiptDate.description: Date when the advanced shipment notice (ASN) is expected to be received.

ExternalSystemTransactionReference.description: Value that contains reference information for the corresponding transaction in external applications.

FreightAmount.description: Price at which the cargo is delivered from one point to another. The price depends on the mode of transport, the weight of the cargo, and the distance of the delivery destination.

FreightCarrierId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the freight carrier.

FreightCarrierName.description: Name of the freight carrier. Used to derive the freight carrier identifier.

FreightTerms.description: Agreement that describes whether the buyer or seller pays the shipping cost of the sales order, and when is the payment due.

FromOrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the source organization for an in-transit shipment or transfer order. Used to derive from-organization identifier. To create a receipt for in-transit shipment or transfer order, you must provide one of the following attributes: from organization or from-organization code.

FromOrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source organization for an in-transit shipment or transfer order. To create a receipt for in-transit shipment or transfer order, you must provide one of the following attributes: from organization or from-organization code.

GroupId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the group of interface records submitted together for processing.

HeaderInterfaceId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receipt request header.

InsertAndProcessFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the Manage Receiving Transactions API processes the posted interface data automatically and immediately returns the response. If false, then the records are created in interface tables but no processing is done. These interface records can subsequently processed by the Manage Receiving Transactions scheduled process. The default value is true.

InvoiceDate.description: Date when the invoice associated with the shipment or billing notice such as an advanced shipment notice (ASN) with billing information, is due.

InvoiceNumber.description: Number that identifies the invoice associated with the shipment or billing notice (advanced shipment notice (ASN) with billing information).

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time when the user most recently updated the interface record for the header request.

LastUpdatedBy.description: Login of the user who most recently updated the interface record for the header request.

NetWeight.description: Weight of the products being shipped without considering the packaging.

NetWeightUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure used for net weight of the shipment.

NetWeightUnitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the net weight of the shipment.

NumberOfPackingUnits.description: Number of containers in the shipment.

OrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the receiving organization. For a receipt request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) request, you must provide one of the following attributes: organization code or organization identifier. Without the organization, the advanced shipment notice (ASN) or receipt cannot be created.

OrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receiving organization. For a receipt request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) request, you must provide one of the following attributes: organization code or organization identifier. Without the organization, the advanced shipment notice (ASN) or receipt cannot be created.

PackagingCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the material being transported. The unique packaging code is based on the United Nations Committee of Experts on the Transportation of Dangerous Goods recommendations.

PackingSlip.description: Number that identifies the packing slip for a container on the shipment or a receipt.

PaymentTermsId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the payment terms. This attribute is applicable to advance shipment billing notice (ASBN) (advanced shipment notice (ASN) with billing information).

PaymentTermsName.description: Name of the payment terms used to schedule payments and to calculate due dates, discount dates, and discount amounts, if applicable. This attribute is applicable to advance shipment billing notice (ASBN) (advanced shipment notice (ASN) with billing information).

ProcessingStatusCode.description:
Value that indicates the processing status for the receipt. Valid values include PENDING, ERROR, or SUCCESS. The default value is PENDING.
Only the interface records with value PENDING will be picked for processing. If there is an error in the derive, default and validate cycle, the status moves to ERROR.
This attribute should be blank during POST operation so that the default value of PENDING is picked.

RMASourceSystemId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source application. To create a return material authorization (RMA) receipt, you must provide one of the following attributes: source-system identifier or source-system name.

RMASourceSystemName.description: Name of the source application. Used to derive return material authorization (RMA) source-system identifier. To create a RMA receipt, you must provide one of the following attributes: source-system identifier or source-system name.

ReceiptHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receipt or shipment that exists in the application. This attribute is used when adding lines to an existing purchase order receipt or a return material authorization (RMA) receipt. This attribute is required when an item is received multiple times against a single advanced shipment notice (ASN), single transfer order shipment, or in-transit shipment. This attribute can be used in place of the shipment number or receipt number when creating a receipt.

ReceiptNumber.description: Number that identifies the items that the warehouse receives in a single receipt. Leave this attribute blank when the receiving parameter for receipt generation is automatic.

ReceiptSourceCode.description: Value that indicates the source of the shipment or the receipt. Valid values include SUPPLIER to create an advanced shipment notice (ASN) request, or receipt request for a purchase order, or an ASN, CUSTOMER to create a return material authorization (RMA) receipt request, INVENTORY to create in transit shipment receipt request, and TRANSFER ORDER to create a transfer order receipt request. This attribute is mandatory.

ReturnStatus.description: Value that indicates the status of the application call that is sent to the client. Values include SUCCESS or ERROR.

SaveAndSubmitFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the Manage Receiving Transactions API resubmits the patched interface data automatically and immediately returns the response. If false, then the records are updated in interface tables but not resubmitted. The default value is false.

ShipmentNumber.description: Number that is assigned to the shipment by the shipment source. This number corresponds to one of the following: advance shipment notice, in-transit shipment, or transfer order shipment.

ShippedDate.description: Date when the supplier shipped the advanced shipment notice (ASN).

SpecialHandlingCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the handling instructions for the transported material.

TarWeight.description: Weight of an empty vehicle or container. You can subtract the tare weight from the gross weight (laden weight) to find the weight of the carried goods (net weight).

TarWeightUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure used for tare weight of the shipment.

TarWeightUnitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the tare weight of the shipment.

TaxAmount.description: Tax amount associated with the shipment or billing notice name indicated at the header level.

TotalInvoiceAmount.description: Total amount for the invoice associated with the shipment or billing notice (advanced shipment notice (ASN) with billing information).

TransactionDate.description:
Date when the receipt header request is interfaced.
The default value is the current date.

VendorId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier. To create a purchase order receipt or an advanced shipment notice (ASN), you must provide one of the following attributes: vendor identifier, vendor name, or vendor number.

VendorName.description: Name of the supplier. This attribute is used to derive the vendor identifier. To create a purchase order receipt or an advanced shipment notice (ASN), you must provide one of the following attributes: vendor identifier, vendor name, or vendor number.

VendorNumber.description: Number that identifies the supplier. This attribute is used to derive the vendor identifier. To create a purchase order receipt or an advanced shipment notice (ASN), you must provide one of the following attributes: vendor identifier, vendor name, or vendor number.

VendorSiteCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the supplier site for this supplier. This attribute should match the supplier site for the purchase orders that are part of the current receipt request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) request. To create a purchase order receipt or an advanced shipment notice (ASN), you must provide one of the following attributes: vendor site code or vendor site.

VendorSiteId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier site.

WaybillAirbillNumber.description: Number that identifies the waybill or air bill for the shipment or receipt.

attachments.description: The Attachments for Receipt Header Requests resource manages attachments when creating a receipt header request.
attachments.title: Attachments for Receipt Header Requests

lines.description: The Lines resource manages one more receipt line requests or advance shipment notice (ASN) line requests for a header request. A header request comprises of one or more lines. The header groups the lines by a supplier, inventory organization, or a customer. This resource contains information important to creating a receipt or an ASN; for example, item , quantity, order references, receiving organization, location, subinventory, locator, and so on.
lines.title: Lines

AssetSubinventory.description: Determines whether or not to consider the inventory in the subinventory as an asset. Contains one of the following values. 1: asset subinventory. 2: not an asset subinventory. The default value is 1.
AssetSubinventory.title: Asset subinventory

CountMethod.description: Indicates the method to use to replenish. Values include Two-Bin, Request, or Count. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_REPLENISHMENT_COUNT_METHOD. The default value is COUNT.
CountMethod.title: Replenishment Count Method

DefaultCountTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the replenishment type to use with Periodic Automatic Replenishment in the subinventory. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type INV_DEFAULT_REPLEN_COUNT_TYPE. The default value is 4.
DefaultCountTypeCode.title: Default Replenishment Count Type

DefaultLocStatusCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the default material status to use for the locators for this subinventory.

DefaultLocStatusId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the default material status for the locators that reference this subinventory. The default value is 1.
DefaultLocStatusId.title: Default Locator Status

Depreciable.description: Determines whether or not the inventory in this subinventory is depreciable. Contains one of the following values. 1: depreciable subinventory. 2: not a depreciable subinventory. The default value is 2.
Depreciable.title: Depreciable

DisableDate.description: Date when the subinventory is disabled for use in the application.
DisableDate.title: End Date

FillKillToLookup.description: FillKill status for this subinventory. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type ORA_INV_TO_FILLKILL_OPTIONS. The default value is NEXT_LEVEL.

LocationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the value that identifies the location that references the subinventory.

LocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the location that references the subinventory.
LocationId.title: Location

LocatorControl.description: Type of locator control that references the subinventory. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type INV_SUB_LOCATOR_CONTROL. The default value is 1.
LocatorControl.title: Locator Control

LocatorStructure.description: Value that uniquely identifies the locator structure for the subinventory when a locator controls the subinventory.
LocatorStructure.title: Locator Structure

MaterialStatusCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the material status that references the subinventory.

MaterialStatusId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the material status that references the subinventory. The default value is 1.
MaterialStatusId.title: Material Status

OrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the organization that references the subinventory.

OrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the organization that references the subinventory.

ParLocation.description: Determines whether or not the subinventory is a Periodic Automatic Replenishment location. Contains one of the following values. 1: Yes subinventory. 2: No, not the subinventory. The default value is 2.
ParLocation.title: PAR location

PostprocessingLeadTime.description: Post processing lead time to use while sourcing the item.
PostprocessingLeadTime.title: Postprocessing

PreprocessingLeadTime.description: Preprocessing lead time to use while sourcing the item.
PreprocessingLeadTime.title: Preprocessing

ProcessingLeadTime.description: Processing lead time to use while sourcing the item.
ProcessingLeadTime.title: Processing

QuantityTracked.description: Determines whether or not to track the subinventory.
QuantityTracked.title: Quantity tracked

SourceOrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the source organization. Used while sourcing the material to this subinventory.

SourceOrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source organization. Used while sourcing the material to this subinventory.
SourceOrganizationId.title: Organization

SourceSubinventory.description: Name of the source subinventory. Used while sourcing the material to this subinventory.
SourceSubinventory.title: Sourcing Subinventory

SourcingType.description: Sourcing type to use to replenish stock for this subinventory. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type INV_SOURCE_TYPES.
SourcingType.title: Sourcing Type

SubinventoryType.description: Type of subinventory, such as Storage or Receiving. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type INV_SUB_TYPE. The default value is 1.
SubinventoryType.title: Subinventory Type

itemSubinventories.description: The Item Subinventories resource manages operations on item subinventories.
itemSubinventories.title: Item Subinventories

locators.description: The Locators resource manages operations on locators.
locators.title: Locators

subinventoriesDFF.description: The Flexfields for Subinventories resource manages descriptive flexfields that contain details about subinventories.
subinventoriesDFF.title: Flexfields

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: Descriptive flexfield context display name for receipt transaction requests.

AsyncTrackerId.title: Asynchronous Upload Tracker Id

AttachedDocumentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the attachment of a shipment line. It is a primary key that the application generates when a document is attached to the receipt transaction request.
AttachedDocumentId.title: Attached Document Id

ContentRepositoryFileShared.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the attachment is shared. If false, then the attachment is not shared. The default value is true.
ContentRepositoryFileShared.title: Shared

CreatedBy.description: User who created the attachment.
CreatedBy.title: Created By

CreatedByUserName.description: Login that the user used when creating the attachment for the specification.
CreatedByUserName.title: Created By User Name

CreationDate.description: Date when the user created the attachment record.

DatatypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the data type.
DatatypeCode.title: Type

DmDocumentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the attached document.

DmVersionNumber.description: Number that identifies the version of the attached document.

ErrorStatusCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the error code, if any, for the attachment.
ErrorStatusCode.title: Error Status Code

ErrorStatusMessage.description: Error message, if any, for the attachment.

ExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the contents in the attachment.

FileUrl.description: URL (Uniform Resource Locator) of the attachment.
FileUrl.title: File Url

FileWebImage.description: The base64 encoded image of the file displayed in .png format if the source is a convertible image.
FileWebImage.title: File Web Image

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time when the user most recently updated the document that is attached to the receipt transaction request.
LastUpdateDate.title: Last Update Date

LastUpdatedBy.description: Login of the user who updated the document that is attached to the receipt transaction request.
LastUpdatedBy.title: Last Updated By

LastUpdatedByUserName.description: Login that the user used when updating the attachment for the specification.

UserName.title: User Name

InterfaceTransactionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transaction. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

__FLEX_Context.description: Descriptive flexfield context name for inventory striping attributes. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: Descriptive flexfield context display value for inventory striping attributes. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

countryOfOriginCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the country of manufacture for this item. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

countryOfOriginCode_Display.description: Name of the country of origin. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

projectId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the project. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

projectId_Display.description: Number that identifies the project. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

taskId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the task. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

taskId_Display.description: Number that identifies the task. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

HoldDate.description: Date when the warehouse applied a hold on the lot corresponding to the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

LotExpirationDate.description: Date when the item of the lot corresponding to receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

LotNumber.description: Number that identifies the lot corresponding to the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

MaturityDate.description: Date when the lot matures. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

OriginationDate.description: Date when the lot originated corresponding to the ASN line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

OriginationType.description: Type of origination for the lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

ParentLotNumber.description: Number that identifies the parent lot of the lot corresponding to the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

PrimaryQuantity.description: Transaction quantity for the lot in the primary unit of measure that the item uses. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

ReasonId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the reason for the receiving transaction. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

ReasonName.description: Name of the reason for the receiving transaction for the lot. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

SecondaryTransactionQuantity.description: Transaction quantity for the lot in the secondary unit of measure that the item uses. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

TransactionQuantity.description: Transaction quantity of the item for the lot corresponding to the receipt transaction request expires. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

VendorLotNumber.description: Number that identifies the supplier lot for the lot corresponding to the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

lotAttributesDFF.description: The Flexfields for Lot Attributes resource manages the details of the lot attributes and is associated to a transaction line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.
lotAttributesDFF.title: Flexfields for Lot Attributes

lotNumbersDFF.description: The Flexfields for Lot Numbers resource manages lot numbers and is associated to a transaction line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.
lotNumbersDFF.title: Flexfields for Lot Numbers

HoldDate.description: Date when the warehouse applied a hold on the lot corresponding to the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

LotExpirationDate.description: Date when the item of this lot corresponding to the receipt transaction request expires. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

LotNumber.description: Number that identifies the lot for the item corresponding to the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

MaturityDate.description: Date when the lot matures for the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

OriginationDate.description: Date when this lot originated for the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

OriginationType.description: Type of origination for the lot corresponding to the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

ParentLotNumber.description: Number that identifies the parent lot of the lot corresponding to the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

PrimaryQuantity.description: Transaction quantity for this lot in the primary unit of measure that the item uses. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

ReasonId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the reason for the receiving transaction for the lot. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

ReasonName.description: Name of the reason for the receiving transaction for the lot. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

SecondaryTransactionQuantity.description: Transaction quantity for this lot in the secondary unit of measure that the item uses. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

TransactionQuantity.description: Transaction quantity of the lot corresponding to the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

VendorLotNumber.description: Number that identifies the supplier lot for the lot corresponding to the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

lotAttributesDFF.description: The Flexfields for Lot Attributes resource manages the details of the lot attributes and is associated to a transaction line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.
lotAttributesDFF.title: Flexfields for Lot Attributes

lotNumbersDFF.description: The Flexfields for Lot Numbers resource manages lot numbers and is associated to a transaction line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.
lotNumbersDFF.title: Flexfields for Lot Numbers

lotSerialItemSerials.description: The Serials for Lot and Serial Items resource manages the serial number information associated with a specific lot for a transaction line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.
lotSerialItemSerials.title: Serials for Lot and Serial Items

BatchId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the batch into which the interface records are grouped for processing.

ColumnName.description: Name of the column for the attribute value that resulted in error during processing.

ErrorMessage.description: Text of the error message, if any, after the processing the records.

ErrorMessageName.description: Name of the error message, is any, after processing the records.

ErrorType.description:
Type of the error, if any, after processing the records.
Valid values include ERROR or WARNING.

InterfaceErrorId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receiving interface error record.

InterfaceHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the header request that corresponds to the current receiving interface error record.

InterfaceLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the line request that corresponds to the current receiving interface error record.

TableName.description: Name of the table for the attribute value that resulted in error during processing.

FromSerialNumber.description: Starting serial number in a range of serial numbers of the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under serial control.

ToSerialNumber.description: Ending serial number in a range of serial numbers of the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under serial control.

VendorSerialNumber.description: Supplier serial number for the serial range of the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under serial control.

serialAttributesDFF.description: The Flexfields for Serial Attributes resource manages the details of serial attributes and is associated to a transaction line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.
serialAttributesDFF.title: Flexfields for Serial Attributes

serialNumbersDFF.description: The Flexfields for Serial Numbers resource manages the details of serial numbers and is associated to a transaction line whose item is serial controlled and not lot controlled.
serialNumbersDFF.title: Flexfields for Serial Numbers
