ASNLineAttachments.description: The Attachments for ASN Lines resource manages attachments when creating an advance shipment notice (ASN) line request.
ASNLineAttachments.title: Attachments for ASN Lines

ASNLineDFF.description: The Flexfields for ASN Line Requests resource manages the details of the advance shipment notice (ASN) line requests that the descriptive flexfield references.
ASNLineDFF.title: Flexfields for ASN Line Requests

ASNLineNumber.description: Number that identifies the line on the advance shipment notice. Either this attribute or ShipmentLineId must be provided when receiving an advanced shipment notice (ASN).

ASNPackingUnits.description: The Packing Units for the ASNs resource manages details about the packing units which are associated with the advance shipment notice (ASN) or advance shipment billing notice (ASBN) lines.
ASNPackingUnits.title: Packing Units for ASNs

Amount.description: Receipt amount in the purchase order currency. This attribute is mandatory when creating a receipt for a fixed price service purchase order line.

AssessableValue.description: Assessable value of the transaction for taxation purposes.

AutoTransactCode.description: Abbreviation that determines how to finish subsequent transactions automatically, if needed. Valid values include SHIP, RECEIVE, and DELIVER. If you receive a document line (transaction type is RECEIVE) where the document routing is direct delivery, then set auto-transact code to DELIVER. This will receive and also deliver the material or services automatically. If you receive a document with standard or inspection required routing, set auto-transact code to RECEIVE, so that only the receipt is created and the material resides in the receiving bay. When you create an advanced shipment notice (ASN) line (transaction type is SHIP) and set the auto-transact code to RECEIVE, then the advanced shipment notice (ASN) will be created and a receipt is automatically created. If you set auto-transact code to DELIVER, then along with creation of an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receive and deliver take place automatically.

BarcodeLabel.description: Label of the barcode on the product. This attribute is applicable only for advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

BusinessUnit.description: Name of the business unit. For a purchase order receipt, this attribute references the procurement business unit of the supplier site. For a receipt that includes a return material authorization, this attribute references the business unit that the return material authorization contains.

BusinessUnitId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the business unit. For a purchase order receipt, this attribute references the procurement business unit of the supplier site. For a receipt that includes a return material authorization, this attribute references the business unit that the return material authorization contains. You can leave this attribute blank.

Comments.description: Text that the used entered when receiving the item.

ConsignedLine.description: Value that indicates whether or not the receiving transaction is for consigned material. If blank for a receipt line request, the value from the document is used.

ContainerNumber.description: Container number for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

CountryOfOriginCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the country of manufacture for this item.

CreateDebitMemoFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then create the debit memo. If false, then do not create the debit memo. The default value is false. This attribute is not currently used.

CreatedBy.description: User who created the interface record for the receipt line request.

CreationDate.description: Date and time when the interface record for receipt line request was created.

CurrencyCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the currency that the receiving transaction uses. If you leave this attribute blank, the value from the document is used.

CurrencyConversionDate.description: Date when the currency conversion occurred for the receipt. Use this attribute only for a purchase order receipt where the option on the purchase order schedule is Receipt and the order currency is different from the ledger currency of the receiving organization.

CurrencyConversionRate.description: Currency conversion rate for the receipt. Use this attribute only for a purchase order receipt where the option on the purchase order schedule is Receipt, the order currency is different from the ledger currency of the receiving organization, and the rate type on the purchase order is User.

CustomerId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the customer. This attribute can be blank and the value is derived from the header.

CustomerItemId.description: Value that the customer uses to uniquely identify the item.

CustomerItemNumber.description: Number that the customer uses to identify the item.

CustomerPartyName.description: Name of the customer. This attribute can be blank and the value is derived from the header.

CustomerPartyNumber.description: Number that uniquely identifies the customer. This attribute can be blank and the value is derived from the header.

DefaultLotsAndSerialNumbersFromASNFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the lots and serial numbers from an advance shipment notice (ASN) or an advance shipment billing notice (ASBN) will be are defaulted when executing a receipt or a put away transaction. If false, then the lots and serial numbers from an advance shipment notice (ASN) or an advance shipment billing notice (ASBN) will not be defaulted when executing a receipt or a put away transaction. The default value is false.

DefaultTaxationCountry.description: Value that indicates the default taxation country.

DeliverToLocationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the deliver-to location. This is used to derive DeliverTolocationId.

DeliverToLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the deliver-to location. If this attribute is blank during a POST operation, this is derived from the DeliverToLocationId of the document distribution: purchase order distribution or transfer order distribution. DeliverToLocationId is mandatory when receiving a purchase order or transfer order with expense destination and the receipt routing is direct delivery.

DeliverToPersonId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the deliver-to person or requester. If this attribute is blank, this will default to the requester specified on the purchase order distribution or transfer order distribution.

DeliverToPersonName.description: Name of the deliver-to person or requester. This attribute is used to derive DeliverToPersonId.

DestinationTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the destination type for the receiving transaction. Contains one of the following values: blank, RECEIVING, value stored in destination type, or INVENTORY. When you set to blank, the application will default the appropriate value based on the document type and auto-transact code. This is recommended. When set to RECEIVING, the document routing is standard or inspection required. Set to the value stored in destination type for the corresponding purchase order schedule or transfer order line. When set to INVENTORY, receive in-transit shipment or return material authorization (RMA) and the document routing is direct delivery.

DocumentDistributionNumber.description: Number that identifies the document distribution for the receiving transaction. When receiving a purchase order that has multiple distributions, this attribute is the respective purchase order distribution number. When receiving a purchase order with multiple distributions, this attribute is mandatory.

DocumentLineNumber.description: Number that identifies the document line number for the receipt line request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request. When the source document code is PO (create an ASN, receive a purchase order, or receive an ASN), this attribute is the purchase order line number. When the source document code is INVENTORY, this attribute is the in-transit shipment line number. When the source document code is TRANSFER ORDER, this attribute is the transfer order shipment line number. When the source document code is RMA, this attribute is the return material authorization (RMA) line number. This attribute is mandatory.

DocumentNumber.description: Number that identifies the document for the receipt line request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request. When the source document code is PO (create an ASN, receive a purchase order or an ASN), this attribute is the purchase order number. When the source document code is INVENTORY, this attribute is the in-transit shipment number. When the source document code is TRANSFER ORDER, this attribute is the transfer order shipment number. When the source document code is RMA, this attribute is the return material authorization (RMA) number. This attribute is mandatory.

DocumentShipmentLineNumber.description: Number that identifies the document schedule for the receiving transaction. When the source document code is PO (create an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receive a purchase order, or receive an ASN), this attribute is the purchase order schedule number. When receiving a purchase order or creating an ASN line, this attribute is mandatory.

EmployeeId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the employee who performed the receiving transaction. If this attribute is blank during POST or PATCH operation, the value from the header request is used.

EmployeeName.description: Name of the employee who performed the receiving transaction. This attribute is used to derive the EmployeeId. If this attribute is blank during POST or PATCH operation, the value from the header request is used.

EwayBillDate.description: Date when the electronic waybill was generated. This value is used to calculate the goods and services tax for India.

EwayBillNumber.description: Number that identifies the electronic waybill provided by supplier for shipment of goods. This value is used to calculate the goods and services tax for India.

Exception.description: Value that indicates whether or not the receive transaction being created has an exception. If you want to flag the receiving transaction as an exception, populate this attribute with Y. Else, leave it blank.

ExternalSystemPackingUnit.description: License plate number of the external warehouse management application.

ExternalSystemTransactionReference.description:
Value that contains reference information for the corresponding transaction in external applications.

Do not enter this value at line level for RECEIVE or SHIP transactions, the value given at header is copied to lines. This value is entered at line level for other receiving transactions like inspection, put away, correct, and return.

FinalDischargeLocationCode.description: Value that indicates the final discharge location. This attribute is used to derive FinalDischargeLocationId.

FinalDischargeLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the final discharge location.

FirstPartyRegistrationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the first party registration.

FirstPartyRegistrationNumber.description: Number that is used for the first party registration. This attribute is used to derive FirstPartyRegistrationId.

FromLocator.description: Name of the source locator for the receiving transaction. This attribute is not currently used.

FromLocatorId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source locator for the receiving transaction. This attribute is not currently used.

FromOrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the source organization for an interorganization transfer. This is applicable for receipts against in-transit shipment or transfer order shipment.

FromOrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source organization for an in-transit shipment.

FromSubinventory.description: Name of the source subinventory for the receiving transaction. This attribute is not currently used.

GroupId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the group of interface records submitted together for processing.

HeaderInterfaceId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the header request to which this line belongs to.

InsertAndProcessFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the Manage Receiving Transactions API processes the posted interface data automatically and immediately returns the response. If false, then the records are created in interface tables but no processing is done. These interface records can subsequently processed by the Manage Receiving Transactions scheduled process. The default value is true.

InspectionQualityCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the inspection quality. This attribute is not applicable for a receipt line request or an advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

IntendedUse.description: Value that indicates the intended use.

IntendedUseClassificationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the intended use classification.

InterfaceSourceCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the source that interfaced the receiving transaction. It can be populated with the source application name.

InterfaceSourceLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the interfaced source line. This can be populated with the identifier of the line in the source application that initiated the receipt.

InterfaceTransactionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the interfaced receipt line request.

ItemDescription.description: Description of the item corresponding to the receipt line request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request. When you create an ASN or a receipt for a purchase order, it should match the item description of the corresponding purchase order line. For receipts against In-transit shipment, transfer order and return material authorization (RMA), this attribute should match the description of the inventory item. When creating an ASN or a receipt, one of the following must be provided: item identifier, item number, or item description.

ItemId.description:
Value that uniquely identifies the inventory item.
When creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN) or a receipt, one of the following must be provided: item identifier, item number, or item description.

ItemNumber.description: Number that identifies the item. Used to derive the attribute ItemId. When creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN) or a receipt, one of the following must be provided: item identifier, item number, or item description.

ItemRevision.description: Number that identifies the revision of the item. This attribute is mandatory when creating receipt lines for an item that is revision controlled.

LPNId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source license plate number. This attribute should be populated only for an advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time when the user most recently updated the interface record for receipt line request.

LastUpdatedBy.description: Login of the user who updated the interface record for receipt line request.

LicensePlateNumber.description: Source license plate number of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) request line. This attribute should be populated only for an advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

Locator.description: Name of the destination locator for the receiving transaction. This is used to derive LocatorId. This attribute or LocatorId is mandatory when: the document routing is direct delivery or auto-transact code is DELIVER, destination type of the document schedule or document line is Inventory, locator control is predefined or dynamic and item transaction defaults or not entered (if item transaction default exists, it will be derived).

LocatorId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the destination locator for the receiving transaction. This attribute or Locator is mandatory when: the document routing is direct delivery or auto-transact code is DELIVER, destination type of the document schedule or document line is Inventory, locator control is predefined or dynamic and item transaction defaults or not entered (if item transaction default exists, it will be derived).

OrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the receiving organization. This attribute is used to derive the organization identifier. For every receipt line request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request, either organization code or organization identifier must be populated. If the values are not provided, the request will fail.

OrganizationId.description:
Value that uniquely identifies the receiving organization.
For every receipt line request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request, either organization code or organization identifier must be populated. If the values are not provided, the request will fail.

PODistributionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the purchase order distribution. This attribute is applicable when creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receiving a purchase order or an ASN.

POHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the purchase order header. This attribute is applicable when creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receiving a purchase order or an ASN.

POLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the purchase order line. This attribute is applicable when creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receiving a purchase order or an ASN.

POLineLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the purchase order schedule. This attribute is applicable when creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receiving a purchase order or an ASN.

PackingSlip.description: Packing slip number for the container that contains this item. This attribute is applicable when creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

ParentSourceTransactionNumber.description: Number that identifies the source transaction of the parent receiving transaction. This attribute should not be populated when creating a receipt or creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN).

ParentTransactionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the parent receiving transaction. This attribute should not be populated when creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN) or creating a receipt. Since this attribute is applicable only for post receipt transactions, leave this blank.

PhysicalMaterialReturnRequiredFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then return against a transfer order requires a physical return of the item. If false, then return against a transfer order does not require a physical return of the item. The default value is false. This attribute is not currently used.

PrimaryQuantity.description: Transaction quantity in the primary unit of measure that the item uses.

PrimaryUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the primary unit of measure that the item in the receiving organization uses.

PrimaryUnitOfMeasure.description: Primary unit of measure that the item in the receiving organization uses. This attribute is used to derive PrimaryUOMCode.

ProcessingStatusCode.description: Value that indicates the processing status for the line request. Valid values include PENDING, RUNNING, COMPLETED. The default value is PENDING. Only the interface records with value PENDING will be picked for processing. If there is an error in the derive, default, and validate cycle, the status moves to ERROR. This attribute should be blank during POST operation so that the default value of PENDING is picked.

ProductCategory.description: Value that indicates the product category.

ProductFiscalClassName.description: Name used to indicate the product fiscal classification. This attribute is used to derive ProductFiscalClassificationId.

ProductFiscalClassificationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the product fiscal classification.

ProductType.description: Value that indicates the product type for taxation purposes.

Quantity.description: Transaction quantity in the unit of measure that the receipt line request or advanced shipment notice (ASN) request uses.

RMALineNumber.description: Line number of the return material authorization (RMA) against which the receipt is being created. This attribute is used to derive ReceiptAdviceLineId. This attribute is mandatory when creating a receipt for RMA.

RMANumber.description: Number of the return material authorization (RMA) against which the receipt is being created. This attribute along with RMASourceSystemName of the header is used to derive ReceiptAdviceHeaderId. This attribute is mandatory when creating a receipt for RMA.

RMAReference.description: Number that identifies the return material authorization that the supplier provides when returning goods to the supplier. This attribute is not currently used.

RMAScheduleNumber.description: Schedule number of the return material authorization against which receipt is being created.

ReasonId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the inventory transaction reason for the receiving transaction.

ReasonName.description: Name of the inventory transaction reason for the receiving transaction. This attribute is used to derive ReasonId.

RecallHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the recall notice number. This attribute should only be used for the RETURN TO VENDOR transaction type.

RecallLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the line corresponding to the recall notice number. This attribute should only be used for the RETURN TO VENDOR transaction type.

RecallLineNumber.description: Number that identifies the recall notice line. This attribute should only be used for the RETURN TO VENDOR transaction type.

RecallNoticeNumber.description: Number that identifies the recall notice. This attribute should only be used for the RETURN TO VENDOR transaction type.

ReceiptAdviceHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receipt advice header.

ReceiptAdviceLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receipt advice line.

ReceiptSourceCode.description: Value that identifies the source of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) or the receipt. Valid values include VENDOR when creating an ASN, receiving a purchase order, or receiving an ASN, INVENTORY when receiving an in-transit shipment, TRANSFER ORDER when receiving a transfer order, CUSTOMER when receiving a return material authorization (RMA). This attribute is mandatory.

ReturnStatus.description: Value that indicates the status of the application call that is sent to the client. Values include SUCCESS or ERROR.

RoutingCode.description: Value that indicates the receiving routing. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type RCV_ROUTING_HEADERS.

RoutingHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receiving routing. Valid values include: 1 for standard receipt, 2 for inspection required, 3 for direct delivery. If this attribute is blank, the value is derived from the document line or schedule.

SaveAndSubmitFlag.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the Manage Receiving Transactions API resubmits the patched interface data automatically and immediately returns the response. If false, then the records are updated in interface tables but not resubmitted. The default value is false.

SecondaryQuantity.description: Transaction quantity in the secondary unit of measure that the item uses.

SecondaryUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the secondary unit of measure that the item in the receiving organization uses.

SecondaryUnitOfMeasure.description: Secondary unit of measure that the item in the receiving organization uses.

ShipToLocationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the receiving location. This is used to derive ShipTolocationId. When creating a receipt against in-transit shipment, either ShipToLocationCode or ShipToLocationId must be provided.

ShipToLocationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receiving location. If this attribute is blank during a POST operation, this is derived from the ShipToLocationId of the source document. When creating a receipt against in-transit shipment, either ShipToLocationCode or ShipToLocationId must be provided.

ShipmentHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receiving shipment or receipt header. This attribute is applicable when receiving an advanced shipment notice (ASN), a in-transit shipment, or a transfer order.

ShipmentLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the shipment line. This attribute is applicable when receiving an advanced shipment notice (ASN), a in-transit shipment, or a transfer order.

ShipmentNumber.description: Number that indicates the shipment that the shipment source assigns. This number corresponds to the number that identifies one of the following objects: advance shipment notice, in-transit shipment, or transfer-order shipment.

SoldtoLegalEntity.description: Name of the sold-to legal entity. Populate this attribute with the sold-to legal entity associated to the purchase order. This is used to derive SoldtoLegalEntityId.

SoldtoLegalEntityId.description:
Value that uniquely identifies the sold-to legal entity.
The combination of DocumentNumber and SoldtoLegalEntityId is needed to derive POHeaderId, which identifies the purchase order header for a purchase order-based transaction.

SourceDocumentCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the type of source document. Valid values include PO to create an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receive a purchase order, or an ASN, INVENTORY to receive an in-transit shipment, TRANSFER ORDER to receive a transfer order, RMA to receive a transfer order. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type RCV_SOURCE_DOCUMENT_TYPE. This attribute is mandatory.

SourceTransactionNumber.description: Number that identifies the unique transaction identifier in the source system. This is not applicable when creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN). This attribute should be unique across the application. There can be only one record in receiving transactions for a source transaction number.

Subinventory.description: Name of the destination subinventory for the receiving transaction. This attribute is mandatory when: the document routing is direct delivery or auto-transact code is DELIVER, destination type of the document schedule or document line is Inventory, subinventory is not specified on the document distribution or line (if provided in the document line, the default value is used), or no item transaction default exists (if item transaction default exists, it will be derived).

SubstituteItemId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the substitute item. This is applicable for purchase order receipts.

SubstituteItemNumber.description: Substitute item number for the item on the receipt line. This attribute is used to derive SubstituteItemId. This is applicable for purchase order receipts.

SubstituteUnorderedCode.description: Value that indicates whether the transaction is for a substitute item. Enter the value as SUBSTITUTE if you are creating a receipt for a substitute item.

TaxClassificationCode.description: Value that indicates the tax classification.

TaxInvoiceDate.description: Date when the tax invoice is created.

ThirdPartyRegistrationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the third party registration.

ThirdPartyRegistrationNumber.description: Number that is used for the third party registration. This attribute is used to derive ThirdPartyRegistrationId.

TransactionDate.description: Receipt date for the current line. This attribute is used for receipt accounting, invoicing, and other related processes. The default value is the current date and time. If the time zone is not provided, the value stored is the time zone of the database. This value cannot be a future date.

TransactionStatusCode.description: Value that indicates the status of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt transaction request. Valid values include PENDING, RUNNING or ERROR. The default value is PENDING. Only the interface records with value PENDING are picked for processing. If there is an error in running the transaction, the status changes to ERROR. This attribute should be blank during POST operations so that the default value of PENDING is used.

TransactionType.description: Type if transaction for the line request. Valid values include RECEIVE or SHIP. When creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN) line, transaction type should be set to SHIP. When creating a receipt line request, transaction type should be set to RECEIVE.

TransferOrderDistributionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transfer order distribution. This attribute is applicable when receiving a transfer order with multiple distributions and direct routing.

TransferOrderHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transfer order header. This attribute is applicable when receiving a transfer order.

TransferOrderLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transfer order line. This attribute is applicable receiving a transfer order.

TruckNumber.description: Number of the truck. This attribute is applicable only for advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

UOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure that the receipt line or advanced shipment notice (ASN) line uses.

UnitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the receipt line or ASN line request. This attribute is used to derive UOMCode.

UserDefinedFiscalClassification.description: Value that indicates the fiscal classification defined by the user.

VendorId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier. You can leave this attribute blank.

VendorItemNumber.description: Number that the supplier uses to identify the item. If a value is entered for this attribute, It must match the supplier item on the purchase order line.

VendorName.description: Name of the supplier. You can leave this attribute blank.

VendorNumber.description: Number that identifies the supplier. You can leave this attribute blank.

VendorSiteCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the supplier site for a business unit. This attribute is used to derive SupplierSiteId. It is applicable to creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receiving an ASN, or receiving a purchase order. You can leave this attribute blank.

VendorSiteId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the supplier site. It is applicable to creating an advanced shipment notice (ASN), receiving an ASN, or receiving a purchase order. You can leave this attribute blank.

inventoryStripingDFF.description: The Flexfields for Inventory Striping Attributes resource manages the details of the inventory striping attributes that the descriptive flexfield references associated with a transaction. Inventory striping (inventory tracking) attributes are a set of named attributes (project, task, and country of origin) as well as user-configurable attributes, which when specified as part of the receipt or receiving transaction, are used to track the inventory on hand.
inventoryStripingDFF.title: Flexfields for Inventory Striping Attributes

lotItemLots.description: The Lots for Lot Items resource manages the lot number information for a line whose item is lot controlled and not serial controlled.
lotItemLots.title: Lots for Lot Items

lotSerialItemLots.description: The Lots for Lot and Serial Items resource manages the lot number information for a line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.
lotSerialItemLots.title: Lots for Lot and Serial Items

processingErrors.description: The Processing Errors resource gets the details for each error that was encountered while processing a request for advance shipment notice (ASN) creation or receipt creation.
processingErrors.title: Processing Errors

serialItemSerials.description: The Serials for Serial Items resource manages the serial number information for a line whose item is serial controlled and not lot controlled.
serialItemSerials.title: Serials for Serial Items

transactionAttachments.description: The Attachments for Transactions resource manages attachments when creating a receipt line request.
transactionAttachments.title: Attachments for Transactions

transactionDFF.description: The Flexfields for Receive Transaction Requests resource manages the details of the receive transaction request that the descriptive flexfield references.
transactionDFF.title: Flexfields for Receive Transaction Requests

CountRequired.description: Contains Y or N. Y: the application requires counting during periodic automatic replenishment for the item in the locator. N: the application does not require this counting.
CountRequired.title: Count Required

DefaultCountTypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the type of periodic automatic replenishment. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type INV_DEFAULT_REPLEN_COUNT_TYPE. The default value is 4.
DefaultCountTypeCode.title: Replenishment Count Type

FixedLotMultiple.description: Value of the fixed lot multiple. Used while sourcing the material for the item. You can source an item only in this value.
FixedLotMultiple.title: Fixed Lot Multiple

InventoryItemId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the inventory item.

ItemNumber.description: Name that identifies the product or material in the subinventory.

MinimumMaximumPlanningCode.description: Abbreviation that determines whether to enable min-max planning for the item subinventory. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type INV_MATERIAL_PLANNING.
MinimumMaximumPlanningCode.title: Inventory Planning Method

MinmaxQuantityUOM.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure to use for the min-max quantities.

MinmaxQuantityUOMMeasure.description: Unit of measure to use for the min-max quantities.

ParLevel.description: Level that the application uses for the item subinventory during periodic automatic replenishment.
ParLevel.title: PAR Level

ParMaximumQuantity.description: Maximum quantity to use during periodic automatic replenishment.
ParMaximumQuantity.title: PAR Maximum Quantity

ParUOMCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure to use for quantities during periodic automatic replenishment.
ParUOMCode.title: PAR Level UOM

ParUOMMeasure.description: Unit of measure to use for quantities during periodic automatic replenishment.
ParUOMMeasure.title: PAR Level UOM

PostprocessingLeadTime.description: Post processing lead time to use while sourcing the item.
PostprocessingLeadTime.title: Postprocessing

PreprocessingLeadTime.description: Preprocessing lead time to use while sourcing the item.
PreprocessingLeadTime.title: Preprocessing

ProcessingLeadTime.description: Processing lead time to use while sourcing the item.
ProcessingLeadTime.title: Processing

QuantityCountTolerance.description: Count tolerance percent to use before the application does not allow the count. This tolerance prevents data entry mistakes when counting, and prevents ordering too much quantity for the replenishment request.
QuantityCountTolerance.title: Count Tolerance Percentage

SourceOrderingUOM.description: Abbreviation that identifies the unit of measure to use for sourcing.

SourceOrderingUOMMeasure.description: Unit of measure to use for sourcing.

SourceOrganizationCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the source organization. Used while sourcing the material for the item to this subinventory.

SourceOrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the source organization. Used while sourcing the material for the item to this subinventory.
SourceOrganizationId.title: Organization

SourceSubinventory.description: Name of the source subinventory. Used while sourcing the material for the item to this subinventory.
SourceSubinventory.title: Sourcing Subinventory

SourceType.description: Sourcing type to use to replenish stock for the item to this subinventory. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type INV_SOURCE_TYPES. The default value is 6.
SourceType.title: Sourcing Type

itemSubinventoriesDFF.description: The Flexfields for Item Subinventories resource manages descriptive flexfields that contain details about item subinventories.
itemSubinventoriesDFF.title: Flexfields

DisableDate.description: Date when the locator is disabled for use in the application.
DisableDate.title: End Date

InventoryLocationType.description: Value that identifies the locator type. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type INV_LOCATOR_TYPES.
InventoryLocationType.title: Type

MaterialStatusCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the material status that references the locator.

MaterialStatusId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the material status that references the locator.
MaterialStatusId.title: Status

StructureInstanceNumber.description: Value that uniquely identifies the locator structure.
StructureInstanceNumber.title: Locator Structure

SubinventoryCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the subinventory name.
SubinventoryCode.title: Subinventory

itemLocators.description: The Item Locators resource manages operations on item locators.
itemLocators.title: Item Locators

locatorsDFF.description: The Flexfields for Locators resource manages descriptive flexfields that contain details about locators.
locatorsDFF.title: Flexfields for Locators

locatorsKeyFlex.description: The Flexfields for Locator Keys resource manages flexfields that contain details about locator keys.
locatorsKeyFlex.title: Flexfields for Locator Keys

OrganizationId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the inventory organization.

_FLEX_NumOfSegments.description: Descriptive flexfield number of segments for subinventories.

_FLEX_ValidationDate.description: Descriptive flexfield validation date for subinventories.

__FLEX_Context.description: Descriptive flexfield context name for subinventories.
Descriptive flexfield context name for lot attributes. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: Descriptive flexfield context display name for lot attributes. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

__FLEX_Context.description: Descriptive flexfield context name for lots. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: Descriptive flexfield context name for lots. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

__FLEX_Context.description: Descriptive flexfield context name for lot attributes. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: Descriptive flexfield context display name for lot attributes. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

__FLEX_Context.description: Descriptive flexfield context name for lots. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: Descriptive flexfield context name for lots. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

FromSerialNumber.description: Starting serial number in a range of serial numbers of the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

ToSerialNumber.description: Ending serial number in a range of serial numbers of the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

VendorSerialNumber.description: Supplier serial number for the serial range of the receipt transaction request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

serialAttributesDFF.description: The Flexfields for Serial Attributes resource manages the details of serial attributes and is associated to a transaction line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.
serialAttributesDFF.title: Flexfields for Serial Attributes

serialNumbersDFF.description: The Flexfields for Serial Numbers resource manages the details of serial numbers and is associated to a transaction line whose item is serial controlled and not lot controlled.
serialNumbersDFF.title: Flexfields for Serial Numbers

__FLEX_Context.description: Descriptive flexfield context name for serial attributes. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: Descriptive flexfield context display value for serial attributes. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

__FLEX_Context.description: Descriptive flexfield context name for serials. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: Descriptive flexfield context display value for serials. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

AsyncTrackerId.description: Attribute provided for the exclusive use by the Attachment UI components to assist in uploading files.
AsyncTrackerId.title: Asynchronous Upload Tracker Id

AttachedDocumentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the attachment of a shipment line. It is a primary key that the application generates when a document is attached to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
AttachedDocumentId.title: Attached Document Id

CategoryName.description: Category of the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
CategoryName.title: Category

ContentRepositoryFileShared.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, then the attachment is shared. If false, then the attachment is not shared. The default value is true.
ContentRepositoryFileShared.title: Shared

CreatedBy.description: User who created the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
CreatedBy.title: Created By

CreatedByUserName.description: Login that the user used when creating the attachment for the specification.
CreatedByUserName.title: Created By User Name

CreationDate.description: Date when the user created the attachment record for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
CreationDate.title: Creation Date

DatatypeCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the data type.
DatatypeCode.title: Type

Description.description: Description of the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
Description.title: Description

DmDocumentId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the content server document.

DmVersionNumber.description: Number that identifies a particular version of the content server document.

ErrorStatusCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the error code, if any, for the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
ErrorStatusCode.title: Error Status Code

ErrorStatusMessage.description: Error message, if any, for the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

ExpirationDate.description: Date when the contents in the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request expire.

FileContents.description: Contents of the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

FileName.description: File name of the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
FileName.title: File Name

FileUrl.description: URL (Uniform Resource Locator) of the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
FileUrl.title: File Url

FileWebImage.description: The base64 encoded image of the file displayed in .png format if the source is a convertible image.
FileWebImage.title: File Web Image

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time when the user most recently updated the document that is attached to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
LastUpdateDate.title: Last Update Date

LastUpdatedBy.description: Login of the user who updated the document that is attached to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
LastUpdatedBy.title: Last Updated By

LastUpdatedByUserName.description: Login that the user used when updating the attachment for the specification.
LastUpdatedByUserName.title: Last Updated By User

Title.description: Title of the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
Title.title: Title

UploadedFileContentType.description: Content type of the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
UploadedFileContentType.title: Uploaded File Content Type

UploadedFileLength.description: Length of the attachment file for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
UploadedFileLength.title: File Size

UploadedFileName.description: Name of the attachment file for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
UploadedFileName.title: Uploaded File Name

UploadedText.description: Text of the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
UploadedText.title: Uploaded Text

Uri.description: URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) that identifies the attachment.
Uri.title: Uri

Url.description: URL (Uniform Resource Locator) that locates the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
Url.title: Url

UserName.description: Login that the user used when adding or modifying the attachment for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.
UserName.title: User Name

__FLEX_Context.description: Descriptive flexfield context name for advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: Descriptive flexfield context display value for advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

CreatedBy.description: User who created the packing unit interface record of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

CreationDate.description: Date and time when the packing unit interface record of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request was created.

LPNId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the license plate number of the current license plate number hierarchy of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

LPNInterfaceId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the interfaced license plate number of the current license plate number hierarchy of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

LastUpdateDate.description: Date and time when the user most recently updated the packing unit interface record of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

LastUpdateLogin.description: Login of the user who updated the packing unit interface record of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

LastUpdatedBy.description: User who last updated the packing unit interface record of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

LicensePlateNumber.description: License plate number of the current license plate number hierarchy of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

ParentLPNId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the parent license plate number of the current license plate number hierarchy of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

ParentLicensePlateNumber.description: Parent license plate number of the current license plate number hierarchy of the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request.

InterfaceTransactionId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the transaction. This attribute is not currently used.

__FLEX_Context.description: Descriptive flexfield context name for inventory striping attributes. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

__FLEX_Context_DisplayValue.description: Descriptive flexfield context display value for inventory striping attributes. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

countryOfOriginCode.description: Abbreviation that identifies the country of manufacture for this item. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

countryOfOriginCode_Display.description: Name of the country of manufacture. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

projectId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the project. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

projectId_Display.description: Number that identifies the project. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

taskId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the task. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

taskId_Display.description: Number that identifies the task. This attribute is associated with a feature that requires opt in.

HoldDate.description: Date when the warehouse applied a hold on the lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

LotExpirationDate.description: Date when the item of the lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

LotNumber.description: Number that identifies the lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

MaturityDate.description: Date when the lot matures. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

OriginationDate.description: Date when the lot originated corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

OriginationType.description: Type of origination for the lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

ParentLotNumber.description: Number that identifies the parent lot of the lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

PrimaryQuantity.description: Transaction quantity for the lot in the primary unit of measure that the item uses. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

ReasonId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the reason for the receiving transaction. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

ReasonName.description: Name of the reason for the receiving transaction for the lot. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

SecondaryTransactionQuantity.description: Transaction quantity for the lot in the secondary unit of measure that the item uses. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

TransactionQuantity.description: Transaction quantity of the item for the lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request expires. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

VendorLotNumber.description: Number that identifies the supplier lot for the lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot control.

lotNumbersDFF.description: The Flexfields for Lot Numbers resource manages the details of the lot numbers that the descriptive flexfield references and is associated with a line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.

HoldDate.description: Date when the warehouse applied a hold on the lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

LotExpirationDate.description: Date when the item of this lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request expires. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

LotNumber.description: Number that identifies the lot for the item corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

MaturityDate.description: Date when the lot matures for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

OriginationDate.description: Date when this lot originated for the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

OriginationType.description: Type of origination for the lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

ParentLotNumber.description: Number that identifies the parent lot of the lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

ReasonName.description: Name of the reason for the receiving transaction for the lot. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

VendorLotNumber.description: Number that identifies the supplier lot for the lot corresponding to the advanced shipment notice (ASN) line request or receipt line request. This attribute is applicable when the warehouse places the item under lot and serial control.

lotAttributesDFF.description: The Flexfields for Lot Attributes resource manages the details of the lot attributes that the descriptive flexfield references and is associated with a line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.

lotNumbersDFF.description: The Flexfields for Lot Numbers resource manages the details of the lot numbers that the descriptive flexfield references and is associated with a line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.

lotSerialItemSerials.description: The Serials for Lot and Serial Items resource manages the serial number information associated with a specific lot for a line whose item is both lot and serial controlled.
lotSerialItemSerials.title: Serials for Lot and Serial Items

BatchId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the batch into which the interface records are grouped for processing.

ColumnName.description: Name of the column for the attribute value that resulted in error during processing.

ErrorMessage.description: Text of the error message, if any, after the processing the records.

ErrorMessageName.description: Name of the error message, is any, after processing the records.

ErrorType.description:
Type of the error, if any, after processing the records.
Valid values include ERROR or WARNING.

InterfaceErrorId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the receiving interface error record.

InterfaceHeaderId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the header request that corresponds to the current receiving interface error record.

InterfaceLineId.description: Value that uniquely identifies the line request that corresponds to the current receiving interface error record.

expand.name: expand
expand.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

fields.name: fields
fields.description:
This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2

onlyData.name: onlyData
onlyData.description: The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

links.name: links
links.description:
This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

limit.name: limit
limit.description: This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.

totalResults.name: totalResults
totalResults.description: The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

q.name: q
q.description:
This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

orderBy.name: orderBy
orderBy.description: This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

standardLookupsLOV-finder.name: finder
standardLookupsLOV-finder.description:
Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • LookupTypeAllRowsFinder
    Finder Variables:
    • LookupCode
    • LookupType
  • LookupTypeFinder
    Finder Variables:
    • ActiveDate
    • LookupCode
    • LookupType
  • PrimaryKey
    Finder Variables:
    • LookupCode
    • LookupType

REST-Framework-Version.name: REST-Framework-Version
REST-Framework-Version.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

Metadata-Context.name: Metadata-Context
Metadata-Context.description: If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".
